loans.name: Nasreen Group

texts.en: Nasreen is 31 years old. She is a responsible mother of two children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband is a government employee, and both of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children, and they are facing many hurdles in life. Nasreen is helping her husband by selling clothing in her house; she has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of loan is to buy a variety of clothes at a cheaper rate and then sell them for a profit. In the future she is looking forward to opening a small boutique in the market. She would save some money from the profit and pay the educational expenses of her children. She has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support. NOTE: In the picture Nasreen is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothes

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais is a 37-year-old man who is married with one daughter. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives in an IDP Settlement with his family in Bilasuvar. He breeds cows and cattle, and he sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Mais has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle. He receives 80 AZN in financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Mais usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months, then resells them at a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat sales bring 130 AZN income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in such everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and also present in everyday life.   

The above is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved daughter. Mais applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase three cattle and one milk cow. He has already completed several loans and proven himself as a good client.

loans.use: to buy three cattle and one milk cow

loans.name: Marysali

texts.en: Marysali is married and lives in a rental house. She has been sewing clothes for more than 2 years and has gained much experience and recognition for her work thanks to her dedication and to the good service she provides. She will use the loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic for her work. Thanks to this line of work, she’s been able to get ahead and help her family members cover expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and elastic.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is a 46-year-old woman, married with two children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. She is a very hardworking and kind woman. She is cattle breeder and breeds cows and cattle for milk and meat purposes. She has 15 years of experience in this field which makes her an experienced farmer with deep knowledge of the market and customer’s needs.
She makes home-made yoghurt and sells it, as well as fresh milk, to the neighbors and local vendors. She also raises cattle for meat purpose and sells to the butchers in the settlement. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Her monthly income is 140 AZN. Her husband also works, however his income as a workman is too low to cover the family’s needs.
To increase her income and improve their financial situation she applied for a 1500 AZN loan. She is going to buy three cows. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимиру  28 лет .Он  женат и имеет сына и дочь . Жена Владимира домохозяйка и  воспитывает малышей. Владимир живет с семьей и родителями в городе Капан. Отец Владимира почти как 30 лет занимается ремонтом автомобилей в своем гараже.
 С 2008 года  Владимир и его отец открыли их частное дело по ремонту автомобилей. Они имеют постоянных клиентов в городе Капан. У Владимира тяжелая но прибыльная работа, которая позволяет ему достойно содержать семью.  
Владимиру нужен кредит на сумму 800,000 Арм. драмм для покупки авто-запчастей и инструментов для эго авторемонтной деятельности  .
texts.en:
Vladimir is 28 years old. He is married and has a son and daughter. Vladimir's wife is a homemaker and takes care of the little ones. Vladimir lives with his family and parents in the town of Kapan. For almost 30 years, Vladimir's father has been involved in auto repairs in his own garage. 

In 2008, Vladimir and his father opened their own private premises for auto repairs. They have regular customers in Kapan. Vladimir has a hard but lucrative job that allows him to support his family. 

Vladimir needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy auto parts and tools for his auto repair activities.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts and tools for his vehicle repair activities

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is 46 years old, married, and has three daughters. He has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 12 years. During these years he gained the necessary skills and knowledge for effective management of his business. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. He also makes homemade yoghurt and sells it, together with fresh milk, to neighbors. His monthly income is 130 AZN. This business is the only source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes, like pilau and dolma.

Now Salim would like to buy more animals. For this purpose  he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. He will buy three calves and one milking cow. This will be his second loan with AqroInvest, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three calves and one milking cow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, who appears in the picture, is a 22-year-old, single man. He is employed and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs. Ahmad is requesting a USD loan from FATEN, which he will use to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahmad to enhance his skills in using computers and to do his reports at home. This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед житель города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 километрах к востоку от столицы Таджикистана. Ему 32 года. У него есть жена, сын и две дочери. Хуршед занимается торговым бизнесом. У него есть собственный магазин, где он продает продукты питания, в том числе: печенье, сладости, шоколад, консервированные продукты, растительное масло, майонез, детское питание и т.д. Хуршед работает в области торговли в течение 5 лет. Он привозит свой товар в месяц 4 раза с города Душанбе. В бизнесе ему конечно помогает семья. Сейчас Хуршед запрашивает кредит для закупа продуктов питания в свой магазин с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Khurshed is an inhabitant of the town of Vakhdat, located 20 kilometers to the west of the capital of Tajikistan. He is 32 years old. He has a wife, son and two daughters. 

Khurshed is engaged in the trade business. He has his own store, where he sells food products, including cookies, sweets, chocolate, canned food, cooking oil, mayonnaise, baby food, etc. Khurshed has been working in trade for five years. He brings his goods four times per month to Dushanbe. His family always helps him in his business.

Now, Khurshed is requesting a loan to buy food products for his store with the goal of expanding inventory.

loans.use: to buy food products for his store

loans.name: Ganjali

texts.en:
Ganjali is a 29-year-old man. He is an Internally Displaced Person ("IDP"), who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two sons. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past eight years. During these years Ganjali gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business, because it is profitable; fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan, and people also use them to make fresh punch. Ganjali usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 130 AZN.

As his products are in high demand, Ganjali wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables, to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonio Maria

texts.es:
Don Antonio tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y convive con su familia en el municipio de la Masica, San juan Pueblo.
Don Antonio hace 6 años inicio un negocio el cual consiste en la venta de mariscos(pescado y camarones), lo establecio con la necesidad de tener un ingreso en el cual solventar los gastos familiares. comenta que las ventas de estos productos son buenas y rentables, las ganancias que obtiene, las trabaja invirtiendo en producto.El ha realizado varios creditos con Odef que le han ayudado mucho a mantener activo su negocio. En la actualidad solicita otro de 10,000 lempiras para compra de mariscos (pescado) y aprovechar la temporada de Semana Santa, esta inversion le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos. La meta es seguir trabajando paa dar a su familia bienestar economico.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old. He is married and has three children. He lives with his family in San Juan Pueblo in the municipality of La Masica.

Six years ago Antonio started a business selling seafood (fish and shrimp). He started this business out of the need to have a source of income with which to pay household expenses. These products sell well and are profitable. He invests his earnings into the purchase of more products.

He has had several loans with Odef which have helped keep him in business. He is currently requesting another 10,000 Honduran Lempiras to buy seafood (fish) and to make the most of the season around Holy Week. This investment will help increase his earnings. 

The goal is to continue working to provide his family with economic well-being.

loans.use: to buy seafood (fish) to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children and runs a food cafe. The business has been in operation for six months. 

Jumwa was introduced to Milango by her friends. She is asking for a loan of 15,900 Kenyan shillings. She will use it to buy food ingredients to use at her cafe, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil, and cereals.

A business challenge Jumwa faces is the high level of bad debts by her customers. Despite this problem, Jumwa believes she will have extra income earned with the loan. She will use her income to save for the education of her children, to provide a means of income to her employees, and eventually to open a larger cafe.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to use at her cafe, like sugar, baking flour, frying oil, and cereals.

loans.name: Vyacheslav

texts.ru:
Вячеслав  - фермер. С 2008 года занимается выращиванием помидор, перца, лука и арбуза.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и  19-ти летний сын. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания лука в открытом грунте.
Вячеслав решил приобрести пленку для защиты помидоров от холода и ветра.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  приобрести трактор с навесным оборудованием для вспашки и обработки  своего земельного участка.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки.
texts.en:
Vyacheslav is a farmer. Since 2008, he has been involved in growing tomatoes, peppers, onions, and melons. 

He manages the farm with the help of his wife and 19-year-old son. 
Development of the activities began with growing onions in an open field. 

Vyacheslav decided to buy plastic film to protect the tomatoes from the cold and winder.

Plans for the Future: to buy a tractor with accessories for plowing and preparation of his land.
Personal Plans:  to finish building his home.

He needs help with financing the plastic film.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория  -  фермер. С 2010 года занимается выращиванием винограда.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и 22-х летняя дочь. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания клубники а открытом грунте.
Виктория с мужем решила  приобрести мотоблок для вспашки и культивации своего земельного участка, т.к осуществлять вручную вспашку очень тяжело.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  посадить новые сорта винограда, ежевики, а также приобрести минитрактор.
В личных планах: достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока.
texts.en:
Victoria is a farmer. Since 2010, she has been growing wine grapes.

Her husband and 22-year-old daughter help her to manage the farm. Development activities began with growing strawberries in an open field. 

Victoria and her husband decided to buy a push tractor for plowing and cultivating their land, since manual plowing is very difficult. 

Future Plans: to plant new varieties of grapes, blackberries, and to buy a mini-tractor. 
Personal Plans: to finish a house.

She needs help to fund the push tractor.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment

loans.name: Redempta

texts.en:
Redempta comes from the town of Kisauni. She says she runs a small and well-furnished store in her neighborhood. She has three children, all of whom attend school, and whom she has succeed in educating thanks to her business.
 
She has been running her small store for several years. She has established customers, and she is really well-known thanks to the variety of products she offers to her customers. She wants to keep on investing in her activity. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, canned foods, bulk items, and other merchandise, in order to continue offering her customers a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned food, bulk items, and other merchandise to sell in her store

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий - фермер. С 1997 года занимается выращиванием малины, клубники, помидор, арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания свеклы и моркови в открытом грунте.
Дмитрий  решил приобрести пленку и агроволокно для защиты от ветра клубники и помидор.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  посадить виноградник.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и агроволокна.
texts.en:
Dmitriy is a farmer. Since 1997, he has been growing raspberries, strawberries, tomatoes, watermelon, and cantaloupe. His wife helps him to manage the farm. Development activities began with growing beets and carrots in an open field. Dmitriy decided to purchase film and ground cover for protecting strawberries and tomatoes against wind.

Future Plans: to plant a vineyard.
Personal Plans: to finish building a home. 

He needs help to finance the film and ground cover.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Amazonas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Bertha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carteras, tienda de barrio, venta de carne, impresión cerigráfica, taller de carpintería, tienda de venta de carne, venta de ropa de bebe, taller de reparación de frenos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Bertha da a conocer que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de venta de pasteles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por el concejo de sus profesores y sus amigas, iniciando con un pequeño capital que en la actualidad creció por los préstamos obtenidos en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en cercanías de los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amazonas” will be starting their fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the regional office in Senkata. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors with Bertha as the president. The members are engaged in various business activities such as hand bag sales, a neighborhood store, meat sales, screen printing, carpentry, a butcher shop, children’s clothing sales and a brake repair shop. 

The loan will benefit small businesses like Bertha’s.  She has been member of Pro Mujer for 2 years and was invited by a friend of hers who is a member. She currently sells pastries and she says that she started this business several years ago on the advice of her teachers and friends. She started with a small amount of capital which has now grown because of the loans through Pro Mujer.

With this new loan she will increase her capital and purchase flour from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell her pastries in the neighborhoods around schools. This work will allow her to generate income to maintain her household as much as possible as she lives with her partner and their four children.

When asked what she likes most about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the meetings about credit and health.

loans.use: purchase flour.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is 54 years old, married, and has four children. He is an Internally Displaced Person ("IDP") and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cattle and sells milk and milk products, and sells cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Nariman has more than eight years of experience in this field, thanks to his father, who taught him the best ways to look after cattle. 

Nariman usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat-selling brings an income of 140 AZN per month.

Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life. 
  
This is the only financial income in his family, and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Therefore, Nariman applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN, which he will use to purchase three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder. This will be his third loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three beef cattle, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of maize flour and soft drinks, and also to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline est une femme de 51 ans , mariée et mère 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 19 et 32 ans. l'un d'eux va encore à l'école.Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 51 years old. She is married and is the mother of three children who are between 19 and 32 years old. One of her children is still in school. 

She opened a grocery in an area of the capital, which she has run for 2 years. Her small business works due to the warm welcome she gives customers, her experience in her field, and the clientele she has built over time. 

This last part is becoming important because she no longer can meet the needs of her customers. Due to her small amount of capital, she has to buy at retail prices. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her business in order to diversify her goods (rice, salt, mineral water, sugar, candy...) and increase her profit margins. 

She will reinvest a part of her profits in her business to cover its needs.  The other part will allow her to meet her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to bolster her supply of goods.

loans.name: Yasaman

texts.en:
Yasaman is a 47-year-old woman, married with three children.  She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is very hardworking and kind woman. 

She breeds cows and cattle for milk and meat purposes. She has ten years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced farmer with deep knowledge of the market and the customer's needs.

Yasaman makes and sells home-made yogurt, as well as fresh milk, to neighbors and local vendors. She also raises cattle for meat purposes, and sells it to the butchers in the settlement. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Her monthly income is 110 AZN. Her husband is also working, however, his income is too low to cover the family's needs.

To increase her income and improve her financial situation, Yasaman applied for a 2000 AZN loan. She is going to buy four cattle and one milk cow. This will be her fifth loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy four cattle and one milk cow.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is a 49-year-old mother from Kisumu city; she is married to Clement, and has two children who are 24 and 26.

She has been in the tailoring business for the past 12 years, and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 14,000.  She is applying for her fifth loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase clothing material and repair some of her sewing machines. 

She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and boost her business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material and repair her sewing machines.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan, age 22, studies at State Engineering University of Armenia. Together with his studies, he works at a local computer store, as a seller. Vardan lives with his parents and sister and, jointly with them, works hard to sustain their family.

Unfortunately, Vardan's salary is hardly enough for covering daily costs, and it is very difficult for him to save money for education. So Vardan has applied for this loan, which he will use to pay his university tuition. This is very important for Vardan, to be able to get a higher education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay his tuition at the Engineering University

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 35 years old and is a single man, as he has yet to get married. He is a farmer.

Elias has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to enable him buy a cow. He is optimistic that his business will do better, after the loan. 

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is married and has four children. Two are adults and working, while two still attend school. Halima has had a home-based grocery store for about seven years. Aside from the usual grocery items, she also has a vegetable stall that generates extra income, especially on the weekend. She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles, at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour and noodles, at wholesale.

loans.name: Ingrid Geoconda

texts.es:
La clienta Ingrid vive en Orquídeas, ella tiene 43 años de edad. Ella empezó con la idea de su mama, ella les entregaba comida a unos amigos que laboraban en una empresa, y así comenzó con su propio negocio. 

Ella trabaja en un restaurante junto a su mama, una señora de edad ella le ayuda por la mañana y por la noche trabaja ella sola. Ella no a tenido ninguna dificultad en su trabajo gracias a Dios.

Ella no tiene esposo, no tiene hijos .Ella usara el préstamo para comprar inmuebles para su restaurante como: sillas,, mesas, y víveres. 

Su sueño es que Dios mantenga a su madre con vida, que siga con ella y que su negocio siga creciendo, y tener un lugar propio para establecerse.
texts.en:
Ingrid, age 43, lives in Orquídeas.  She started with her mother’s idea.  She delivered food to some friends who worked at a company.  That is how she started with her own business.

She works in a restaurant together with her mother, an elderly woman who helps her in the mornings.  In the evening she works alone.  She has not had any difficulty in her work, thank God.

She does not have a husband, nor does she have any children.

She will use the loan to buy things like tables, chairs, and supplies for her restaurant.

Her dream is for God to continue giving her mother life, that she stays with her, that her business continues growing, and to have her own place in order to establish herself.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 22-year-old, single man. He is employed and gets a low salary, which is barely enough to cover all his needs.

Hussam wants to improve his skills in using computer applications, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. He will use it to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. Taking this loan will help Ahmad to get a new laptop and enhance his skills in using computer and internet applications.

Hussam appears in the picture, inside the store from where he purchased the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 34 years old, is married, and lives in Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. Theresa has four children, 5 to 14 years old, who are in school.

Theresa runs a table in the community market, where she sells slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks. She works at her business for nine hours daily. She gets her goods from the capital city of Liberia, by riding a bus to go and come back. She enjoys her business, because it makes her busy. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks, to resell at her business table. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, hair oil, water, and soft drinks, to resell at her business table in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sugar, flour, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 44 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his 28-year-old wife, Lusiana. Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Tamaz’s wife, Lusiana, is working at the local shop as a seller, and she earns a small daily income. This is the only source of income for the family now.

Recently, Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase a car to drive as a taxi. He had a car before, but after an accident it was totally damaged, and he had to stop working. With the new car, he will continue his work and earn additional daily income for the family. With the increased income, Tamaz and his wife will be able to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car, to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Liliana Nicolasa

texts.es:
La Clienta Liliana vive en Quevedo, tiene 26 años de edad. Su papa también vendía CD pero en los transportes, cuando ella creció se puso un stand pequeño en una mesa de madera con unos cuantos CD, pero luego con un  crédito bancario logra tener su negocio propio y ahora tiene un gran negocio.

Ella realiza la venta de CD  sola, todos los días de la semana. A tenido inconvenientes en su negocio por medio de los ladrones. No está casada, no tiene hijos.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar CD para ponerlos a la venta en su negocio. Ella desea más adelante tener su casa propia y dejar de arrendar porque esto se le lleva mucho dinero.
texts.en:
Liliana, age 26, lives in Quevedo.  Her father also sold CDs, but he sold them on vehicles providing transportation.

When she grew up she set up a small stand on a wooden table with some CDs.  However, after that, with a loan, she managed to have her own business.  She now has a great business.

She sells CDs alone every day of the week.  She has had some obstacles in her business because of thieves.

She is not married, nor does she have any children.

She will use the loan to buy CDs in order to sell them at her place of business.  

Later she wishes to have her own house.  She wishes to stop renting because this takes a lot of money.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and movies.

loans.name: Antony Muturi

texts.en:
Antony is 26 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married and has one child, who is in school. Antony has a second-hand clothing business that he has been running for the past one year.

He has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd. He will use the loan to buy more clothes, to add to his stock to be sold.

He hopes to be able to open up a supermarket, in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to add to his inventory

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Don Luis de 30 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maiz y maicillo, es un hombre responsable y trabajador con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus cultivos logra cubrir los gatos de su hogar, él solicita un credito para comprar mas insumos agricolas: semillas abonos, entre otros productos que el necesita para su siembra y asi poder llevar lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 30-years-old and lives with his wife in his own home. He works in agriculture in the cultivation of corn and gamagrass. He is a responsible and hard workingman with the desire to cover the costs of his home through the sale of his crops. He is requesting a loan to purchase more agricultural supplies: seeds, fertilizer, and other products that he needs to harvest. This way he will be able to provide the necessities for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Knowe Favour Group

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Lemmy from Harare. He is single, but looks after his two brothers and one sister. Lemmy is in the poultry business, selling chickens. The business has been in operation for 5 years. He says the main challenges that he faces are that normally the chicks are affected with bird flu and weather. Also, if the chicks are not properly bred, they die. Lemmy has requested a loan of $500 to purchase more chicks and stock feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable him to send his brothers and sister to school and college. In the future, Lemmy plans to have a butchery in Norton.

loans.use: to buy feed and chicks.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
Julia Mercedes de 34 años de edad, casada con tres hijos menores de edad. De 4, 8,12,  es originaria de  León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus pequeños hijos. Preparándoles uno de los platillo típicos de la localidad como es la ‘ sopa de leche” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante Julia tiene por actividad económica servicio de costura y venta de ropa elaborada por ella misma. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, y dedica unas 8 horas diarias a su actividad  como es la elaboración de prendas de vestir como camisas, faldas,  short, ropa de cama, uniformes de colegios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de materia prima como tela, forros, esponjas, encajes, hijos, aceite de máquinas, agujas, cintas de mantequillas, zíper; para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Julia Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes is 34 years old. She is married with three young children. They are 4, 8 and 12 years old. She is originally from Leon, which is located in the west area of the country.  In her free time she likes to enjoy quality time with her small children by preparing them a typical dish of the area such as “sopa de leche” (milk soup). 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial means, she was not able to study a university career. She felt obligated to work from a young age.  Currently she works hard everyday to give her family a better future. 

Thanks to her sprit and her drive to get ahead, Julia she has a sewing business and she sells clothing that she creates.  The business is located in her home and she works 8 hours a day in this activity such as creation of clothing such as shirts, skirts, shorts, sleepwear, and school uniforms. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in capital for work and supply the business with the purchase of materials such as fabric, linings, sponges, laces, thread, oil for the machine, needles, measuring tape, and zippers. She needs these items so that in the near future she could have better income. Julia Mercedes is grateful for the help that the investors in Kiva provide the people of scanty resources  and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a better means of honest work.

loans.use: to invest capital in the business for materials including fabric, linings, sponges, laces, thread, oil for the machine, needles, measuring tape, and zippers to make clothing

loans.name: José Abel

texts.es: Don José Abel es un señor con mucha experiencia en la producción de café. necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para poder aumentar la producción de café. Para él este préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: José Abel is a senior with a lot of experience in the production of coffee. He needs a loan of 1 million colones to purchase manure and fertilizer to increase his production of coffee. For him this loan will help him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Melvil Eliseo

texts.es: Melvil se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace 15 años y ha logrado salir adelante junto con su famila ya que las ventas de sus cosechas le ha dejado ganacias para cubrir todos sus gastos, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Don Melvil solicita un credito para poder comprar mas semillas, fetilizantes, abonos y todo lo necesario para el cultivo y asi obtener mejores ganacias que le ayuden a solventar los gatos de su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Melvil has worked harvesting corn and beans for the last 15 years. He has been able to get ahead with his family since the sales of his crops have generated income that cover his expenses. He lives with his wife and his two children in their own home. 

Melvil is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds, fertilizer, manure, and all the necessities to harvest. This way he will be able to obtain better earnings that will help him to cover the costs of his home and give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new electrical installation for his home

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Víctor tiene 53 años de edad, está casado y es padre de 5 hijos, vive en una aldea de Esparta Atlántida, San Juan Pueblo.
Don Víctor  hace muchos años que  desarrolla sus habilidades en artesanías en madera. El ha recibido capacitación con una asociación Francesa quienes le han apoyado en la promoción y mercadeo de productos.
El tiene su propio taller de artesanías en madera como ser tallados, lápices, lapiceros, carritos, fruteros, llaveros etc., también  elabora muebles artesanos para sala, comedor, divisiones y otros con madera y mimbre. Este negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios y lo ha mantenido con los préstamos solicitados a ODEF, con los cuales ha podido hacer crecer el negocio y aumentar su clientela.
Actualmente solicita el doceavo  préstamos  que es por  25,000 Lempiras, para comprar madera y accesorios que utiliza en la elaboración de las plumas.
Su meta es tener más variedad de productos para atraer más clientes y también lograr exportar estos productos  que hace, para promocionarse e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Víctor is 53 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. He lives in the town of Esparta Atlántida, San Juan Pueblo.

For many years, Víctor has been using his abilities making artisanal wood crafts. He received training from a French association who helped him with selling and marketing his products.  He has his own woodworking workshop where he makes carvings, pencil holders, carts, fruit bowls, key chains, etc.  
He also makes artisanal furniture for living rooms, dining rooms, bedrooms and more out of wood and wicker. He started this business with his own money and has maintained it with loans from ODEF, with which he has been able to grow his business and increase his clientele.

Right now, he is asking for his twelfth loan, which is for 25,000 Lempiras, to buy wood and accessories he will use to make fountain pens. his goal is to have a wider variety of products to attract more customers and also export the products he makes to sell more an increase his income.

loans.use: to buy wood and accessories to make fountain pens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fence the nursery school compound

loans.name: Tagarika Group

texts.en:
Mornica, age 42, is from Harare. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She also takes care of two additional dependents. Mornica is engaged in buying and selling of packaging materials for agricultural produce, such as potatoes, oranges and tomatoes. She imports from neighbouring countries. Her business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges she faces are import duties, and change of seasons for her products.

Mornica has requested a loan of $500, which she will use to buy more packaging to resell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and improve the quality of life for her children. In future, Mornica wishes to be one of the big providers of packaging materials in town.

loans.use: to buy more packaging for agricultural produce, to resell to her customers

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa Fernanda , nació el día 20 de agosto de 1990. Su madre se llama María y su padre Luis. A la edad de 7 meses, sus padres se separan y su madre toma la decisión de mudarse, donde vive la familia materna (abuela y tíos), allí curso los estudios de educación básica primaria y secundaria en la Institución Educativa María Auxiliadora, en el año 2008 recibe el título de Bachiller Académico.
En el año 2009 por causa de traslado de sitio de trabajo del padrastro y con el ánimo de estudiar en la Universidad, nuevamente se mudan a esta ciudad, Donde inicia estudios de Medicina en la Fundación Universitaria San Martin, y simultáneamente hace curso de Ingles en Academia de idiomas Passport, que se ven interrumpidos debido a su embarazo. 
El día 11 de abril ingresa a la clínica Federman en trabajo de parto de su hija Zaray, quien en la actualidad tiene dos años de vida y asiste al Jardín Infantil Luz Del Mañana.
Por diversos motivos que no cabe mencionar no convive con el padre de Zaray;  pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para dar todo el amor y educación a su hija, de quien se siente muy orgullosa y da la vida por ella.
Le encanta la rama de la salud, en una de sus metas es llegar a ser médico, pero por tiempo y dinero esta meta se aplaza temporalmente sin dejar de darle prioridad. Por gusto al sector de la salud estudia auxiliar en enfermería en la Institución  CampoAlto; donde demuestra que la ayuda, atención y cuidado de los prójimos es su pasión.
En la actualidad sueña con ser una muy buena enfermera, dar un buen ejemplo a su hija, seguir valorando a su madre y su abuelita,… Se siente muy agradecida con Dios por contar con la educación y valores que le inculco su madre, que la llevaron a ser como es hoy una buena persona, de muy buenos sentimientos  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Quiere trabajar y ahorrar para comprarle una casa a su princesa como llama a su hija y a su mama, darles lo que necesitan y no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Luisa Fernanda was born August 20th of 1990. Her mother's name is María and her father is Luis. When she was 7 months old, her parents separated and her mother decided to move to where her mother's family lives (grandmothers and aunts and uncles). She went to primary and secondary school there at  Institución Educativa María Auxiliadora. In 2008, she received her high school degree.

In 2009, because her step father had to move for work and because she wanted to go to college, they moved to this city again, where she began to study  medicine at the Fundación Universitaria San Martin. At the same time, she studied English at the Passport Language Academy, all of which was interrupted by her pregnancy. 

On April 11, she entered the Federman to give birth to her daughter Zaray. Now she is two years old and goes to the Luz Del Mañana day care. For reasons not to be mentioned here, she does not live with Zaray's father. This has not been an obstacle to giving all of the love and education she can to her daughter, of whom she is very proud and for whom she gives her life. 

She lives the area of health. One of her goals is to be a doctor but for reasons of time and money, this goal is being postponed temporarily, while still being a priority. Because she likes working in health she is studying to be a nurse's assistant at the Institución CampoAlto. there she has shown that help, attention and care for others is her passion. 

Right now, she dreams of being a good nurse, being a good example to her daughter and continuing to value her mother and her grandmother. She is very grateful to God for having education and values that her mother gave her, which made her the good person that she is today, honorable and eager to get ahead.

loans.use: to finish her degree in assistant nursing with Campoalto

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Elizabeth from Harare. She is a divorcee with one child who is attending school. Elizabeth runs a flea market business selling shoes, blankets, ladies clothes and accesories. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are the limits on quantities of goods at the border post and competition with other sellers. 

Elizabeth has requested a loan of $500 to buy dresses and blankets for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future, Elizabeth plans to have her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase products for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace from Nakuru is 58 years old. She is married with five children who are aged between 30 and 22 years old.

Grace has a farming business which she has been doing for many years. She has applied for this second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be able to buy another dairy cow in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ruth Damaris

texts.es: Doña Ruth vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo tiene 5 años de tener una minitienda dentro de una escuela cerca de su lugar de residencia vende los 5 dias de la semana, es una persons responsable y trabajadora con las ganacias que le quedan de sus ventas ayuda a su esposo a los gastos de su hogar. Ruth solicita un credito para poder surtir su minitienda con golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y galletas ya que en la escuela donde esta tiene mucha demanda y asi obtener mejores ganacias para ayudar en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth lives in her own home with her child and husband. For 5 years, she has had a small store inside a school near the place where she lives. She is open 5 days a week, and she is a responsible and hardworking person. With the income from her sales, she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to stock her store with candy, soft drinks, toys, and cookies, because there’s a lot of demand in the school where she is located, and therefore she can obtain better earnings in order to help out in her home.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy dried vegetables, beans, and groundnuts for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a mother and a resident of Kitale, in Western Kenya.  She lives with her family of two children, ages 2 and 11 years old.  She has been in the farming business for seven years and runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.  Her farm produces maize horticultural products and poultry.  In addition to farming, she also runs a salon business.  

Hellen has requested a loan of 62,400 KES in order to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She hopes to expand her farm and have at least five dairy cows in the future.  She reiterates that the additional dairy cow will improve her farming income through improved milk sales.

She points out animal disease and the high cost of feed as her major challenges.  She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells clothing for women and children, such as blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts, and sweatshirts.  Little by little she began increasing her sales since she goes out herself to offer products in the zone.

One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center.  She is asking for a loan to purchase more women and men’s clothing.  This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.fr: Jean Baptiste est un homme de 40 ans , marié et père 3 enfants . deux  vont encore à l'école.Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des friandises,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is a 40-year-old man, married and father of three children, two of whom are still in school.

He opened a grocery store in one of the capital's neighborhoods and has already been managing it for two years. His small store is successful thanks to his warm welcome, his experience in the business and the customer base he acquired over time.

The latter is increasing in size; he is no longer able to satisfy customer demand and his limited funds force him to buy retail.

He is requesting this loan to bolster his small business, to diversify its goods (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, candy, ...), and to increase his profit margin.

He will reinvest a portion of his earnings in the business to cover the needs of his activity, and the remainder will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: Increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Achuapa Un Pequeño Pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la joven Alba Luz de 63 años de edad.

Alba Luz es una madre soltera, trabaja brindando servicio a los ciudadanos que habitan en el municipio, dicho negocio consiste en procesar el maíz con en masa con un molino para luego poder elaborar las tortillas para la venta,  cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo, a duras penas ella mantiene su hogar, pero también ve de gran Necesidad, mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita un financiamiento a Kiva Y Ceprodel para la compra de: Cemento, ladrillo y Arena, con esto cubriría parte de su necesidades. 

Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad y su buen record crediticio que le han ido mejorando las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Achuapa is a small town where there are various economic activities. This is where the young Alba Luz, 63 years old, lives.

Alba Luz is a single mother, providing services to the citizens of her town through her business of grinding corn that she can later make into tortillas to sell. She has a son in her care, and works hard to maintain her household. She sees a great need to improve her house, which is why she asks Kiva and Ceprodel for a loan to buy cement, brick and sand. This will cover part of her needs.

She has good health, honesty and a good credit record which has improved the stat of her business.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sandra del Socorro de 45 años de edad, casada, con hijos mayores de edad  e independiente económicamente. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal, la cual ha tenido que luchar muy duro en la vida  para poder sobrevivir a pesar de las muchas adversidades. 

Gracias a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de CD Y DVD regrabables. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace 8 años en un lugar específico de su localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio aproximadamente unas 10 horas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de CD Y DVD que se lo están ofreciendo a precio especial para luego poder  comercializarlo. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Sandra agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro, 45, is married with grown children who are financially independent. She is originally from Leon, in the western part of the country. Sandra is hardworking, responsible and has a desire for personal growth. She has had to fight hard in life to survive in the face of many adversities. 

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she sells rewritable CDs and DVDs. She has been doing this for 8 years in her town. She spends around 10 hours on her business.

The goal of the loan is to invest in the purchase of CDs and DVDs that are at a special price in order to later sell them. This will give her more income in the near future. Sandra is grateful for the Kiva investors that give to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have honorable work.

loans.use: to buy rewritable CDs and DVDs for resale.

loans.name: Fatanamunda Group

texts.fr:
Victor  fait partie du groupe Fatanamunda et   habite à Makamba. Il a  47 ans et est marié à Nsengiyumva, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, âgés de  6 à 17 ans.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (savons, riz, haricot,…)   depuis 30 ans. 

Il  est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (savons, riz, haricot,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années,  il voudrait devenir un commerçant grossiste.
texts.en:
Victor is part of the Fatanamunda group and lives in Makamba. He is 47 years old and is married to Nsengiyumva, a farmer. Together they have five children, whose ages range from 6 to 17 years.

He has been managing a general store (soap, rice, beans, ...) for the past 30 years. This is his fourth credit loan with Turame.

With the KIVA loan he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy many items for his store (soap, rice, beans, ...), to resell and earn more.

In coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: it will increase its capital and buy many items from his shop (soap, rice, beans, ...) to sell to earn more.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.fr: Agnès est une femme de 43 ans  mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (plantains, bâton, bananes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 7 ans. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter en gros les régimes de plantains, bananes, et les sacs de batons pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnes is a 43-year-old mother. She is a retail merchant of fresh food (plantains, cassava sticks, bananas), depending on the season. She has been offering her goods at a local market for the past seven years.

She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of the customers she has acquired over time thanks to her business experience. However she finds herself constantly out of stock because she is forced to sell all of her stock before she can resupply, due to her limited funds.

She wants to buy wholesale plantains, bananas, and bags of cassava sticks to establish a good stock supply. This will enable her to better meet the continuing customer demand and avoid being out of stock.. She will save her profits not only to expand her business activity but also to provide for her family.

loans.use: increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Félix Arnulfo

texts.es:
El Sauce, es un Pequeño Pueblo con muchas características agroecológica, es aquí donde habita la joven Félix Arnulfo. 

Félix Arnulfo tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo, su esposa trabaja en una pequeña pulpería, con lo poco que ella gana ayuda en el sustento diario de su familia. 

Félix Arnulfo cuenta con su propia actividad donde consiste en una pequeña talabartería, labora albarda, monturas, cabezadas entre otros que ayuda de mucha importancia a la presentación de los caballos sauceños.  

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Baquetón, tiras de suelo, estribos, tejuelo, Acido, Nelina, Mecates y tules, esto será de gran importancia ya que podrá  elaborar más albardas que le será útil  para el crecimiento de su negocio  le permitirá permanecer estable y con buenos ingresos en su hogar.   

Agradece al gran Dios todo Poderoso, por haber conocido a Kiva y Ceprodel ya que son de sus sueños que estos le financien el crédito para poder vivir en mejores condiciones con en su vida.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a small town characterized by its agriculture and ecology; this is where Félix Arnulfo lives.

Félix Arnulfo has two children to care for; his wife works in a small grocery store. She helps with the family's daily expenses with the little bit that she earns.

Félix Arnulfo has his own business, which is a small leather workshop where he makes packsaddles, saddles, and halters, among other items that are important for showing horses in El Sauce.

For that reason, he applied for a loan to purchase tanned leather, cowhide strips, stirrups, saddle trees, acid, cords, and tulle. This purchase will be very important, because he will be able to make more saddles, which will be beneficial for the growth of his business. It will allow him to remain stable, with good income for his household.

He thanks the great and all-powerful lord that he learned of Kiva and Ceprodel, since it is a dream come true that they are financing the loan that will enable him to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tanned leather, strips of cowhide, stirrups, saddle trees, acid, cords and tulle.

loans.name: Jeanne Pulcherie

texts.fr: Pulcherie st une femme de 48 ans, mariée  mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 25 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (tomate, oignons, huile raffinée...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place quelques mois. elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de marchandises en achetant en gros pour pouvoir mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Pulcherie is a 48-year old woman, who is mother to eight children ranging from 12 to 25 years old. She is a trader and has for the past few months been selling on a retail basis various types of fresh food (tomatoes, onions, refined oil) depending on the season, in a local market. She knows her suppliers well and, more significantly, her customer base, which she has built up over time due to her experience in this field. However, she finds that she is constantly out of stock because she is obliged to totally run it down before getting new stock owing to her small amount of capital. She would like to increase her stock of goods by buying wholesale and thus be able to satisfy the constant customer demand and avoid running out of stock. She will save her profits not only to expand her business but also to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Donyor

texts.ru: Донеру 54 года. Он добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Донер женатый мужчина и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Дети совершеннолетние. Донер живет в сельской местности и занимается услугой тракториста. Он имеет свой трактор и комбайн. Он имеет своих клиентов, то есть частные фермеры используют его услуги тракториста во время сбора урожая. Особенно он собирает фасоль, пшеницу и другие зерновые культуры. Он хочет улучшить условию проживания, то есть купить современные технологии для своих детей и внуков. Он должен отремонтировать свой трактор и комбайн, так как скоро начнется сезон его работы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для ремонта трактора и комбайна. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход и таким образом поможет улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Donyor is 54 years old. He is a kind and hard-working person. He is married to a homemaker and has 4 grown children. He lives in a rural area where he works providing tractor services. He owns a tractor and a combine, and he has clients who pay for his services during harvest time. He mainly harvests beans, wheat, and other grains. He wants to improve his family's living standard, and in particular, to purchase modern technology for his children and grandchildren. He needs to fix his tractor and combine as his work season is going to begin very soon. Donyor is seeking a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to carry out these repairs. He is waiting for your kindness. This loan will help him to increase his income, which will in turn allow him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To repair his farm vehicles

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб честный и справедливый молодой человек. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школе в их городе. Дети несовершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе. Они дружно живут в большом доме, где имеется фруктовый сад и большой коровник, где он держит коровы. Более 12 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет 7 коровы, телята и одну лошадь. Он знает все тонкости своего дела и справляется с легкостью со своим бизнесом. Он покупает коровы, присматривает несколько месяцев и перепродает на местном рынке. Благодаря хорошему условию его коровы имеют большой спрос на местном рынке, и Сухроб имеет своих клиентов. Его жена помогает ему введения бизнеса. Он хочет развевать бизнес дальше и поэтому он должен увеличить количество скота. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Suhrob is an honest and fair-minded young man. He is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children who are in school. His wife is a teacher at the local high school. They live happily in a large house that has a fruit orchard and a big cattle shed where Suhrob keeps cows. For the last 12 years, he has been raising cattle. He now has 7 cows, calves, and 1 horse. He knows all the ins and outs of animal husbandry and is skilled at his business. He purchases livestock, takes care of them for several months, then sells them at the local market. Thanks to their good quality, there is a high demand for Suhrob's cows and he has built up his own clientele. His wife helps him to run the business. He now wants to develop his business further, and in order to do that, he needs to purchase more cattle. Suhrob is seeking a loan of 12,000 Tajikistan Somoni for that purpose. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to develop his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old from Naivasha and is married with three children who are all in school and between 13 and 5 years old.
Esther has a charcoal selling business that she has been doing for the past 3 years. She has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy more charcoal to add to her stock.
She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to add to her stock.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, having the picture inside his store.
Zainab is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.
For the past three years, Zainab's husband has been selling traditional jewelry such as necklaces and bracelets to customers and to other cosmetic stores. He has a good reputation among his customers, which makes his project a profitable one and a second source of income for the family.
Zainab is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing additional collections of traditional jewelry that has been requested by his customers. This will increase sales and improve the family's living conditions.

 
About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase traditional jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Don Mercedes tiene 51 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en San Juan Pueblo Atlantida.
Don Mercedes hace 13 años establecio un negocio de un taller de ebanisteria donde elabora muebles de cocina, puertas, cantramarcos, mesas, sillas etc. El dedica tiempo completo, comenta que tiene bastante demanda en los muebles. Con los financiamientos que ha recibido a logrado mantener su negocio activo, y ha logrado sacar el capital economico para solventar los gastos de la familia. Solicito su septimo prestamo de 13,000 lempiras y lo necesita para comprar madera para elaborar puertas para la venta, y cumplir con los encargos que le hacen falta entregar.
Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y expandirse en los alrededores.
texts.en:
Mr. Mercedes is 51 years old, married and has three children. He lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlántida. Thirteen years ago, Mr. Mercedes opened a workshop where he makes different woodworks: kitchen furniture, doors, counterframes, tables, chairs, etc. He works full time and says that his work is highly demanded. 

With the loans he has received, Mercedes has managed to keep his business going and to make enough to support his family. He requested his seventh loan of 13,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy wood to make doors and sell them, and to finish the orders he has not yet delivered. His goal is to expand his business and start selling in other regions.

loans.use: to buy wood to make doors and sell them.

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 24-year-old, young Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one child. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
Parwin learned to sew at a young age, and has 10 years sewing experience. For her small, home-based business she already completed a small loan in the past which she used to purchase a generator, an overlock sewing machine, and a table for the machine. Having successfully repaid the previous loan and still looking for ways to improve her business, she is now taking a new loan. This time she would like to buy an embroidery machine and also focus on improving her work conditions by renewing her work area's floors and walls.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and also improve her work conditions by renewing her work area's floors and walls.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products. She has worked in this business for more than 9 years and so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.
Her husband is a businessman and in this way they help each other to get ahead. Hellen is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.
She is requesting a loan to buy plants, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Ishkhanuhi

texts.en:
Ishkhanuhi is from the Sardarapat village in the Armavir region or Armenia. She is a mother of two children and works at local supermarket as a clerk. She works hard to earn a high enough income to sustain her children’s life.
Ishkhanuhi's son Lyova is student at Armenian State Economic University. He studies hard, dreams to become a good specialist, find a job and ensure better life for his mother and sister.
As Ishkhanuhi is the only breadwinner of the family, it is very difficult for her to save money for Lyova's education. So she has applied for this loan to pay for her son's university tuition.
The loan is very important for Lyova to get higher education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school going children. She runs a clothes shop which she has been operating for eight years. She also employs one person in the business. 
Sylvia was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,050 Kenya Shillings to purchase new clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts, etc.
Sylvia believes the income from this loan will help her educate her children. She is focused on owning a whole sale shop, despite the challenge of high costs of stock from the suppliers which make most of her items beyond the reach of the general public.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a 53-year-old woman from Iraq. She is married and is living with her husband. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Fatima is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
Fatima has 8 years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business and she has already completed a loan in the past to purchase a new sewing machine and an over-lock sewing machine. She successfully repaid the loan and is now working on making further improvements to her business. She has now requested a new loan to be able to buy a generator, an embroidery machine and a water dispenser/cooler.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a generator, an embroidery machine and a water dispenser/cooler.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 53 years old, married to Stephen and has grown-up children. She takes care of one grandchild who is five years old.
She runs a bakery in Kiambaa village on the outskirts of Kangemi. 
She has been in this business for two years now and gets a monthly income of 40,000 shillings.
This will be Lucy's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy a mixing machine and two cows.

loans.use: to buy mixing machine for her bakery and two cows.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a businessman who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and runs a vehicle garage where he provides mechanical repairs on the vehicles to his clients. He also sells water and owns a motorcycle which offers transport to the residents of the area for a fee. The business has been in operation for eight years. He was introduced to Milango by his relative and joined in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya Shillings to buy spare vehicle parts and a press machine. Patrick believes he can grow the business and employ more people. His main focus now is to meet the basic needs of the family, especially his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts and a press machine to use at his repair garage.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for four years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He heard about bee keeping and would like to invest in the business.
He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are high cost of products.
Samuel is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy a motorcycle for transportation. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Geicel

texts.es: Geicel es una señora trabajadora. tiene mas de cinco años de estar trabajando con ganado de leche. necesita de un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (500.000) para la compra de una vaca para producir leche. para ella es bueno contar con acceso a créditos dentro de su comunidad, lo cual le facilita el acceso y mejora su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Geicel is a hardworking woman. She has been working with dairy cattle for more than five years. She needs a loan of 500,000 Costa Rican colones to buy a cow to produce milk. It is good for her to have access to loans within her community, which facilitates her access and improves her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow to produce milk.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESPERANZA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura (producción de papa); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace años y en la actualidad trabaja con este negocio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en su la ciudad de La paz y en las comunidades. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito ágil y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" ("New Hope") communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya regional office. The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Delia is the president. The businesses which the group members run are varied and include the production and sale of potatoes, the production and sale of vegetables, a neighborhood store, production of potatoes and potato starch, and the sale of livestock.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Delia. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago by the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. She currently has an agricultural business (potato production). She says that she learned about this business from her parents years ago, and she currently works in the business to generate financial resources.

She will use this loan to increase her capital by buying seeds, which she will acquire from distributing companies and later sell in the city of La Paz and in towns. This type of work allows her to generate an income to maintain her household as much as possible, as she is married with four children.
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the flexible credit and the training.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Richar Alexander

texts.es:
Achuapa es un bello municipio ubicado en el departamento de León a 96 Km, donde existen muchas personas emprendedoras, es aquí donde vive el joven Richar Alexander. 

 Richar Alexander se llama el Joven de 30 años edad Luchador por su vida y la de su familia, cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo trabaja brindando sus servicios en una de las instituciones.

 Hoy en día se le ha presentado una oportunidad de poder mejorar su casa de habitación, esto sería de gran importancia para su familia vivir en mejores condiciones, por tal razón solicita un crédito a través de kiva y ceprodel, para la compra de: Cementó, Arena y Pago de Mono de Obra Para la mejora de su vivienda.
