El señor Manuel salvador vive en la cuidad de Managua  casado   tiene tres pequeños hijos a su cargo trabaja como supervisor de limpieza en un centro de compra  desde hace 7 años.

Manuel está solicitando un crédito a kiva y ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena,bloque,cemento, para  terminar de construir un anexo en su casa de habitación.

El señor Manuel  agradece  mucho por todos los financiamiento obtenidos en nuestra institución porque gracias a  estos créditos a mejorado su casa y ha podido ofrecerles un hogar digno para su familia
texts.en:
Manuel Salvador lives in the city of Managua. He is married and has three little children in his care. He has been working as a cleaning supervisor in a shopping center for 7 years.

Manuel is asking for a loan through Kiva and Ceprodel in order to buy construction materials such as sand, blocks, and cement in order to finish building an addition to his home.

Manual is very grateful for the financing obtained through the institutions because thanks to these loans he has improved his home and can provide decent housing for his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron, and sand to finish building an addition to his home

loans.name: Isabel De Jutacaj 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Eva es una señora casada, cuenta con 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 3 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos; inició este negocio vendiendo mercadería de casa en casa y hasta el momento tiene ya 5 años de experiencia. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la venta de relojes.

Organiza un Grupo para poder solicitar un prestamo que lo va utilizar para ampliar su negocio comprando mas productos para la venta, en el futuro cercano quiere tener un local fijo en el centro del municipio y tener mayor capital de trabajo; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agropecuarias y al comercio de cosmeticos.

Una de las señoras no aparece en la fotografía ya que cuendo tomaron la misma ella no pudo asistir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eva, 27, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She could not study herself. Eva sells cosmetics door-to-door, something she has been doing for five years. Her husband, who sells watches, supports her.

Eva started a group to be able to request a loan to expand her business and buy more products to sell. In the near future, she would like to have an establishment located in the center of the municipality and have more working capital.

The remaining members work in agriculture and selling cosmetics. One of the members could not come when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Union Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Wilfredo is from El Seibo in the Dominican Republic, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. He is the coordinator of his group, which is called Union y Amor (Union and Love) 4. He has been running a grocery store for ten years, after starting it with his own savings. He will invest this loan in his grocery store and buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food, and many other goods.

Wilfredo lives with his long term partner in their simple home. He says that his most difficult challenge is to improve his business. He enjoys running his store and is very excited to be receiving his 12th loan from Esperanza Internacional. He plans to save the profits for his future goals, which include rebuilding his house with a better and safer structure, and also having a successful store. He thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, canned food and many other goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery stock, including fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and the father of one child, and he owns a retail shop that deals in a variety of items, from clothes to household utensils. The shop has been running for nine years, in addition to a transport business. Stephen learned about Milango through a friend, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is lack of financing, a problem he sees being partly solved by this loan. Stephen is applying for a loan of 83,500 KES (Kenya shillings) to purchase additional stock, including clothes, shoes, basins and utensils. He believes that the business has improved enough for him to meet the required repayments for the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his store, including clothes, shoes, basins and utensils.

loans.name: Pingano

texts.en: Pingano is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has seven children. He is a multi-level marketer, a business he has run for the last four years. He obtained his startup capital through savings from his formal employment. He was introduced to Milango by his friends, and he is asking for a loan of 10,650 KES (Kenya shillings) to purchase more multi-level marketing products, including healthcare products, soap and supplements. He intends to meet the needs of his family by operating his business.

loans.use: to  buy multi-level marketing products for his business, including healthcare products, soap and supplements.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley, de 22 años de edad  vive en compañía de su esposo, con quien tiene un hijo, al que cuida en la casa que construyeron hace un año. Desde las primeras horas del día se dedica al cultivo de diversas verduras, además de alverjas y papa. “Junto a mi esposo me dirijo a los terrenos agrícolas, estar ahí y ver crecer a mis sembríos, es mi principal gratificación”, afirma. Hace 5 años que comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente en los terrenos que heredó de sus padres, donde ahora aplica todos los conocimientos que aprendió desde niña. Afirma sin ninguna duda, que sus cosechas son compradas a buen precio en el mercado mayoristas de la ciudad, donde cada 4 meses lleva a comercializar los alimentos maduros. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera poder tener mayor producción y mayores ingresos. Shirley, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos. 
Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero brindando ,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Shirley, 22 years old, lives with her husband, with whom she has a son, and cares for him in the house they built a year ago. 

From the early morning hours she works growing various vegetables, and peas and potatoes. “Together with my husband I tend to the agricultural fields as to be there and to see my crops grow is my biggest satisfaction,” she says. It has been 5 years since she began to work independently on the land that she inherited from her parents, where now she puts to use all the knowledge she learned as a young girl. She says that without a doubt, she gets a good price for the crops in the city wholesale market, where she goes every 4 months to sell her harvest.

Now she wants to improve her income in order to buy more farming land in order to be able to have better production and higher profits. Shirley, will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial help and she agrees to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anorkhol

texts.ru:
Анорхол замужняя женщина. Ей 32 года. У нее есть два сына и одна дочь. Старший сын и дочь учатся вшколе, а младшему сыну еще не исполнилось и годика. Муж Анорхол занимается купле-продажей скота. Анорхол со своей семьей проживает в Яванском районе, который расположен в центральной части Таджикистана. 
Уже 5 лет как Анорхол занимается растениеводством и выращивает в основном огородные культуры. Анорхол и ее муж помогают друг другу в ведении растениеводства и скотоводства. Сейчас Анорхол запрашивает кредит для закупа семян огородных культур и минеральных удобрений. В будущем она планирует расширить участок орошаемой земли и выращивать различные виды сельскохозяйственной культуры.
texts.en: Anorkhol is 32 years old, married, and has 2 sons and 1 daughter. Her older son and her daughter go to school, but the younger son is not yet one year old. Her husband buys and sells cattle for a living. The family lives in the Yavan region of central Tajikistan. For 5 years now, Anorkhol has been growing crops, in particular vegetables. She and her husband help each other in their animal husbandry and crop growing endeavours. Anorkhol is now seeking a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers. In the future, she plans to expand her plot of irrigated land and to grow a variety of agricultural crops.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and the father of two, and he owns a restaurant that he has been operating for three years. He employs four other people in the café. He is also formally employed. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and the effect of seasonal changes. Patrick is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy food supplies, including rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat. His extra income resulting from the loan will be added to his savings, to pay school fees for his child and improve his standard of living. His dream is to move to a new, spacious, place to carry on the business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for his restaurant, including rice, cereals, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sophia lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and the mother of five children, although only the youngest is in school. She is a fresh juice vendor, a business she has been operating for three years. She started the business with her savings. She learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, and she joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are the high cost of materials and unpredictable weather, which interferes with the steady supply of fruits. Sophia is applying a loan of 41,900 KES (Kenya shillings) to buy fruits wholesale and to put up a structure where she can sell the products. The extra income will be used to pay school fees for her child. She aspires to expand the business to one that is bigger than the one she has and to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy fruits wholesale and put up a structure where she can sell the products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to change the mains electricity.

loans.name: Giesteira

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É Docente e comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, amendoim, massa, feijão, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio e dar continuidade aos estudos e fazer o nível superior, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e adquirir uma viatura para auxiliar no transporte pessoal.
texts.en: Giesteira is the mother of three children, one of whom goes to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else besides her family.  She owns her own business selling food products.  She will use this loan to buy products (rice, flour, peanuts, pasta, beans, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and to continue her studies to receive higher education.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her biggest challenge is working more and acquiring a vehicle to help with personal transportation.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, peanuts, pasta, beans, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema, de 28 años, esta casada con Héctor, con quien tiene una hija, a la que cuidan en la casa que heredó hace algunos años.  La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, el cual lo realiza en sus propios terrenos ubicados a las afueras de la comunidad. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas, alverja y maíz; ya tiene 3 años de experiencia. Y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder trasmitir el conocimiento que le heredaron sus padres. Asimismo afirma que siembra en sociedad con una señora, con quien comparte los gastos de semilla, abono y fertilizantes que requiere en sus cultivos. Pero lo que más le agrada es el cuidado de animales menores, como cuyes; los cuales comercializa a un buen precio en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma donde vende de acuerdo a los pedidos. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Zulema, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Zulema is 28 years old and is married to Hector. They have a daughter who they are raising in the house she inherited several years ago. She works as a farmer in her own plots of land located on the outskirts of her community. Her main crops include potatoes, beans, peas and corn. She has three years of experience. What she likes most about her job is that she can pass on the knowledge that she inherited from her parents. In addition, she says that she works the fields in partnership with another lady, with whom she shares the costs of the seeds, manure and fertilizers that her farm requires. However, what she enjoys most is taking care of small animals such as guinea pigs. She sells these animals for a good price at the Modelo market in Tarma, where she sells upon request. This is her fifth Kiva loan and she is committed to paying her installments on time.
Zulema will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her fields.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Tomasa Inmaculada

texts.es: Doña Tomasa de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su yerno desde hace 30 años, ella tiene un puesto de venta de comida; el local donde lo tiene es alquilado cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene muy buena clientela y con sus ventas ha tenido una buena estabilidad economica ya que esta situada en una zona centrica, ella solicita un credito para la compra de productos (bebidas, harina de arroz, harina de maiz, azucar, frijoles, pollo, entre otras cosas) para poder seguir manteniendo su negocio como hasta ahora y asi tener mejores ganacias para una mejor vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 59, has been living in her own home with her daughter and her son-in-law for 30 years. She has a food stall located on rented premises near to her home which has good clientele and with the sales she has been financially secure as it the food stall is located in a central area.

Tomasa is seeking a loan to buy products (drinks, rice flour, sugar, beans, chicken and others) to be able to continue running her business as it has been to date, and to increase sales for a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her café.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas De Argueta Group

texts.es:
La señora Victoria Angelica Concepcion es de estado civil casada, cuenta con 38 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar 3 años, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 4 van a la escuela; ella se dedica a atender su tienda de productos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo va utilizar para ampliar su capital comprando más producto para surtir su tienda, en el futuro proximo quiere que su negocio este prospero; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesanía. 

en la fotografía aparecen 7 integrantes, pero, 2 de ellas no clasificaron.
texts.en:
Victoria Angelica Concepcion is married. She is 38 years old, with 3 years of education, and she has 5 children and 4 of them attend school. She works tending her general store. She began this business with little capital and has 12 years experience. She has the help of her husband who works in commerce.

A group was organized to apply for a loan and she will use it as working capital in order to buy more merchandise to supply her store. She hopes that in the near future her business will be prosperous. The other members of the group work in commerce and handicrafts.

In the photograph there are 7 loan partners, but 2 of them are not members of this group.

loans.use: to buy household items in order to supply her store

loans.name: Ana Clorinda

texts.es: Doña Ana de 67 años de edad se dedica a la sastreria desdes hace varios años, vive con su esposo, con su hijo y un nieto en casa propia desde hace 40 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo e hijo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar; pero necesita mas herramientas para tener mejor su taller de costura, por eso ella solicita un credito para poder comprar esas herramientas que tanto necesita y asi poder seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en: Ana is 67 years old and has been making her living in tailoring for several years now. For 40 years, she has been living in her own home with her husband, along with her son and a grandson. With the earnings from her job, and with the help of her husband and her son, they are able to cover the household costs but Ana needs more tools to better run her sewing workshop, hence the reason she is seeking a loan to buy the tools which she is so much in need of, and to be able to continue helping in the household.

loans.use: to buy tools for a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Angie

texts.es: Angie es una joven muy esforzada. tiene experiencia en la producción de leche pero no ha podido poner su propio negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar dos vacas y así poder empezar con su propia empresa de producción de leche.
texts.en: Angie is strong young woman. She has experience in milk production but has been unable to start her own business. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 colons in order to buy two cows and start her own dairy business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: Leida Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ella es  madre cabeza de familia tiene una niña de 7 años la cual depende  económicamente de  ella  ya que el papa no le colabora, tiene un empleo  y gracias a este  sostiene  a su hija, a ella y puede pagar sus estudios de farmacia, la cual esta cursando segundo semestre.
 Sus aspiraciones son terminar  esos estudios de  farmacia  con el fin de conseguir un mejor empleo y tener un mejor futuro  para ellas dos,  comparte el apartamento  con  un primo y su señora esposa. 
Desde muy  joven ha tenido que  trabajar,  es una persona totalmente independiente emprendedora luchadora que a pesar de adversidades  siempre he salido adelante  con entereza  y acompañada de Dios
texts.en:
Leida is a mother and head of the household, she has a 7-year-old girl who is financially dependent on her as the father does not provide any support. She has a job with which she supports her daughter and with with she pays her pharmaceutical studies. Leida is currently attending the second semester of studies.

Leida dreams of completing her pharmaceutical studies in order to obtain a better job and have a better future for herself and her daughter. She shares the flat with a cousin and his wife.

From a young age, Leida has had to work, she is a person who is fully independent, enterprising and a fighter who despite the obstacles has always got ahead in life with integrity and accompanied by God.

loans.use: to finish her schooling in Pharmaceutical studies.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yodany is one of the entrepreneurial woman from the group Esperanza y Fe (Hope and Faith) 1, 2 & 3. She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She plans to continue enjoying reading the Bible. Yodany is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for three years, starting out with her own savings. She sells underwear and clothing.

Yodany plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying dozens of underwear items for men, kids and women. Also, she is planning to buy clothes. She will use the profits to invest in the business and to save, because she has a dream to have a beauty salon and a spa. Yodany's group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy.

loans.use: to buy underwear and other clothes

loans.name: Nicolas Adilio

texts.es: Don Nicolas de 58 años de edad tienen una pequeña tienda desde hace 25 años en la que vende productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles y gracias a las ventas que hace en su tienda a podido salir adelante junto con su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hija y una neura. Busca mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un credito para incrementar la variedad de artículos en su tienda, lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Nicolas, 58, has owned a small grocery store for 25 years in which he sells perishable goods such as soft drinks, sweets and other types of edible and non-edible goods. It is thanks to the sales in the store that Nicolas has got ahead in life with his family - he lives in his own home with his wife, his daughter and a daughter-in-law. As he is looking to improve his quality of life, he is seeking a loan to increase the variety of goods in his store, thus enabling him to increase his business' profits and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for the store.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар  имеет четырехлетний опыт в сфере кредитования. Она кредитуется вот уже четвёртый год и продвигает своё дело и жизнь. Она занимается скотоводством. Жизнь принудила её заняться таким «мужским» делом. Начинала она с одного крупного рогатого скота откормив его  продала за небольшую прибыль.  И так, потихоньку с каждым годом пользуясь кредитом от МДО «Арванд» сумела увеличить количество скота.  Приобретая опыт Дилбар начала разводить коров и также  продовать кисло молочные продукты. Продавая  молока, зарабатывает на ежедневные расходы детей. Ведь у неё пятеро детей и для них необходимо определённые средство для каждодневной ходьбы в школу и ежемесячную оплату обучения. Очень хочет, чтобы её дети стали образованными и грамотными. Для этого вкладывает много усилий, старается создать хотя бы какие то условия для того чтобы её дети учились и научились чему нибудь.  Но и дети Дилбар вовлечены в её маленький семейный бизнес. Они помогают маме с чисткой помещения для скота и продажей молока. Дилбар считает поговорку «каждая минута дорога» своим лозунгом. Несмотря на возраст, также работает техничкой в колхозе. Ведь ей предстоит  сыграть свадьбу сына, что требует немало денежных средств. Как говорит сама Дилбар: «Я ещё должна трудиться и зарабатывать денег, а потом придёт время буду сидеть и внуков нянчить». Жизнь заставило Дилбар быть сильной и решительной как мужчина, экономной и чуткой как женщина, заботливой как жена и любящей как мама.  И в очередной раз Дилбар обратилась за кредитом. Ей необходимо закупить корм и дополнительно скота. Очень надеется на поддержку со стороны МДО «Арванд»   и заранее благодарит за содействие и внимание в её сторону.
texts.en: Dilbar began taking out loans 4 years ago, and in this time, she has made progress in her work and her life. Though it is generally considered a man's field, circumstances worked out such that she earns a living in animal husbandry. She started out with one cow which she fattened and sold for a small profit. With each year, with the help of loans from MDO Arvand, she has gradually increased her herd. Having gained more experience, Dilbar has started to raise cattle and sell dairy products, the profit from which allows her to cover the daily living expenses of her children. She has 5 kids and she needs a certain amount of money to pay for their daily school needs and monthly educational costs. She really wants her children to become educated, and to this end, she is working hard to provide at least the basic means for them to study well and learn a specialisation. At present though, her kids help her in her small family business by cleaning the cattle shed and selling milk. Dilbar's motto is "every minute is precious." Despite her age, she also works as a cleaner on a collective farm because in the near future, she will host her son's wedding, and this will require a significant outlay of cash. As Dilbar herself says, "I still need to work and earn money, and later there will come the time when I can sit and take care of my grandchildren." Life has required her to be strong and decisive like a man, thrifty and sensitive like a woman, a caring wife, and a loving mother. Dilbar has once more approached MDO Arvand for a loan to purchase more cattle and cattle feed. She is really hoping for support and is grateful in advance for the cooperation and assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú. El grupo “Las Hormiguitas” está constituida por 09 mujeres entusiastas y emprendedoras. Este es el caso de  Sara  una de las integrantes de 30 años de edad conviviente y  por el momento no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de lencería en una galería cerca a su localidad, este negocio surge gracias a la motivación de un familiar la cual  se dedica a dicha actividad. A Sara le gustaría poner otros puesto de lencerías en lugares comerciales, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de ropas interiores para niños y adultos, medias y chalinas. El grupo “Las Hormiguitas” agradecen el crédito brindado. Sara se encuentra sentada, es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste una blusa floreada y pantalón beige. Miluska no puedo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú. The "Little Ants" group is composed of 9 enthusiastic female entrepreneurs. This is the case of one of the members, Sara, who is 30 years old, has a live-in partner, but no children at the moment. Sara sells underwear in a gallery near her neighborhood. This business arose thanks to the encouragement of a family member that has the same business. 

Sara would like to to have other underwear stalls in commercial areas to increase her revenue. She asked for the loan to purchase undergarments for children and adults, stockings and scarves. The "Little Ants" group appreciates the given credit. 

Sara is the third on the left side, sitting, and dressed in a floral blouse with beige pans. Miluska is not present for work reasons.

loans.use: purchase undergarments.

loans.name: Ines Marely

texts.es:
Doña Inés  es comerciante de mariscos, actividad comercial que tiene cuatro años de tener con la cual contribuye directamente en las necesidades básicas de su hogar, su forma de venta es ambulante de casa en casa, además de vender en su casa de habitación.

Necesita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de mariscos para atender algunos comerciantes en los mercados de la ciudad de Managua.

Es importante mencionar que su esposo es pescador y adquiere los productos a un buen precio para luego comercializarlo.

Gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo han mejorado su casa de habitación y creen que atreves de un financiamiento su negocio tendrá mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Inés is a seafood merchant, a job she has had for four years. Thanks to her work, she can contribute directly to buying her household needs. She sells door to door as well as from her home.

She needs a loan to buy larger quantities of seafood in order to meet the needs of various merchants at markets in Managua.

It is important to mention that her husband is a fisherman. He purchases the seafood at a good price for resale later.

Thanks to God and their sacrifice, they have made improvements to their house and believe that a loan will help them increase their income.

loans.use: to buy lobsters, shrimp and fish

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in a small house with his wife in Khanyounis. 

Omar works in a barber shop with a very low income that barely covers the family needs. Omar's wife is still a university student who wants to complete her studies, so Omar is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Omar's wife to do her homework and reports and help her with her studies. 

This will ensure a better future for Omar's wife and improve the family's living conditions.

Omar is photographed in the store from where he purchased the laptop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Don Oscar es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra uno de los principales granos básicos que es el maíz. Don Oscar desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso ha solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos y entre otras cosas que necesita para la siembra de maiz y asi seguir solventando los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.
texts.en: Don Oscar is a man who takes his household obligations very seriously; he has always been known as someone who provides the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and children. He is a hard-working farmer who grows one of the main basic grains: corn. Don Oscar would like to increase his sales, which is why he is seeking a loan. It would allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers and other items needed to grow corn, thus allowing him to continue meeting his household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Geremias

texts.es: Geremias, tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Toda su vida ha dedicado a realizar actividades agrícolas. El cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El ha invertido dos préstamos anteriores a los cultivos lo que le ha permitido sacar buenas cosechas. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo por 3,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de frijol, comprara abono y gastos por limpieza del mismo. Su plan es incrementar el área de siembra y obtener más ingresos para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Geremías, 33, is married and has three children. He lives in a village that belongs to the municipality of Morazán, Yoro department. Geremías has worked all his life in agriculture, growing grains such as corn and beans and selling them in the local marketplace. He has invested the two previous loans in his plantations, which has resulted in good harvests. 

Geremías decided to request a loan of 3,000 lempiras [HNL] to give maintenance to his beans plantation. He will buy compost and cover some cleaning costs. His plan is to expand the planted area and increase his income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and to pay for the cleaning of his beans plantation.

loans.name: Francisco Ariel

texts.es:
Don Franklin Ariel habita en un barrio de Managua desde hace cuarenta años, es casado con tres hijo a su cargo, labora de conductor con más de doce años de servicio para una institución del estado. Franklin Ariel junto a su esposa han trabajado para sacar adelante a sus hijos con los estudios.  

El crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para  comprar materiales de construcción como cinc, perlin y pago de mano de obra, en la reparación del techo. Esto permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. 

Esta muy agradecido con  Ceprodel  y kiva, “ya que dice que aparte que se le atiende bien también son bajos los intereses, y que  con estos créditos que le han dado ha podido cumplir poco a poco sus sueños.
texts.en:
Don Franklin Ariel has lived in a neighborhood of Managua for 40 years. He is married with three children, and he has worked as a driver for over 12 years in the service of a state institution. Franklin Ariel and his wife have worked to help their children get ahead with their studies.

The loan he is asking from CEPRODEL will be used to purchase construction materials like zinc and timber, and to pay laborers in the repair of his roof. This will allow for a better quality of life for Franklin Ariel's family. 

He is very grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva, and he says that apart from being well-served, they offer loans with low interest rates. With these loans, he's been able to fulfill his dreams little by little.

loans.use: pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his wife in a small village near Tulkarem city. For the past 5 years, Hazem has had a supermarket selling different types of food and consumer goods. It has been a profitable project, but needs some improvements. 

Hazem is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock that customers often request and to make improvements in the supermarket's condition such as installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales and increase Hazem's income.
Hazem is photographed in his store.

loans.use: to purchase needed stock and make improvements to the store.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is married with one child. She is twenty-eight years old and lives in Balatacan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Madel sells grocery goods to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for five thousand pesos to buy grocery goods for her retail store. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Madel hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her retail store.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 1 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is the coordinator of her group, El Sol Sale Para Todos 1 (The Sun Shines For Everyone 1), the members of which are located in the city of Hato Mayor, a small rural community. Antonia makes her home there with her husband, in a simple structure. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business, something she continues to work very hard at. In the meantime, she plans to continue attending church and serving the people.

With her first Esperanza loan almost eight years ago, Antonia started her business, a "Fantasia" selling miscellaneous products. She is now requesting her 15th loan, which she will use to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women´s accessories and other products. Antonia and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, accessories, jewelry, clothes, and other products to resell

loans.name: Sol De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Hola  desde  Perú,   Un grupo conformado por  7  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito de Ate Vitarte. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “sol de Vitarte” una de ellas es  Sídney de 26 años de edad  soltera y sin  hijos,  Sídney es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de ingeniería de sistemas   estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Sídney   tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios y así ser exitosa en la vida. Sídney  ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar matricula de pensión y así  cumplir sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo agradecida por la ayuda brindada ah  Kiva y  despide con la seguridad de culminar sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  Sol de Vitarte (Sun of Vitarte) is a group formed by seven responsible woman from the district of Ate Vitarte who all come from different business backgrounds.  One of these ladies is Sidney who is 26 years old, single, and has no children.  She studies Information Technology at the University, and she is working hard to reach her goals in life.  

Sidney's goal is to finish her degree, and with it, be successful in life.  She has applied for a new loan to pay her tuition fees, so she will be able to accomplish her goals with lots of effort and hard work.  She is thankful for the help that Kiva has given her, and she is certain she will end of fulfilling her goals.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Juvie Jean

texts.en:
Juvie Jean is single. She is 21 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for almost a year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this work.

She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries to resell at her retail store. Juvie Jean has been a member of PMPC for one year. She hopes to improve her living conditions in the future, by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell at the retail store

location.town: Tangub - Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Laurente

texts.en:
Laurente lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old. Laurente is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

He is requesting a loan of 60,000 PHP which will be used to purchase spare parts and tires and to pay for maintenance. In 2004, Laurente joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 64 years old and widowed with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business which is planting and harvesting coconut (copra) to sell to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns about 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Dioscora plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mujeres De Union Y Paz 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of the group called Mujeres de Union y Paz 1, 2 & 3 (Women of Union and Peace 1, 2 & 3). This group is located in the rural area surrounding San Pedro de Macoris. They all live in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields. This is where Ana lives, with her long-term partner.

Ana has operated her business selling miscellaneous products since two years ago, when she decided to take a loan with us and invest it in this business activity. Before, she had had another business, but it was closed at the time she took her first loan. Having promptly repaid her previous loans, Ana is excited to be taking her sixth loan from Esperanza, which she will invest in her business by buying products to increase her inventory. She is planning to use her profits to save for her future plans.

Ana's dream is to have a successful business, where she can sell different kinds of products for all the needs in her community. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy women's accessories, Silver Jewel, cosmetics, and other products for her inventory

loans.name: Darwin José

texts.es:
El señor  Darwin José   vive en  la cuidad de Managua, casado  con dos  pequeños hijos tiene un trabajo  desde hace 2 años desempeñando el cargo de operador de limpieza.

 Joven trabajador  responsable en su trabajo y con su familia. Darwin  está solicitando a kiva  un crédito  para   la compra de un terreno ya él cuenta con una parte de dinero que ha venido ahorrando.

Hace dicha solicitud ya que vive en la casa de su padre y con la compra del terreno  va a poder construir su casa para  darles mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin José lives in Managua. He is married with two small children. For the last two years he has worked as a cleaner.

This hard-working young man is responsible both at work and at home with his family. Darwin is seeking a Kiva loan to buy a plot of land. He has already saved part of the money.

He is applying for this loan because he currently lives in his father's house. Once he purchases the land, he will be able to build his own house and make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old and married. She has four children. With three of her children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, snack foods, sugar, and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF, which she will use to buy more groceries to sell at her store. In the future Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 50 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, candies, soft-drinks and other groceries.

She has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending. Carmencita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, rice, candies, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Nancy Eloísa

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad ubicada a 90 Km del departamento de León, donde existen diferente tipos de actividades comerciales.  

Nancy Eloisa se llama la Joven de 25 años de edad donde habita con su esposo y su hijo que tanto ama y estima, tiene buenos costumbre, sus principales sueños es vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia. 
 
Se dedica brindar servicio en uno de los centros educativo, hoy en día se dio cuenta que Ceprodel Y Kiva piensa en el desarrollo de las personas emprendedoras como es el caso de esta joven, por tal razón le está solicitando a que le brinden un financiamiento, para la compra de: Cemento, Arena, zin y pago de mano de Obra, con esto ayudaría a mejorar las paredes y el techo de su vivienda.

Esto sería de mucho beneficio después de llegar un día cansada de su trabajo a su vivienda compartiendo su vida con su familia en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
There are different types of commercial activities that exist in Santa Rosa del Peñon, a beautiful city located 90km from León.

Nancy Eloisa is 25 years old and lives with her husband and her son who she loves and appreciates very much. She is a respectable woman. Her main dream is to live in better conditions with her family.

She provides service at an educational center. One of these days, Nancy realized that CEPRODEL and KIVA are helping the development of entrepreneurs, which is the case of this young person. For this reason, Nancy is requesting a loan that will provide financing for the purchase of cement, sand, zinc, and to pay for labor. This would help her improve the walls and roof of her home.

This would be very beneficial for coming home after a long day at work, sharing her life with her family in better conditions.

loans.use: Compra de: Cemento, Arena, zin y pago de mano de Obra.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old, and married. She has five children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and other fishing equipment.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, rope and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Chinimaya Group

texts.es:
La señora Concepcion es de estado civil casada, de 35 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 estudian; ella se dedica a la artesanía, especificamente a la elaboracion de bordado de blusas para damas, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y hasta el momento tiene 17 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo va utilizar para la compra de telas y lustrina para realizar los bordados, en el futuro quiere tener mas capital y tener trabajadoras; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican también a bordados y a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Concepcion is married. She is 35 years old. She had 3 years of primary education. She has 3 children and all of them are school students. She works in handicrafts, specifically embroidered blouses for women. She began this business with a small amount of capital and has 17 years experience.

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan in order to buy fabric and shiny cotton embroidery thread to do her embroidery work. In the future she wants to have more capital and employees. 

The other members of the group also work in embroidery and in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shiny cotton embroidery thread for handicrafts and fertilizer and seed for agricultural use

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Marta se dedica a la venta de sorbetes y paletas desde hace 6 años, ha tenido buenas ganacias porque es un producto muy vendible en la zona donde ella reside, con las ganacias que obtiene logra salir adelante con su familia su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 6 años que actualmente estudian, solicita un credito para poder seguir alquilando la camara refrigerante donde mantiene sus productos y poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar junto con su esposo.
texts.en: For six years, Doña Marta has sold sorbets and popsicles.  She has been able to make a good income because they are products that sell well in the area where she lives.  The business is located in her home, and with what she makes, she is able to help her family move forward.  Doña Marta lives with her husband and two children (14 years old and 6 years old) who are in school.  She is applying for this loan to be able to continue to rent to deep freezer where she keeps her products and to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy tools needed for the sale of sorbets and popsicles.

loans.name: Peruanos A Trabajar Group

texts.es: Hola  de Perú,   Un grupo conformado por 8  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “PERUANOS A TRABAJAR” una de ellas es la Sra. Yolanda  de 33 años casada y con 2 hijos, la Sra. Yolanda se dedica ya hace 7 años a la venta de productos de belleza   en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Yolanda   ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. Yolanda   trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más cosméticos de belleza  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru, from a group made up of eight responsible women from different commercial backgrounds. They are members of the "Peruanos a Trabajar" communal bank. One of the members is Yolanda who is 33 years old, married and has two children. For the last seven years, Yolanda has been making her living selling beauty products every day in a small business. She has succeeded in getting ahead in life and therein being able to pay for her children's secondary schooling. With the fruit of her efforts, Yolanda has managed to improve her home and support her children's education. 

In improving her business, her greatest dream is that her children become professionals and that is why Yolanda works so much. With the loan, she will invest in the purchase of more cosmetic goods and therein obtain more sales. Yolanda bids us farewell sending Kiva a hug and is thankful for the loan that she has been given as it enables her to progress.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ma. Nieves

texts.en:
Ma. Nieves is 53 years old and married, and she has nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for ten years, and she earns additional income by farming rice.

Ma. Nieves is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is 54 years old and single. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, raising pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2009. And now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nissondiya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames, les dix  femmes du groupe Nissondiya ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Fabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de charbon de bois, céréales, arachide, thé, sucre, fruits et légumes.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  décident de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme assise en 1ème position à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’arachide dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac d’arachide à la foire de Konodimini. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Salimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous families, the ten women of the group Nissondiya average 41 years of age and three children each. The women all live in the village of Fabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and kinship. They buy and sell charcoal, grains, peanuts, tea, sugar, and fruit & vegetables. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Salimata (the woman seated first from the right in the photo) is a major vendor of peanuts in the village. She intends to use her loan to purchase a sack of peanuts at the Konodimini fair. Sales are made in cash or on credit to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

Ms. Salimata hopes to make an average monthly profit  of 5,000 francs CFA with this loan. It will be used for reinvesting in the business and ensuring her home is kept supplied with ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Jose Artemio

texts.es: Don Jose se dedica a la reparacion de todo tipo de calzado desde hace varios años tiene su puesto cerca del lugar donde reside, vive en una casa que alquila con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, solicta un credito para poder comprar materiales para la reparacion de los calzados ya que tiene clientela por que trabaja todos los dias de la semana y con las ganancias que le queda logra pagar los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: For many years, Don Jose has been repairing all types of shoes.  He works close to the home that he rents with his wife and two children.  His is applying for this loan to buy shoe repair materials.  He has enough customers to work every day, and with what he makes, he is able to pay the household expenses and help his family move forward.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her home (to buy zinc, rafter beams, and more)

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a purified drinking water retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more purified drinking water to sell. In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more purified drinking water, to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and is the mother of three children. She is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she has run a retail business for six years and earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living conditions. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Melanie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as soap, sugar and other groceries.

Sally has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Sally aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as soap, sugar and other groceries, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 45 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Roger is a 45 year old entrepreneur. He is married and currently lives with his four children. Roger is requesting a loan with the desire to purchase supplies like fertilizers and pesticides. 

He wishes to help his coffee crops and to keep them in good condition throughout their development in order to get a good quality project. The only constraint that he has is the lack of money to keep growing since he and his family depend on this economic activity to get ahead. This is why he makes the request for credit. 

It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Roger is not looking for other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with best terms and an interest rate that is much lower.

loans.use: buy supplies.

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eva Mercedes, es madre de cuatro hijos y se dedica a la venta de bisutería en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León desde hace doce años, este trabajo lo realiza para llevar el sustento a su familia, sale de su casa a las 5:00 y abre su negocio a las 5:30 am finalizando hasta las 5:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.

El crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para gastos de matriculas y aranceles de universidad de su hijo que está a su cargo.

La Señora Eva espera que su sueño se le cumpla en ver a su hijo coronar  su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes is a mother of four children. For the last 12 years, she has been selling trinkets in one of León's markets. She does this job in order to support her family. Monday through Saturday, she leaves home at 5:00 am, opens her business at 5:30 am, and works till 5:00 pm.

The loan she is seeking from Ceprodel will be used to pay the university enrollment and tuition fees for her son, who is under her care.

Señora Eva hopes that her dream of seeing her son achieve a professional career will come true.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: La Señora Flor trabaja para un Centro de Salud público desde hace 20 años como auxiliar de enfermería, actualmente el crédito lo requiere para mejora de casa de habitación con la compra de zinc y perlines en ampliación de dormitorio.
texts.en:
Flor has been working for a public health center for twenty years as a nursing assistant. 

She is currently seeking a loan so she can make improvements to her home with the purchase of zinc plates and roof braces for an addition to her sleeping area.

loans.use: bo buy construction materials in order to make improvements to her housing

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
Neba is married, has five children and lives with her family in a three bed apartment house in Bafut Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life including: sickness in her family, poverty, the death of both parents leaving her to care for her younger siblings, the death of her son after a brief illness that led to spending money to no avail, and a serious illness.

With the new loan requested, she will engage in gardening by cultivating vegetables and ginger, buy chicks for her poultry farm, buy feed for the chicks, and other articles. This business will succeed because she has good soil for gardening and the droppings from the chicks will also serve as manure in the less fertile areas. She has ready customers who will buy the output. The community will benefit from some of the droppings from the chicks as vegetables will be sold to them at moderate prices.

Profit from the business will be used for expansion of her poultry farm, education of her children in school, and furnishing of her house.  The GHAPE loan is preferable because of its low interest rate, convenient repayment intervals and no collateral required before loan disbursement.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chick feed, vegetable seedlings and other articles for her farm.

loans.name: Recibella

texts.en:
Recibella is 31 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Recibella has a retail business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to buy sand and gravel for house renovation. 

Recibella has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the retail business.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel for house renovation.

location.town: Tangub - Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa es madre de 6 hijos, inicia diariamente la elaboración de tortillas a las 10 am a 12 pm y posterior a las 4 pm a 6 pm el cual posee su negocio en su casa de habitación en uno de los barrios del departamento de León el cual realiza la venta de su producto desde su casa de habitación, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 32 años siendo este el sustento de su familia.

La señora María Luisa se presentó a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para realizar compras de productos al por mayor como son: leña y maíz los cuales utiliza para la elaboración de tortillas, tiste, posol, nacatamales, entre otros productos.

Este trabajo lo realiza para aumentar sus ingresos de esa manera a mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María Luisa is the mother of 6 children. Every day she makes tortillas from 10:00AM until noon and later from 4:00PM until 6:00PM. She has her business at home in one of the neighborhoods in León, and makes her dishes in her house. She has been in this activity for 32 years and this is the way she supports her family.

María Luisa came to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a loan in order to buy products at wholesale such as: firewood and corn which she will use to make tortillas, corn and cocoa drinks, stew, and tamales, among other products.

She does this work in order to increase her income so that she can improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn at wholesale prices

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Teresita requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married, hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Zenaida successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

NWTF is re-listing Zenaida's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sirri

texts.en:
Sirri is married, has eight children and lives with her family in a five bedroom apartment in Bafut Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life including inadequate finances to educate, feed and provide healthcare to her children, the death of her father and father in-law, constant theft and the death of her child.

With the new loan requested, she will buy piglets, piglet feed and maize.  The maize will enable her to produce corn beer which she sells in her compound. This business will succeed because she has regular customers who usually buy her piglets and community members consume corn beer from her on regular basis as she is the only person who sells it. Because of her business, her community can always buy piglets at discounted prices and she educates other people on how to prepare corn beer.

The profit from the loan will be used to purchase cement to repair her compound, purchase more piglets, educate her children and expand her corn beer bar by adding other drinks. GHAPE loans are preferable to her because of their low interest rates, their gradual installmental repayments, and they are not dependent on the borrowers existing financial resources.

loans.use: to buy piglets and maize seedlings.

loans.name: Pierina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Pierina del Carmen trabaja para un Colegio público como Maestra de Primaria desde hace 5 años.

Este es su primer crédito con Ceprodel y se siento agradecida por la ayuda que me está brindado ya que lo va a resolver para pagos de trámite de diploma de universidad.
texts.en:
Pierina del Carmen has been working for a public school as a primary teacher for 5 years.

This is her first loan through Ceprodel and she is grateful for the help given to her so that she can make the required payment for the paperwork involved for her college diploma.

loans.use: to pay the expenses involved for the processing of her college degree

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a business selling bread in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by working as a fish vendor and as a tailor.

Veronica is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more bread to sell to customers.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, 25 years old, is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Rhamil and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household, working hard to continually provide income for her every day expenses.

Michelle makes and sells rice cakes and rice dishes. These are foods commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meal for desserts. She sells them by order, with particularly strong demand for special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, sugar, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Michelle dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes for good health and happiness for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as rice, sugar, condiments, and seasonings, to make rice cakes.

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Violita is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store and she also makes and sells baskets that are made of "lagpakanay." She has been in her business for four years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Violita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, which she believed would help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock to sell at her store and to buy more "lagpakanay" to use in making baskets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell at her store and to buy more lagpakanay to use in making baskets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old and married, and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting coconut for sale. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase chemicals for coconut production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for coconut production

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en: Lelia is 59 years old, is married and has four children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has owned and operated a retail business for over eight years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and eggs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 34 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on ring fenced land. She has been rendering taxi service to local people for three years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience providing this service. Her husband used to work at a construction site but now stays at home unemployed. She is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. The natural gas vehicle will be used by her husband to start a taxi service to generate income. As a result, she and her husband can generate more income for their children's education. Importantly, natural gas vehicles have cleaner emissions and waste less fuel. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle.

loans.name: Jowo Slow Group

texts.en:
Nartini lives in a village of the Cawang district of the province of Jakarta in Indonesia. She is 48 years old and is married with one son who is a senior in high school. To support her family, she opened a small kiosk in front of an academic school nearby her house. She sells there from 06.00 AM – 04.00 PM. The current business earns her family about 400,000 IDR per day to meet the family’s needs and pay her husband's medical fees which have accumulated over the two months of his being sick.

Nartini has been with VisionFund Indonesia for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of four to ask for another loan of 1,500,000 IDR each. As the leader, Nartini wants to use her portion to buy instant noodles and instant drinks to complete her kiosk. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living. She dreams of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles and instant drinks to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Koeng

texts.en:
Koeng, 39, is a mother of three dependent kids who are still in school. The rest of her family is residing in the Sangke district of Battambang province, where rice farming is the common business as the main source of income. To deal with the daily food consumption,she solely counts on a single business activity, rice farming, which she has been with for 10 years.

Koeng is a new client for VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now taking out her first loan, which she will use to buy a plot of farmland for growing more paddy rice. She hopes that she will be able to enlarge her business and gain triple yield, so that she can sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for growing more paddy rice

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 48 years old and widowed. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Cristina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Cristina would like to save money, for future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 27-year-old mother of one schoolboy, who resides in Battambang Province, where rice farming is the common business. Yoeurn is also one of the villagers who cultivate rice, as the main source of income. This is the business that she has been with for 10 years.

This is not the original loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has effectively used her previous three loans to stabilize her family’s living status, especially with regard to having a meal three times each day and keeping her child in school. For this loan cycle, she is going to smooth her farmland surface in order to be ready for the re-planting season. She hopes to grow her cash crop on time and make more income for her family.

loans.use: To smooth her farmland surface, in order to be ready for the re-planting season

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en: Kifah is a 42-year-old Lebanese widow living with her one parent and one sibling. In 2008, she started running her own shop selling souvenirs and flowers. Her income is important to help with the household expenses since she is the main income provider. She has a wide variety of flowers and decoration accessories. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of souvenirs and flowers. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales to amplify her income. In the future, she is planning to enlarge her business and collect higher revenues.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of souvenirs and flowers.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang Province, Saran is 50 years old and a widow. As a single mother with seven children, she strives for a living through corn farming on one hectare. The-10 year engagement in the current business returns her about 44,700 Riel per day.

A new client of VisionFund, Saran is seeking a loan to lease additional farmland, pay plowing fees, and buy rice seed and potash. She hopes to make more income through diversification to upgrade her living standard.

loans.use: To lease additional farmland, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 21,500 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, dried fish, shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and eggs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods, dried fish, shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy bananas and ingredients for her food business. Janeth successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Janeth's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bananas and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa is 60 years old and married with 12 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. She has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Diosa would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food market business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. 
She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to purchase more stock of spices and seasonings to sell at her food stall. In the future, Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spices and seasonings to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Cabecera Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cabecera” está conformado por siete mujeres y dos hombres todos son muy trabajadoress y responsables ellos viven en una comunidad pequeña y tranquila. Doña Angela quien es parte del grupo tiene 63 años de edad es una mujer ya de la tercera edad sin embrago no la limita a seguir trabajando con la cria de sus borregos. Esta casada con el señor Gregorio juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja Doña Angela desde hace 15 años se dedica a la crianza de borregos Doña Angela Argumento "Inicie con la cria de los borregos porque mi esposo siempre ha tenido un sueldo minimo y muchas veces no nos alcanzaba para solventar gastos de educacion y para el hogar" Desde hace cinco años amplio mas el numero de sus borregos Doña Angela los comprar desde que son unos corderitos los crece por algun tiempo para despues venderlos a las personas que se dedican hacer barbacoa en su comunidad. Esta vez esta solicitando el credito para comprar cuatro borreguitos mas. Doña Aangela cuenta platica  que le gusta mucho la crianza de sus borregos porque es una muy buena manera de poder salir de algun problema economico, ademas cuenta que nunca ha tenido ningun tipo de problema con la crianza de sus borregos siempre los ha cuidado mucho. La meta de Doña Angela es la llegar a tener mas borregos para que en un momento dado que su esposo ya no pueda trabajar puedan vivir tranquilamente sin preocupaciones economicas.
