El Señor Jacson vive en Orquídeas, el tiene 34 años de edad.
El empezó hace 5 años  adquirió un vehículo,   con un crédito que adquirió pudo completar para comprar otro carro y ahora tiene 2 vehículos  de alquiler.
El sale a realizar su trabajo de 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, y el otro lo alquila.
El no tiene esposa, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad están en escuela fiscal.
El usara el préstamo para arreglar su auto con llantas, frenos etc.
El desea en el futuro tener su propia casa para darles mejor comodidad a sus hijos, y poder conservar su auto ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Jacson, age 34, lives in Orquídes.  He started five years ago and got a vehicle.  With a loan that he got he was able to finish buying another car.  Now he has two vehicles to rent.

He leaves to work at 6:30 a.m., and he works until 10:00 p.m.  He rents the other one.

He does not have a wife.  He has two minor children, and they attend public school.

He will use the loan to fix up his car with tires and brakes, etc.

In the future he wishes to have his own house in order to make his children more comfortable.  He wishes to be able to keep up his car because it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his car by purchasing tires and brakes, etc.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Em, 49, is a mother of three kids; two are still in school. She is also a local citizen from Kampong Cham province. She works on two, 2-hectare areas of land, one for rice and the other for cassava cultivation. This is the main source of her family's income, whereas working for others for a fee is the supplementary income.

Em’s Group is comprised of two female members, who are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the group leader, Em will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay the fee for weeding her land. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her crop output and gain a high yield, so that she can sell the crops for a high price and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to pay the fee for weeding the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Magda Elizabeth

texts.es: Magda, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes, junto a sus tres hijos, yerno y una nieta. Magda lleva 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de golosinas como ser: tajadas de plátano, chicharrones y palomitas de maíz en bolsas en ristras. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y le esta yendo bien. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 7,000 Lempiras y los utilizara en la compra de materia prima como plátanos, sal, condimentos, chicharrones, bolsas etc. para hacer las ristras de tajadas, chicharrones y vender. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en: Magda is 42 years old.  She is a single mother, and lives with her three children, son-in-law, and granddaughter in a community belonging to the town of Choloma, Cortés.   For five years, Magda has been engaged in selling sweets such as plantain slices, pork rinds, and popcorn in bags with string.  She has this business in her home and it is going well.  She is requesting her second loan of 7,000 lempiras and will use the funds to purchase supplies such as plantains, salt, seasonings, pork rinds, bags, etc.  to make the stringed slices and pork rinds to sell. Her dream is to expand her business and earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase supples (oil, plantains, seasonings, bags, salt, pork rinds, etc.)

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is aged 44 and has been blessed with four children. She is a rice grower on one hectare of land, with the support of her husband. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 37,000 KHR per day.

Chanthy and the other two borrowers of this group are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). These borrowers are seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, Chanthy will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income, so that she can enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo, 45 years old, is married and has four school-going children. He owns a house with neither electricity nor water supplied. For the past few years he has been doing business, selling cereals to his customers as a retailer, to earn a living and support his family and pay school fees for his children. 

Kyalo is requesting a loan of KES 10,000. He will use the loan to buy dried beans, maize, cashew nuts, and rice, to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy dried beans, maize, cashew nuts, and rice, to boost his business

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen vive en Guayaquil (Orquídeas), ella tiene 34 años de edad. A ella le gustan las ventas desde hace 10 años, ella se dedica a este tipo de negocio porque le genera ingresos, y así puede obtener dinero para sustentar los gastos del hogar. 

Ella realiza la venta de cosméticos, de ropa,  desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, todos los días. Ella no está casada, no tiene hijos. 

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería como cosmeticos, zapatos, carteras, perfumes. Ella desea para el futuro poder comprarse un vehículo, y seguir trabajando porque ese es el sustento de ella y de sus padres.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 34, lives in Guayaquil (Orquídeas).  She has liked sales for ten years.  She devotes herself to this type of business because it generates income for her.  This way she is able to get money to cover the household expenses.

She sells cosmetics and clothes from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day.  

She is not married, and she does not have children.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like cosmetics, shoes, purses, and perfume.

In the future she wishes to be able to buy a vehicle and to continue working.  This is because this is how she supports herself and her parents.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like cosmetics, shoes, purses, and perfume.

loans.name: Las Tiunfadoras De Santa María Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta unida de hecho, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo y de escolaridad tercero primaria; ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, inició este negocio con un capital de Q.300.00 y hasta la fecha lleva ya 4 años de experiencia en el negocio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro de educacion primaria.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un credito que lo utilizará para la compra de gallinas y chompipes para engordarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro muy cercaco quiere tener una granja de dichas aves. Las demás integrantes se dedican tambiéna a criar aves de corral y a vender ropa típica.
texts.en:
Maria is in a de facto relationship. She is 30 years old and has one primary-school age son. She earns her living raising fowl. This business has a capital value of  Q.300.00 and she has 4 years of experience with the business. She relies on her husband's support, her husband being a primary school teacher.  

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan which she will use to buy chickens and turkeys to fatten and sell. In the near future she hopes to have a farm with these birds. The other members also work raising domestic fowl and selling traditional clothing.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Jose Fausto

texts.es: Don Fausto de 59 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia desde hace varios años, vive con su esposa y sus hijas en casa propia, con las de ventas de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar pero necesita hacerle una mejora a su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le es suficiente para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito para hacerle algunos cambios para que su familia y el puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Fausto is 59 years old.  He has been engaged in farming and cattle raising for several years.  He and his wife and children live in their own home.  With the sales of his crops, he manages to pay some household expenses.  However, he needs to make a home improvement and the income he earns is not enough to pay for it.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to make some changes so that he and his family can live more safely.  .

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Sheyla Vanessa

texts.es: Sheyla es una señorita de 24 años de edad que  estudió la carrera de Ciencias Sociales y Humanidades en una Universidad pública. Estudio esta carrera, pues le gusta enseñar e interactuar con alumnos. Con el  préstamo anterior obtuvo el título profesional en esta especialidad. Es por ello que inscribió en la escuela de posgrado en maestría que dura dos años aproximadamente. El crédito lo requiere para el pago del ciclo en este curso. Realizarse como docente y ser una especialista en pedagogía es su meta, pues luego va a  continuar estudiando pues así asegura ella tendrá mejor oportunidad laboral. Sheyla agradece a los prestamistas Kiva, ya que le permite cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Sheyla is a 24 year old woman who studies social science and humanities at the public university. She studied this major because she likes to teach and interact with students. With the previous loan, she obtained her degree in this specialty. That is why she registered for a post-graduate program for a masters that lasts for approximately two years. She needs the loan to pay for the semester in this course. Becoming a teacher and a specialist in education is her goal. She will continue to study and thus ensure that she has better job opportunities. Sheyla is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since they have allowed her to meet her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course.

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Yoem is married and strives for a living by farming rice on one hectare of land. She has been involved in the current business for 18 years and is able to earn up to 39,500 KHR per day.

Yoem is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as are the other two members of Yoem's group. They are seeking to borrow 1,000,000 KHR, each. As the group leader, Yoem will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the fee for plowing the land. She hopes that she will gain triple yield next harvest, and make more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay the fee for plowing the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhean's Group

texts.en:
Chhean, who lives in Dambae district, Kampong Cham province, is a  51-year-old mother of 11 children. Now, only five children still rely on her, as they are in school. She earns a daily living by farming rice and cassava on four hectares of land. After five years' engagement in the current business, she earns about 20,900 KHR per day.

This is the fifth loan for Chhean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan with success and made good progress in her living status. Now she is in a group of three, to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, and to pay fees for plowing and labor. She hopes to make more income and to sustain her lifestyle in a good pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay fees for plowing and labor

loans.name: Sokkhy

texts.en:
Sokkhy, age 35, lives in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. He is the father of one schoolchild and two children who are too little for school. To feed his kids, he farms rice on 2.5 hectares of land, and cassava on 1.5 hectares. He has been able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the business, for nine years.

His first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was four loan cycles ago. He has completely repaid his previous loan, which has supported his business and returned to him a decent income with which to support his family and keep his child in school. For this new loan cycle, he is going to use his loan to pay fees for plowing and transplanting, and to buy potash to use on his crop. He hopes to earn more income and to improve his living.

loans.use: to pay fees for plowing and transplanting, and to buy potash to use on his crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell. Her earnings helped her to meet her personal, household, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial addition with a glad and thankful heart.

Margarita dreams that her future will be secure and hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Pritty

texts.en:
Pritty, 46, is married and has four children. She owns a house, with neither electricity nor water supplied. She runs a grocery in her residence, and her customers are her neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000. She will use the loan to buy produce to resell, like potatoes, tomatoes, onions and cereals, to help her get profit and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy produce to resell, like potatoes, tomatoes, onions and cereals

loans.name: Manuel Angelo

texts.es:
Manuel de 23 años es estudiante de Administración Industrial en una Universidad local

Manuel eligió esta carrera porque es muy competitiva y tiene mucho futuro en el mercado sus estudios le demandan 6 años de los cuales ya cursa el tercer año, se siente feliz porque su mayor logro será cumplir su objetivo principal, convertirse en un profesional exitoso, durante la semana estudia aproximadamente 25 horas; en la actualidad trabaja en una empresa como auxiliar. Manuel ha solicitado el préstamo para pagar un ciclo de pensiones en la universidad y así continuar con sus estudios, está agradecido por el apoyo de sus padres y también quiere agradecer a los Inversionistas de KIVA quienes hacen posible su préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 23 year old industrial management student at the local university.

Manuel chose this major because it is very competitive and very marketable. He has already finished 3 years of the 6 year program. He is happy because he is working toward his main goal, to become a successful professional.  He studies for approximately 25 hours a week and is currently working for a business as an assistant. He is requesting this loan so he can pay for board at the university and continue with his studies. He is grateful to his parent’s for their support and to all the Kiva lenders who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: pay his university board fees.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Aged 33 and a resident of Kampong Cham province, Chanthy is married and blessed with two children—one schoolboy and one little boy. She has managed one hectare for growing rice and two hectares for growing cassava. The 13 years of experience in the current business has returned her about 41,000 KHR per day. Chanthy has never been with VisionFund before. She is now seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and to pay the fees for weeding and plowing. She hopes to grow her cash-crop fruitfully and in a timely fashion so that she can obtain more income to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the fees for weeding and plowing

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokkhy's Group

texts.en: Residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sokkhy is married and has four children: two who are schoolchildren and two who are farmers. Her main source of income depends on agriculture activity. She grows cassava on two and a half hectares and cashew nuts on the same land. This 10-year-engagement has returned about 32,200 KHR per day. She, a five-time borrower, joins with another borrower, a four-time borrower. She has used her past loan effectively to sustain her living and reduce her family’s burden. In a group of two, she is the leader. She and her joint borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor fees and to buy fertilizer. She hopes to earn more income and build a new house.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, originally from Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, is 36 years old and a widow. She has two children to care for as they are still in school. One hectare of rice cropping and one hectare of cassava planting are the main source of her family's income. To supplement the family’s income, she also works for others for a fee. From the current business, she is able to earn up to 32,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Sophea. She is seeking for 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a high yield and sell it with a good price so she can build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Residing in the local area of Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Sokhom is 32 years old and has three children. She and he husband make a living through slaughtering cows as the main source of family income. She has engaged in the current business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 36,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Sokhom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan with success, and it has improved her living with a positive outcome. For this cycle, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy cows for slaughtering for resale. She hopes to make more income and stabilize her living.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughtering

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokheang's Group

texts.en:
A 38-year-old father of three children (two in school and one too little for school), Sokheang is a villager from Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province. To feed the entire family and, especially, to cover his children’s educational costs, he cultivates rice and cassava. He is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day from this business. He has been doing this work for 16 years.

Sokheang has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four previous loan cycles. Having repaid his previous loan successfully, he feels empowered that he can maintain a good pace of improvement in his living conditions.

Now he is in a group of three, to apply for a new loan. The total loan amount requested by his group is 2,400,000 KHR. Sokheang, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, plans to use the borrowed funds to buy an additional plot of farmland on which to grow more cassava, to buy potash, and to pay the fee for plowing his land. He hopes to make more income and upgrade his living status to a better condition.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland, to buy potash, and to pay the fee for plowing the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She works very hard to provide for them. Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.  She sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, detergent, sardines, and other groceries.

Marilyn is requesting a loan from NWTF for 29,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 40 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She used the money from her previous loan to buy timber, which helped expand her business. She also opened a general store which is doing well. 

Margaret is requesting a second loan, which she will use to purchase more timber to sell as well as more stock, such as rice, sugar, cooking fat, for the shop. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to sell and rice, sugar, and cooking fat for the shop.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sinoun is 33 years old and married. She has four dependent children who are in school. The main source of her family’s income is from a cassava plantation of 5 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for ten years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 24,000 to support her family, and she can save about KHR 3,000 per day for the future needs. 

This is the second loan for Sinoun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund while the other member is a fourth-cycle client. She is now leading her group to request for a loan. As the leader, Sinoun wants to use her portion to pay for plowing the field for her cassava planting and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will increase her crop yields so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To pay for plowing the field for her cassava planting

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a 47 year old married woman from the town of Loon, Bohol in the Philippines. She has three children ages 17, 15 and 13. Pablita earns a living through her hog raising business and food vending business. She sells home cooked snack foods to the people in her village. Pablita is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, banana, flour, cooking oil and feed for the pigs.

In the future, Pablita hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, banana, flour, cooking oil and feed for the pigs

loans.name: 3.1.269.03.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 49 years old and she is married with one child.
Thủy is the group leader of the 3.1.269.03.Thiệu Phú solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 
Her child is grown up so Thủy supports no dependents with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province of Viet Nam.

In 2008, Thủy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes her business will do well allowing her to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is 35 years old and lives in Vedi, Armenia with her two daughters. Yelena graduated from secondary school and got married very early. Because the living standard in Armenia is very bad, Yelena's husband has worked in the Republic of Ukraine for more than five years in order to sustain his family.

Yelena doesn't currently work, but she intends to launch an animal breeding business. This will enable her to meet her family needs and her husband will be able to return to the motherland. Yelena is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to repair her animal barn for animal breeding. Yelena dreams that one day her husband will return to his family from overseas and they both will engage in animal husbandry.

loans.use: To repair her animal barn for animal breeding

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is student from Yerevan town. He is 21 years old and studies at Yerevan State University. Andranik lives with his parents, who work hard to cover the family's basic costs.

It is very difficult for Andranik's parents to sustain the family's living and at the same time save money for their son's education.
Therefore, Andranik has applied for this loan to pay for his university tuition for the second semester. The loan is very important for Andranik to complete his education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sopha, 37, is a married mother of four kids, who lives in Dambae district, of Kampong Cham province. To support the family, Sopha is engaged in rubber tree planting on two hectares of land. She has been involved in this business for two years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day.

This is the third loan for Sopha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her previous loan wisely, to keep up good progress of her living standard. Also, she has repaid her previous loan with success.

For this loan cycle, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, Sopha will use her loan portion to buy bowls, for collecting latex, and to buy potash for growing rubber trees. She hopes to grow her rubber trees with a good yield and produce more latex and make more income.

loans.use: to buy bowls, for collecting latex, and to buy potash for growing rubber trees

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.en:
This is Eufemio. His previous loan was a big help for his business and family. He was able to buy more hogs and feed thus generating more income. He has had this business for four years now. He and his wife, who works in a factory, are working to provide income for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more hogs and sacks of feed. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eufemio dreams to give his family a good future. He also dreams that his child will finish his education. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and hogs needed for his business.

loans.name: Fernand

texts.en: Fernand is a 49 year old woman. She lives with her husband and three working children. She’s friendly and above all a hardworking woman. She’s a tailor; very talented at her job and has more than fifteen years of experience working in the same occupation. She’s well known in her area and works upon client’s requests. In order to provide the family with extra financial support, her husband became a blacksmith. With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase a new tailoring machine as well as mandatory supplies such as textiles, needles, strings and many different items. She is very optimistic and ambitious to open her own tailoring factory as soon as she can, hoping to enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: purchase a new tailoring machine as well as mandatory supplies such as textiles, needles, strings and many different items

loans.name: Voern

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Dambae district, Voern is aged 49 years and married with five children. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and cassava on three-hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for five years, she manages to earn about 30,000KHR per day and can save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs.
 
Voern has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her living. Now she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field and labor fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.en:
Praxedes sells coconut vinegar and wine to the people in her area. Praxedes lives with h r family in Loon, Bohol. 

Praxedes is applying for a loan to buy more coconut vinegar and wine. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income. In the future, Praxedes hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more coconut vinegar and wine

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca is 61 years-old.  She is married and they have been blessed with ten children who are all adults. She is a farmer and she has been in business for 40 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES. 30,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES.42,000 in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  She will plow back the the anticipated income.

This is her fifth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase seed and seedlings.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a grocery store in Makueni town and has been running the business for the past five years.She sells fruit, vegetables as well as charcoal. She is 36 years-old, married and has two children.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, oranges, bananas and carrots which are usually in high demand.  She also plans to buy more stock of charcoal.  She anticipates generating more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business and open a bigger grocery store and sell more grocery food.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Chhoeng

texts.en:
Chhoeng is 28 years old, married and has two small kids. Chhoeng and her spouse are farmers, working together on a few pieces of farmland where they particularly grow rice to supply to their family as food and also keep selling the surplus output to local rice traders. Chhoeng has been involved in farming for more than 5 years.

Chhoeng is now asking for additional capital of 2,000,000 KHR to invest in purchasing farm animals for the maintenance of her rice paddy. These will help ensure good rice production and reduce the operating costs. The loan will help achieve an abundant harvest, which is necessary to attain a progressive life someday.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing farm animals for the maintenance of her rice paddy

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is from Yerevan town. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Elmira's eldest daughter, Liana, studies at Russian-Armenian (Slavonic) University in the economics department.

Elmira and her husband work hard to sustain the family. As she has no financial means to pay for her daughter's education, she has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, Elmira will pay for Liana's university tuition and will give her an opportunity to get higher education and become a good specialist.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 34 years old, from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with one daughter.

Dominic's business did well after the first loan as he was able to meet his customers' demands by making for them the required outfits. He is now applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more stock of fabric materials for making dresses.

He hopes to see his businesses expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fabric materials for making dresses

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Sou is aged 59 years old and married with 11 children, three of whom are in school while the other one is still too young for school.

For the last thirty-nine years, Sou has been farming rice and planting cassava to support his family. With the current business, he can earn about 40,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Sou has been a member of VisionFund for two loan cycles already and he completely paid back the loans, which have enabled him to afford to buy fertilizer for his rice and cassava.

Now he is applying for another loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for his cultivated land and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. He hopes to grow his rice and cassava fruitfully so as to sell if for a good price to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his cultivated land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Felimon

texts.en:
This is Felimon. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase ingredients for fish balls and other street foods. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan in buying more ingredients for street foods and other dainties and sweet meats. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Felimon dreams for the continuous success of his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of fish ball ingredients and other ingredients for dainties and sweet meats needed in his business

loans.name: Savean's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Savean is 50 years old and married with ten children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

She earns a living by farming rice to feed and support her family members. For additional income, Savean also works for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 12 years, she is able to earn about KHR70,000 per day to meet the family’s need.

Savean’s group consists of two members, and they are first cycle clients with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. 

Savean hopes to grow more rice to earn additional income to improve her standard of living, and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Las Flores 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Las Flores 2" se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila las personas de la comunidad se dedican a la siembra de maiz, las integrantes del grupo la mayoria se conocen desde que eran muy pequeñas, cuentan que les gusta vivir en dicha comunidad porque sus fiestas son muy agradables sobretodo la fiesta que le celebran a la Virgen de Guadalupe el 12 de diciembre. Son siete integrantes las que conforman el grupo todas mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables platican que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque les gusto mucho pero tambien porque estuvieron de acuerdo, Luci quien es la representante del grupo tiene 20 años de edad vive en union libre con Marco Antonio desde hace cuatro años juntos han formado una familia con un niño que aun no va a la escuela Luci esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar dos borregos chicos que criara para que se puedan reproducir para que algun dia tenga los suficientes y pueda vender cuando necesite de salir de algun problema economico, desde hace cinco años inicio con la crianza de borregos tenia dos borregos pero los tuvo que vender es por eso que quiere volver a tener sus borreguitos Luci comento "Me gusta mucho la actividad solo que mi unica dificultad en estos mome
ntos es que no cuento con un lugar estable para acomodarlos" Luci cree que si los borregos no tienen un buen establo pueden enfermarse con mayor facilidad por lo frios qe hace todas las mañanas aunque esta situacion no la impide a seguir con la crianza de sus borregos asi algun dia llegar a tener tantos borregos entre grandes y chicos esto ayudara para que la Familia de Luci viva sin preocupaciones economicas. Asi como Luci tambien el resto de las integrantes estan muy contentas porque van a poder recibir un credito que Vision Fund y KIVa les han otorgado Doña Gregoria invertira en sus trajes tipicos, Luisa y Veronica invertiran en su tienda de abarrotes, Rosario invertira en su estetica y crianza de pollos, Ma Rosario invertira en ropa, Doña Juana invertira en dulces y Mariana invertira en pollos.
texts.en:
The "Las Flores 2" group is found located in a very tranquil community in which many people work growing corn.  The majority of the group members have known each other since they were little.  They express that they enjoy living in this community because the festivals are very pleasant, especially the festival to celebrate the Virgen of Guadalupe on December 12th.  There are seven members that make up this group, all of them very hard-working and responsible women.  They they choose the group name because they liked it a lot and everyone agreed.

Luci, who is the group's representative, is 20 years old and has lived with Marco Antonio in a common law marriage for the past four years.  Together they have formed a family with one child who does not yet attend school.  Luci is requesting the loan to be able to purchase two young lambs that she will raise so that they can reproduce and someday she will have enough and can sell them when she encounters financial problems.  She began raising sheep five years ago and had two sheep, but she had to sell them.  For this reason, she wants to have sheep again.  Luci comments "I really enjoy this activity.  The only difficulty is that at this moment, I don't have a stable to accomodate them."  Luci believes that if the sheep don't have a good stable, they may get sick more easily because it is cold in the mornings.  However, this hasn't hindered her from continuing to raise her sheep so that some day, she will have many sheep, both large and small.  This will help Luci's family to live without financial worries.  Like Luci, the rest of the group members are also happy to receive the loan that Vision Fund and KIVA have granted them.  Doña Gregoria will invest in traditional clothing.  Luisa and Veronica will invest in a grocery store.  Rosario will invest in raising chickens. Ma Rosario will invest in clothing.  Doña Juana will invest in sweets and Mariana will invest in chickens.

loans.use: to purchase two lambs.

location.town: Barrio La Cañada, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Elimelech

texts.en:
Elimelech has a tailoring business in the town of Emali. He makes suits, shirts and trousers as well as African attire. He is 37 years of age, married and has two children.

This will be his third loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more materials for sewing, including different types of threads, needles, buttons and tape measures for use. He will use the income generated to provide a good education for his children.

He hopes to expand his tailoring business by opening another tailor shop in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sewing materials.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Alexandra vive en Guayaquil, ella tiene 41 años de edad, ella emprende esta labor de vender porque le gusta mucho.

Ella realiza su trabajo sola desde el medio día hasta las 18:00 de la tarde, vendiendo YAMBAL. La única dificultad que se le atraviesa en su negocio es que su esposo no desea que trabaje en eso. Ella está casada, su esposo es comerciante de ropa. Tiene 5 hijos y estudian en escuelas fiscales.

Ella utilizara el préstamo en la  inversión de productos YAMBAL como perfumes, cremas, cosmeticos, y comprara ropa para la venta comercial. Sus metas para un futuro son tener un vehículo propio, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que terminen la universidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Alexandra lives in Guayaquil. She is 41 years old and began working in sales because she greatly enjoys it.

Alexandra works alone from noon to 6:00 P.M., selling Yanbal products. The only difficulty she faces in her business is whenever her husband does not feel like working. She is married and her husband is a clothing merchant. They have five children who are attending state schools.

Alexandra will use this loan to invest in Yanbal products such as perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. She will also buy clothing to sell. Her goals for the future are to have her own vehicle and to see her children continue their studies and finish university.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is 39 years old, married and has one child.

Stanely used the previous loan well, as he was able to buy more peas that he sold and made good profits from. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD., to enable him to buy more peas to sell.  He is optimistic that his business will do better after this loan.

He hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green peas from farmers to sell

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en: Clarissa, 45 years old, is married to a welder. They are currently residing at the village of Nungnungan 2. She has been managing an auto repair shop in their village for almost 14 years. In this business she earns a net income of 1,000 PHP daily. She would like to avail a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase power tools and interior vulcanizing. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase power tools and interior vulcanizing

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old mother of four children, Pov resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Cambodia. Three of her children are dependent on her and still in school. To support her living, she has been growing maize in the village for ten years while her husband is a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 42,000 KHR per day from the current business. 

This is the first loan for Pov with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her maize plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her maize crop in order to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her maize plantation

loans.name: Ilaz

texts.en:
Ilaz, 26 is married and has one child. He has been working in a café restaurant for a very long time. He earns a very low salary and is now planning to start keeping cows and a calf in order to pay for living expenses. He plans to start keeping cows for milk, cheese and other dairy products for his family.
 
He is asking for a loan to buy a cow and calf. This loan will help him to meet family expenses. He hopes in the future to further expand his farm and to multiply the number of cows he owns. His goal is to improve the life of his family. He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a cow and a calf

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis  es soltero pero convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar, vive en casa propia ocupando un pequeño garzonier las habitaciones son de ladrillo revocados con estuco y el piso es de tablones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Artesanos de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como vendedor repartidor de productos masivos de limpieza, de donde percibe un ingreso salario mensual, la esposa trabaja como niñera percibiendo un salario mensual, es la única actividad que tienen y por lo tanto el único ingreso, ambos se encargan de los gastos familiares y de los pagos de los servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de estuco, pintura para la reparación de paredes de su casa ya que se encuentra deteriorado y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Luis  es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is single and in a common-law relationship with his partner. They have two children who are of school age. Luis lives in his own home, which is a small apartment that has rooms made of brick plastered with stucco. The floors are made of wooden planks. His home is located in the District of Artesanos in the city of El Alto.

Luis currently works as a traveling salesman who markets industrial cleaning products. He receives a monthly salary. His wife works as a nanny and also earns a monthly salary. These jobs are the only ones they have by which to generate an income. Both of them are responsible for the family expenses, such as basic services.

The loan Luis is requesting will be used to buy stucco and paint for repairing the walls of his home. They have deteriorated, so making these repairs will improve his quality of life. Luis dreams of seeing his children become professionals so they also will have a better quality of life.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco and paint for repairing the walls of his home.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 31-years-old and a married mother of 1 child.  She has a boutique business in Emali town where she sells fabric material, dresses, shirts, trousers and even shoes.  She has been in this business for three years and it has been profitable.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD., and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more inventory of fabric material to sell.  She also plans to buy ladies shoes to sell.  

She hopes to expand her business and open a big boutique in one of the market stalls in Emali town, to make more income and to be able to provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy more fabric materials to sell

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Kam Rieng district, Vy, 39, has four children in total. All her children are dependent on her and are still in school. Vy and her husband are farmers who have been growing cassavas for 12 years. The current business earns her about $8 US each day after daily expenses.  

Vy has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now she is applying for a loan.  Vy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow a healthy crop of cassava to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Blerta

texts.en:
Blerta is 30 years old. She is single. She lives with her parents in a southern part of Kosovo.  She used to work as a hairdresser and she is planning to change into a boutique business. She is planning to sell clothes for children. Blerta considers that this business is profitable because there is a demand for children's clothing which will help her to make a profit.

Blerta now requests a loan to buy a large variety of children clothes collection. She is thinking of adding different types of clothes in order to have more customers and to increase her income. She hopes to expand her business and to own a big boutique shop in the future.  Her goal is to expand the business in the future.  She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a children's clothing collection to sell

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
Doña Bertha tiene 56 años de edad, es casada,y vive con su esposo en una colonia de la Ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Hace 8 años ella y su esposo decidieron establecer su propio negocio de pulperia. ella atiende a sus clientes todo el dia y ofrece productos de la canasta basica familiar, como frijoles, arroz, maseca, manteca, harina, carnes, pan, embutidos etc. para mantener su negocio, las ganancias que obtiene las ha podido invertir en mantener surtido de producto que tiene mayor demanda.
ella ha mantenido sus creditos en buen record, por lo cual ahora solicita otro de 21000 lempiras para compra de productos de abarroteria, granos basicos, productos de limpieza, refrescos, etc. con esta inversion piensa mejorar la calidad de servicio ofreciendo variedad de producto a los clientes.Su meta es que su negocio crezca cada dia.
texts.en:
Doña Bertha is 56 years old and married. She and her husband live in a neighborhood in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Eight years ago, Doña Bertha and her husband decided to establish their own grocery business. She attends to the customers every day and offers basic household products such as beans, rice, cornmeal, lard, flour, meat, bread, sausages, and other items in order to maintain the business. Her profits are reinvested into her inventory by purchasing those products that are in great demand.

Doña Bertha has maintained a good credit record. She is now requesting another loan in the amount of 21,000 HNL so that she can buy grocery products, basic grains, cleaning products, soft drinks, and other items. With this investment, she plans to improve the quality of her service and offer a variety of products to her customers. Her goal for her business is to continue growing each day.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, basic grains, cleaning products, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Dusan

texts.en:
Dusan is a 20-year-old single male. He lives in a minority community. He works hard with his agricultural machine on agricultural land belonging to other people in his area. Dusan has had a lot of experience working on the land for many years. He is in need of buying another tractor to work on the land of others. In this way, according to him, he can earn a lot of income. In his village there is a very high demand for people to work on the land with a tractor and they always pay for this service. 

Now Dusan decided for the first time to request a loan in order to buy a tractor. The loan will help him to earn an income for living expenses. He hopes in the future to expand his business to buy more tractors and to hire employees to work for him. His goal is to save money for his future and to get married. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders who are helping him to start his business!

loans.use: to buy a tractor

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem, age 59, living in a rural village of the Bovel district has four children. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassava, maize and sesame in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for ten years. She can earn from her current business about $12.00 to support her family. 

This is the second micro loan for Khem with VisionFund. The past loan that she completely repaid has helped her relieve financial burdens and improve her livelihood. Now requesting a loan, Khem wants to use her portion to buy seeds for her plantation and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. Khem hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her crop plantation so as to make her daily living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Lozila

texts.en: Lozila earns a living through her hog raising business. She is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Loon, Bohol. Lozila works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. Lozila is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business thus augmenting her income. In the future, Lozila hopes of making her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additiional piglets and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La Señora vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 45 años de edad.  Ella empezó con la venta de frutas y plátanos, como vio que salían y que tenía  clientela, decidió ponerse un puesto afuera de su casa. 

Ella realiza la mayoría del tiempo las ventas de las frutas sola, y aveses con la ayuda de sus hijos o la del esposo.  La dificultad que le impide vender sus frutas y platanos es el invierno en esas ocasiones las ganancias bajan, y tambien otro de los impedimentos es que no tiene una de sus estremidades para caminar con normalidad.si tiene hijos pero son mayores de edad.

Ella utilizara el préstamo para incrementar su negocio con comprar las frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, papayas, melones, etc. Sus sueños son que su negocio crezca para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This woman lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She is 45 years old and began selling bananas and other fruits as a way of getting ahead. She was able to gain customers, so she decided to set up a stand outside of her home.

The borrower spends most of her time selling fruits by herself. Sometimes she has the help of either her children or her husband. The difficulty she faces in selling fruit is having to do it during the winter because sometimes the profits are low. Another impediment she must deal with is a missing extremity that prevents her from walking normally. All of her children are grown.

The borrower will use the loan to increase her business by purchasing fruits such as bananas, oranges, papayas, melons, and other types of produce. Her dreams include growing her business so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, papayas, melons, and other fruits.

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en una aldea ubicada en el Departamento de Gracias, Lempira.
El ha crecido en familia dedicada a la agricultura, hace 5 años el trabaja una parcela de tierra donde tiene cultivado café y granos básicos. Estos productos los comercializan a intermediarios por la cual recibe buen precio. Sus ingresos son rentables y ha podido mantenerse con los gastos del hogar.
Solicita 7000 lempiras siendo ya su segundo préstamo con Odef, y necesita comprar fertilizante para darle una mejor asistencia a la finca. Con esta inversión piensa que sus cultivos mejoraran y obtendrá mejores cosechas para la venta.
Su plan es seguir cultivando y dandole el mantenimiento necesario.
texts.en:
Elvin is 24 years old, single, and lives in a neighborhood in the Department of Gracias, Lempira. He grew up in a farming family. For the past five years, he has worked a parcel of land on which he grows coffee and basic grains. These products are sold to brokers who offer him a good price. His earnings are profitable and he is able to sustain the household expenses.

Elvin is requesting 7,000 HNL as his second loan from ODEF. He needs to buy fertilizer so that he can better maintain his farm. With his investment, he intends to improve his crops and obtain better harvested produce to sell. His plans include continuing to cultivate his crops and providing them the necessary maintenance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Nelli

texts.ru:
Нелли 47 лет и живет с мужем в городе Капан. У нее есть две дочери, которые тоже замужем и живут отдельно от своих родителей. Нелли  после школы поступила в Ереванский Политехнический институт на факультет электротехники и окончила с отличием. С 2000 года она работает в Сюникском  региональном агентстве. Муж Нелли работает  электриком.  С 2004 года  Нелли и ее семья  занимаются сельскохозяйством. У Нелли есть  огород  где   выращивает овощи, фрукты, орехи. Нелли и ее муж имеют постоянных клиентов и продают сельскохозяйственную продукцию от их огорода. 
Нелли нужен кредит на сумму 750.000 Армянских драм для покупки семян новых сортов, саженцев и для ремонта труб ирригационной системы.
texts.en: Nelli is 47 years old and lives with her husband in Kapan.  She has two daughters who are also married and no longer live at home with their parents.  After high school, Nelli enrolled and Yerevan Polytechnic Institute to study electrical engineering.  She graduated with honors.  Since 2000, she has worked at a regional agency.  Nelli's husband works as an electrician.  Since 2004, Nelli and her family have worked in agriculture.  Nelli has a garden where she grows vegetables, fruits and nuts.  She and her husband have loyal clients to whom they sell the harvests from their garden.  Nelli needs a loan of 750,000 Armenian dram to buy a new assortment of seeds, saplings, and to pay for repairs to their irrigation system.

loans.use: То buy new varieties of seeds, seedlings and pipe to repair irrigation systems

loans.name: Grima Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Grima vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 39 años de edad. Ella empezó vendiendo caramelos en las afuera de un colegio, luego reunió dinero y compro juguetes porque pensó que le traería más ingresos económicos. Ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes lo realiza sola, desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde.

La dificultad que ella tiene en su negocio es dejar a sus hijos solos, porque puede ser peligroso. Ella es viuda, tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 6, 9 y 16 años de edad.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería (juguetes): muñecas, carros plásticos, confites, etc. Ella desea hacer crecer su negocio y darles un mejor estilo de vida y mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Grima lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She is 39 years old. Grima began selling caramels outside of a school. With the money she earned, she later bought toys because she thought it would bring in more income. She sells toys by herself from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.

The difficulty she faces in her business is having to leave her children alone because it can be very dangerous. Grima is a widow and has four children (ages 3, 6, 9, and 16).

She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as toy dolls, plastic cars, candy, and other items. Grima wants to grow her business and provide her children an education and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy toys and candy.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустаму 39 лет. Он женат. У него есть сын и две дочери. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Вахдат в 20 километрах к востоку от столицы Таджикистана. Рустам работает в сфере торговли более 7 лет. На рынке города у него есть торговая точка, где он занимается продажей мужской и женской обуви. Рустам в месяц дважды оптом закупает товар с центрального рынка города Душанбе, привозит товар в свой город и затем продает в розницу. Сейчас Рустам запрашивает кредит для закупа сезонной мужской и женской обуви на продажу.
texts.en: Rustam is 39 years old, married and has 1 son and 2 daughters.  He and his family live in the city Vahdat, 20 kilometers to the west of Tajikistan's capital Dushanbe.  Rustam has worked in trade for more than 7 years.  He has space at a city market where he sells his wares: men's and women's footwear.  Rustam buys goods in bulk twice each month in Dushanbe and brings them back to his own city.  Now, he is asking for a loan to buy seasonal footwear for men and women.

loans.use: To buy seasonal men's and women's footwear to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
La señora Eva Emilia es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando; se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, inició este negocio con 4 gallinas y hasta el momento tiene 18 años de experiencia. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamos que lo va utilizar para la compra de 3 docenas de pollos y concentrado para las mismas, en el futuro quiere tener una granja grande; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesanía.

En la fotografía aparecen 11 integrantes, pero una de ellas no lleno los requisitos y por lo tanto no se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva Emilia is 51 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to attend school. Eva Emilia has three children, two of whom are studying. She raises chickens for fattening. Eva Emilia started her business with four hens and now she has 18 years of experience. She also has the support of her husband who is a farm laborer.

Eva Emilia organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy three dozen chickens and concentrated feed. In the future, she wants to have a large farm. The other members of the group engage in trade and handicrafts.

There are 11 members who appear in the photo because one of them did not meet the requirements. Therefore, she will not be participating in this loan.

loans.use: to buy three dozen chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 25 years old and is married with two children.

Beatrice is a tailor and has applied for her fourth loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy materials to add to her stock so as to be able to make nice outfits for her clients.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future, and to be able to open up a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru: Джамолиддин трудолюбивый человек. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Дети еще не трудоспособные. Он более 6 лет занимается услугой перевозки строительных материалов. Он преподносит услуги местным жителям, так как он живет в отдаленном регионе и местные жители покупают строительные материалы из города и центральных районов. Он последнее время не может работать, так как его грузовик сломался, и он должен проводить ремонт. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для ремонта грузовика. Он надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jamoliddin, aged 35, is a hardworking man.  He is married and raising four children who are still too young to work.  

He has been involved in the transportation of building materials for more than six years.  He provides his services to the residents of his district, as he lives in a remote area, and building materials have to be brought from the city and the central districts.  Recently, he hasn't been able to work because his truck broke down and he needs to fix it.

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 somoni to repair his truck.  He is looking forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Naomi Lom Group

texts.en:
Lhingboi is a group member in the Naomi group, and she is the featured borrower member with her hand raised. She works hand in hand with her husband to manage the household expenses and says, “We work together for our dreams to come true”.  She weaves for income while her husband is a carpenter to support the family. 

Lhingboi says weaving without a loom is painful for her backbone and a lot of time is consumed to finish the woven products. She wanted to get a loom, but always failed because she has three kids to take care of. Providing them with education is not a small task for irregular incomes like theirs. She could weave only two or three wrap-around skirts in a month, provided she is in good health. The amount she gets after the sales are not sufficient to start a weaving business. There never was a time where she could spare her savings to get a loom. On the other hand, her husband earns money by woodworking, which provides an unreliable income. He gets orders for furniture and most of the time, he fails to deliver them on time because he can’t afford to buy advanced tools for his woodworking. 

With the Kiva loan, Lhingboi will get a loom and try to secure her business by producing more woven products with the help of the loom. She also says that her chance for weaving at middle age is very low but with the loom, she can continue her weaving activity for a long time. And with the returns, she is planning to get advanced tools for her husband, to enable him to be successful in his business, too.  

She says that both her husband and herself will continue their businesses until their kids can replace them and manage the family. She is thankful towards Kiva and WSDS for the support and wishes you great success in your own ventures.

loans.use: to purchase a loom for weaving.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old. She operates as a fast food vendor in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is a divorced mother of one child and supports three other people. She has been in this business for the last two years and has done great.

This marks her first borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will purchase sacks of potatoes from farmers for her food kiosk, and will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her child. 

She hopes to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes for her food kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, toilet paper, dairy products, eggs, meat, chicken and vegetables, among others.

loans.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 72 años de edad, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes junto a su conyugue y un hijo. El tiene 8 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería y venta de verduras. Vende variedad de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, pan, churros, embutidos, tomate, repollo, chile, papas, etc. el ha tenido varios prestamos con los que ha mantenido estable su negocio, con este préstamo actual que solicita lleva 20 ciclos de prestamos. El préstamo es por 21,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir con nuevos productos en verduras, granos básicos, refrescos, lácteos y otros. Su plan es obtener mejores ingresos cada dia mediante la inversión de préstamos.
texts.en: Don Juan is a 72-year old man who lives in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes with his wife and son. He has had his own grocery store and vegetable stand for 8 years and sells a wide variety of food products, such as basic grains, dairy products, sodas, bread, churros, cold meats, tomatoes, cabbage, chilli, potatoes, etc. He has had several loans in the past which have helped to maintain his business stable, with this new loan representing his 20th loan cycle. He's requesting a loan of 21,000 HNL to buy vegetables, basic grains, sodas, dairy products and others. His plan is to improve results each day thanks to loan investments.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, dairy products, sodas, churros, bread, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora y que a pesar de sus 51 años de edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarla. Ella es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 5 hijos de los cuales en familia trabajan la agricultura el mayor de todos es casado y los otros 4 viven con ella y la menor de todos estudia en la escuela. Ella aprendió esta actividad hace más de 18 años inculcada por sus padres su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local y otros. Esta actividad les ha dado fruto por mucho tiempo y es el único medio de ingreso que ellos tienen para el sustento de su familia y su hogar cubriendo las necesidades básicas como ser alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. Que a diario se presentan. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 50 metros de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie y eso les permite dar un mejor mantenimiento y protección. La tierra que trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia de parte de sus suegros.  

Doña Marina solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para su cultivo de café, ya que hoy en día esta clase de productos son caros y la (roya) que es una enfermedad que afecta los cultivos de café si no se trata a tiempo es posible que se contamine y se pierda la cosecha completa.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo.
texts.en:
Marina is a happy, hardworking, and entrepreneurial woman, and despite her 51 years, she hasn’t stopped dreaming big. She didn’t have the opportunity to study because her parents didn’t have much money and they couldn’t help her. She is married and has 5 children who all work in agriculture. The oldest is married and the other 4 live with her. The youngest is studying in school. She learned this activity more than 18 years ago, taught by her parents. She sells her product near her home to neighbors, people who sell on a small scale in the local market, and others. This business has worked for them for a long time and it is their only income for the family, covering their basic necessities, such as food, clothing, medicines, etc. Their crop is located 50 meters from their house, and they go there everyday. This allows them to give their crop better maintenance and protection. The land that they work is their own, thanks to an inheritance from her in-laws.

Marina is requesting help to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and a spraying pump for their coffee crop. These types of products are expensive nowadays, and the roya, which is a [fungal] disease that affects the coffee plants if they aren’t treated in time, could contaminate the crop and they could lose the entire harvest. 

Her dream for the future is to have a large coffee farm, one that could continue giving them blessings, a source of income for the family, and that could be worked from generation to generation by her children and her grandchildren; they could make good use of her and her husband’s hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and a spraying pump for her coffee crop.

loans.name: 05.04.42 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a food stall/restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make the food she sells. Bình has been involved in this business for 8 years.
Bình is 55 years old and is married with 5 grown children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
Bình is the group leader of the 05.04.42 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.
In 2010, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main harship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital.
Bình hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make the food she sells.

loans.name: Naykea's Group

texts.en:
A 29-year-old mother residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Naykea has three children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice while her husband is a paid worker. Having been in this business for several years, Naykea and her husband can earn about KHR 25,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.
Naykea’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she a first cycle client while her group member is a third cycle client with VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Naykea, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for plowing and labor. She hopes to harvest more cassava to increase her family’s income which will allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for plowing and labor costs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 41 years old from Nakuru and is married with five children who are between 25 and 18 years old.
Alex has a retail shop which he runs and he has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy soft drinks, sugar, flour, eggs etc. to add to his stock to sell. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.
He hopes to buy a pick-up in the near future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, flour, eggs, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 36 años de edad , esta casada con Héctor, con quien tiene 3 hijos y desde hace 8 años ellos viven en la casa que construyeron con mucho esfuerzo , el cual se ubica en un anexo agrícola.Mercedes se dedica a la agricultura. No es fácil su labor y más aún con una pequeña hija, pero Mercedes es admirable, y se esfuerza en la tierra. Gracias a esa dedicación ahora cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios. Por ello siembra papas y arvejas, en mayor cantidad, pero también cultiva maíz, habas y flores de gladiolos pero no es seguido. Además cuenta con 2 toros para el arado y 2 burros para la carga de sus cosechas. Ella y su esposo están muy contentos y felices, puesto que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura, ya que cada cosecha le genera dinero. Por ello está convencida de progresar mediante sus cultivos y, de ese modo ahorrar para adquirir más terrenos y evitar pagar el derecho de alquiler. Sus planes más próximos son sembrar arvejas y papas, para ello solicita otra vez de su apoyo. Mercedes, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríosy  agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe , motivo por el cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
36- year old Mercedes is married to Hector and they have three children. For eight years now they have lived in the house they built after much hard work. It is located in a farming area as Mercedes works in agriculture. It's not easy work and even more difficult with a little daughter, but Mercedes does a good job. Thanks to her hard work she now has her own land and crops. She grows potatoes and peas for the most part, but also corn, beans, and gladioli flowers at different times. She also has two bulls for ploughing and two donkeys for transporting the products.

Mercedes and her husband are very happy as they enjoy farming and each harvest brings in money. She is sure that the way forward is through agriculture and saving money to buy more land so they don't have to spend it renting land. Her short-term plans are to grow peas and potatoes so she is once again seeking a loan. She plans to spend S/. 3000 on organic fertilizer to spread on her fields. She is grateful for the financial assistance she receives so promises to make the repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: 05.08.01 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung operates a food stall selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making drinks to sell. She has been involved in this business for 6 years.
Nhung is 54 years old and is married with 2 grown children.  She and her husband live in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Nhung is the group leader of the 05.08.01 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.
In 2009, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main harship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.
Nhung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making drinks to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 35-year-old farmer. He is married to Lydia. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES. 15,000 which he uses to support his family.
Geoffrey is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully.
He will use the loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and insecticides. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to improve his living standards and sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and  insecticides.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru: Улугбеку 30 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена очень умелая портниха и имеет своих клиентов. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе. Улугбек более 1 года занимается бизнесом. Он взял в аренду помещение, которое находится не далеко от больницы. Он открыл столовую и продает разные национальные блюда. Он очень хороший повар и вкусно готовит. Благодаря хорошему сервису он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. До этого бизнеса он работал на многих местах, но он не мог развивать себя и свою работу. С текущим бизнесом он справляется отлично. Он хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получить больше дохода. Он должен купить новые бытовые техники и не обходимые овощи для приготовления разнообразных блюд. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони. Он обещает погасить займ во время. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ulugbek is 30 years old. He is married and has 2 children in his care. His wife is a skilled seamstress with a number of regular clients. The couple's children are underage and attend secondary school. 

Ulugbek has been running his own business for over a year. He has opened a cafe on rental premises located near a hospital where he serves various traditional dishes. Ulugbek is a skilled cook whose good service has attracted steady customers. Previously, he worked in a number of different jobs, but was unable to develop personally or professionally. He is now taking excellent care of his new business.

Ulugbek would like to raise his working capital, thereby increasing his profits. He needs to buy new appliances, as well as stock up on vegetables for cooking various dishes. He is requesting a loan of 7500 somoni. Ulugbek promises to repay the loan on time and counts on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy appliances and foodstuffs for his cafe

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
