Marissa is a 49-year-old married woman from Loboc, Bohol. She engages in a motorcycle transport business and sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her area.
Marissa is asking for loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle, and additional stocks for her store like canned goods, noodles, bread, candies and rice and other items.
In the future, Marissa hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle, and additional stocks for her store like canned goods, noodles, bread, candies and rice and other items.

loans.name: Dilcia Ismenia

texts.es:
Dilcia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive con su familia en la Ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Hace 6 años Dilcia inicio su propio negocio vendiendo cremas, lociones, ropa, utensilios de cocina. Sus ventas las hace de manera ambulante y por encargo. Esta actividad le ha ayudado mucho a superarse con los ingresos y con los  financiamientos ha podido trabajar e invertirlos bien. 
Ella es una persona muy responsable, y solicita su noveno préstamo de 7000 lempiras para comprar mas mercadería para la venta y solventar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes como cosméticos, lociones, ropa. esto le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y tener variedad para vender.
La meta es seguir trabajando para darle a su hija la ayuda necesaria.
texts.en:
Dilcia is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her family in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Six years ago, Dilcia started her own business of selling crèmes, lotions, clothing, and cooking utensils. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor and by taking orders. The business has been a great help financially and the loans have been invested well and put to good use.

Dilcia is a very responsible person. She is requesting her ninth loan in the amount of 7,000 HNL so that she can buy more merchandise to sell and fulfill some of her pending orders. Dilcia will acquire cosmetics, lotions, and clothing in order to increase her inventory and have more variety to sell. Her goal is to keep working so that she can provide her daughter the help that she needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, lotions, and clothing.

loans.name: Gennadiy

texts.ru:
Геннадий   - фермер. С 1978 года занимается выращиванием арбуза, дыни и капусты.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и двое детей  26-ти и 27-ми лет. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания лука в открытом грунте.
Геннадий решил приобрести пленку для защиты от холода ветра, а также капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  приобрести трактор с навесным оборудованием для вспашки и обработки  своего земельного участка.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en:
Gennadiy is a farmer. Since 1978, he has been cultivating water melons, cantaloupes and cabbage. His wife and his two children, who are 26 and 27 years of age, help Gennadiy with his business. Gennadiy started his farm by growing onions in open ground.

Gennadiy has decided to purchase plastic film to protect his plants from cold and wind, as well as a drip irrigation hose. In the future, he plans to buy a tractor with attachments for ploughing and cultivating his land. Gennadiy would also like to finish building his family's new home. Presently, he needs your help to finance his purchase of plastic film and irrigation hose.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film and a drip irrigation hose

loans.name: Amalia Felipa

texts.es:
Amalia es una mujer de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con hijo y sus nietos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que siempre dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Amalia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos postres para engreír a sus nietos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Amalia trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Amalia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de los útiles escolares y uniformes de sus nietos, los cuales actualmente se encuentran a su cargo, de esta manera ella podrá brindarles los materiales necesarios para que cursen adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus nietos profesionales.
texts.en:
47-year old Amalia lives in the town of Ica in Santiago district with her son and grandchildren. She loves them very much and they are her main reason for living. Amalia is a very friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic person who always puts in a lot of effort to help her family get on in life. Unfortunately because she is poor and has had to work since she was very young, she couldn't study nursing which is what she wanted to do. In her free time she enjoys cooking delicious desserts as treats for for her grandchildren.

Through her own initiative and after much effort and dedication, Amalia now works as a laborer for a local agricultural foundation. She works every day for 10 hours and all is going well because of her hard work and the pleasant way she treats other people.

Amalia is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to buy school supplies and uniforms for her grandchildren whom she currently looks after. In this way she will be able to provide them with the materials they need for their studies. She will continue working hard so she can achieve her great dream of seeing her grandchildren get good good jobs.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for her grandchildren

loans.name: Ng'ombe

texts.en:
Ng'ombe is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for her third Kiva loan to buy ten sacks of charcoal to re-sell. She will invest the profits back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of charcoal to re-sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Шарофат молодая женщина в возрасте 24 лет. Замужем имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж занимается строительными работами. Сама Шарофат швея. Она шьет национальные платья.  Принимает заказы дома.  Также Шарофат у себя дома откармливает скот. Этим делом она занимается с самого детства. Ее родители научили ее этому делу. Этот вид деятельности дает очень хороший доход,поэтому Шарофат хочет развивать этот бизнес. 
На полученный кредит Шарофат планирует купить  скот и увеличить поголовье. Надеется на своевременную поддержку от Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Sharofat is a young woman who is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband does construction jobs. Sharofat is a seamstress. She sews traditional dresses and takes orders home. Also Sharofat feeds cattle at home. She has been in this business since childhood. Her parents taught her this business. This type of business brings very good income and that's why Sharofat wants to grow it.

She plans to use the loan to buy cattle to increase headcount. She hopes on timely support from Arvand and is thanking in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is known for being a hard-working person with many entrepreneurial ideas. She has a medical clinic, which helps her generate income to support her family.

She is applying for another loan of KES 45,000. She will use the loan funds to pay school fees for her children. She wants to provide better education for her children and see them become useful people in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony has been married for more than 15 years. He has four children. Two of them already attend school, and the two are still young. 

Antony has a kiosk set up in his home. He says that he has many good customers because he is located near the main town. Antony has been a merchant for more than two years and is considered to be a hardworking and determined individual. Every day he wakes up in the early hours to get ready for work, attend to his business, and purchase merchandise for his shop.


He is requesting a loan to buy more products to offer in his kiosk such as candy, beverages, and other items. Antony sees this loan as a good investment opportunity so that he can expand the variety of products that he offers.

loans.use: To buy more products to offer in his kiosk such as candy, beverages, and other items

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is from the town of Kisauni. She's married and has four children, all attending school and are dependent on her. She makes a living buying and selling firewood and charcoal from the rural areas. She has very good stable customers and a good income. 

She's requesting this loan to buy bundles of firewood and charcoal so she can continue giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Denis

texts.ru:
Денис   - фермер. С 1988 года занимается выращиванием арбуза и дыни.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания бахчевых культур в открытом грунте.
Денис решил купить семена дыни для расширения посевной площади.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  расширить свои посевные площади дыни и арбуза, посадить клубнику в теплице.
В личных планах:  Приобрести автомобиль.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования семян дыни.
texts.en:
Denis is a farmer. Since 1988, with his wife's help, he has been cultivating water melons and cantaloupes. Denis started farming by growing melons in open ground.

Denis has decided to purchase melon seeds in order to expand the area of land under cultivation. His future business plans include continued expansion of his water melon and cantaloupe plantings, as well as cultivation of strawberries in a greenhouse. Denis's personal goal is to purchase an automobile. Presently, he needs your help to finance the purchase of melon seeds.

loans.use: to purchase melon seeds

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Hawanatu. She is married and has three children aged 15, 12 and 10 years. In 2000, Hawanatu established her local foodstuff (groundnuts, rice and beans) business. She began her business as a way to support her husband in taking good care of the home. 

Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 600,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy 10 bags beans at 450,000 SLL, and will use the balance of 1,500,000 SLL to buy local rice. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Hawanatu plans to rent a big store so that she will become a leading supplier of local foodstuffs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of beans at 450,000 SLL and use the balance of 1,500,000 SLL to buy local rice.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a businessman who lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a vehicle garage, where he provides mechanical repairs of the vehicles of his clients. The business has been in operation for one year.

He was introduced to Milango by his relative. He joined in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings, which he will use to buy vehicle spare parts and lubricants. He believes he can grow the business and employ more people, and his main focus now is to meet the basic needs.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and has four school-going children. She owns a house with electricity but without piped water. For the last seven years she has been selling vegetables and she wants now to start buying cereals to sell to her customers.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to buy more vegetables, dry maize, beans, and rice to sell in her shop to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, dry maize, beans, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE ALEGRES” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dominga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: agricultura, venta de ganado porcino y ovino, venta de comida, venta de ganado vacuno.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dominga es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de agricultura (producción de papa); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace años y en la actualidad trabaja con este negocio para generar recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semillas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The 8-member Siempre Alegres group will begin their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya central group. Sra. Dominga is president of the Board of Directors. The members run a variety of businesses: farming, pig and sheep sales, food sales, and cattle sales.

The loan they are seeking will benefit all the women's businesses. President Dominga notes that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of one of the advisors who came to her house. Currently she works in agriculture growing potatoes. She learned how to do this from her parents years ago, and now the work enables her to earn money. 

The loan she is seeking will be used to increase working capital so she can buy seeds from distributors and then sell them in the markets of El Alto town. This work enables her to earn money so she can support her family as best she can. She is married and has three children.

When she is asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, Dominga replies that she likes the loans, and the training about credit and health.

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Martha Odilia

texts.es: Doña Martha de 49 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 12 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia , es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has a shop where she sells essential items such as beans, milk, eggs and bread. She has had this business for 12 years and this has provided her with sale experience which has allowed her to increase her sales. It is located in her house, and is well-known by the inhabitants of the area. She has a lot of customers, since her shop is well-stocked. 

Martha wants to expand her business and carry out a new investment buy she needs capital and for this reason she is asking for a loan so that she can buy the necessary items for her shop and in this way improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha de 39 años, vive en compañía de su esposo José y sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa de su padre desde hace 14 años. Desde hace 2 años, comenzó su negocio de venta de comida, jugos, golosinas y demás alimentos en la casa de sus padres; en donde le permiten ejercer su negocio. Junto con su esposo, decidieron vender platos típicos y hacer un restaurante campestre en su terreno, aún no concretan su sueño, pero se encuentran ahorrando y cada vez que pueden, mejoran la infraestructura de su local. Mientras tanto todos los días prepara comidas como desayuno y almuerzos de manera diaria  para los trabajadores de construcción que laboran cerca de su hogar, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha visto que este negocio es rentable a pesar de las diversas dificultades como el alza repentina del precio de los alimentos. Por esta razón ideó una estrategia para abastecerse de los ingredientes no perecibles, comprando en grandes cantidades, ya que así reduce el costo de su inversión.En todo este tiempo aprendió a invertir en su negocio de manera responsable y eficiente ,por ello ser compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
Martha, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para vender en su pequeña tienda y también para la preparación de los alimentos. Piensa comprar al por mayor arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, fideos y demás productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children, whom she has cared for in her father's house for 14 years. Two years ago, she started her business selling food, juices, snacks and more in her parents' house, where they let her run her business. with her husband, she decided to sell traditional food and make a rural restaurant on their land. They still haven't made their dream come true, but they are saving and whenever they can, they improve the infrastructure on their locale. Meanwhile, every day they prepare meals such as breakfasts and lunches every day for the construction workers who work close to their home. This whole time she has worked she has seen that this business is profitable despite different problems such as sudden price spikes in food. For this reason, she came up with the strategy of stocking up on non-perishable ingredients, buying them in large quantities, since this reduces the cost of her investment. She has learned to invest in her business in a responsible and efficient way, and that is why she is committed to making her payments on time.

Martha will invest the S/.3000 soles in buying basic necessity products to sell in her little store and also to prepare the food. She plans on buying rice, sugar, oil, milk, pasta and other products that are non-perishable.

loans.use: to buy food wholesale such as sugar, rice, milk, and more.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy, de 39 años es una mujer emprendedora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó hace 5 años. Ella es una valerosa madre soltera, gusta mucho de trabajar con esmero,  pues de ella depende la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Trabaja desde las primeras horas del día, pues hace 2 años decidió abrir una tienda de comestibles en su casa, en vista de la carencia de una en la zona. En todo este tiempo aprendió a satisfacer las necesidades de los pobladores, es por esa razón que ofrece además de los alimentos no perecibles, carnes, verduras, granos verdes  y legumbres, “mis alimentos no se estropean, pues tengo clientes que en el día compran la mayoría de mis vegetales y la carne se vende mucho más rápido”, comenta.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, aprendió a invertir en su negocio de manera responsable y eficiente y por ello se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Edy, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de verduras, legumbres y carne para su venta; pues sus clientes consumen muchos de estos alimentos.
texts.en:
Edy, 39, is an entrepreneur who lives with her two children in the house she inherited five years ago.  She is a courageous, single mother who enjoys working hard to provide her children with a good education and a healthy diet.  In view of the need for a grocery store in her neighborhood, she opened one in her house two years ago and learned to satisfy the needs of the locals.   She starts work very early in the morning and offers, in addition to the non-perishable goods, items such as meat, vegetables, green grains and pulses.  "My food does not go bad because I have customers who buy most of my vegetables every day, and the meat sells even more quickly.", she says.  

This is her first KIVA loan and she has learned to invest in her business responsibly and efficiently.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Edy will use the 1,000 PEN to buy vegetables, pulses and meat because this is what her customers consume most.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, pulses and meat.

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua is a 46-year-old retail shop and cafe owner in Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children whose spouse provides the family with additional income. She has been in this business for the last seven years and has done great.

This marks her fifth borrowing with KADET LTD, after servicing her previous loans successfully. She will purchase a stock of sugar, milk, maize flour, cooking fat and wheat flour for her shop. 

She will use the anticipated profit to renovate her cafe. She hopes to succeed in life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, milk, maize flour, cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, de 47 años, es una mujer admirable ya que cuidó sola a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en la casa que adquirió hace 14 años.Marina se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante , el cual fue equipando poco a poco ya que compró lo necesario para encaminar su negocio. Al principio fue difícil, pero ahora cuenta con una cocina industrial y un local equipado, todo ello gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Tiene gran clientela, pues la zona donde se encuentra su negocio es comercial y hay afluencia de personas, sobre todo los días domingos donde hay feria comercial. Ahora ella espera mejorar los platos que sirve, para tener mayor clientela y mejores ganancias.Marina, invertirá los S/.2300 soles en la compra de un saco de arroz y un saco de azúcar, latas de aceite, cajas de leche para poder preparar sus alimentos y mejorar su restaurante, de igual forma Marina se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
texts.en:
Marina, 47, is an admirable woman, considering that she raised her three children on her own. Two of them are still living with her in a house she bought fourteen years ago. Marina sells food in her restaurant, equipped step by step with all the necessary things. It was difficult at first, but now she has an industrial kitchen and a well-equipped establishment thanks to her hard work and commitment. Marina has a great customer base, because she is located in a well-frequented and commercial area, especially during the weekly Sunday fair. She hopes to improve her menu in order to attract more customers and improve her profits.

Marina will use the 2,300 soles [PEN] to buy a bag of rice, oil cans and milk to prepare her food and improve her restaurant. She promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant, such as rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida.
Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable tiene 6 meses de haber establecido un negocio de elaboracion y venta de juguitos naturales de sabores, el producto lo empaca en bolsas para despues venerlos.  Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y tambien venta ambulante.Ella ha recibido varios prestamos con Odef los cuales le han ayudado mucho a incrementar su negocio. Actualmente solicita otros de 21,000 lempiras y lo necesita para el pago de complemento en la compra de un vehiculo, el cual utilizara como herramienta de trabajo, asi se le hara mas facil la mobilizacion para vender el producto.Su meta es lograr extenderse a otros lugares para que sus ventas aumenten y tener la solvencia economica que ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 47, is married and has three children, and lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida.

She is a very hard-working, responsible person who set up her business six months ago.  She makes natural juices in different flavors which she sells by the bag.  She works both at home and as a street vendor.  She has received several loans through ODEF which have helped increase her business.  Currently, she is requesting 21,000 HNL to buy a vehicle for work.  This will make it easier for her to sell her product.  Her goal is to open in other markets to increase sales so she can provide her family with a stable income.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for work.

loans.name: 02.03.08 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huế operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Hue is 36 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives with her dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the group leader of the 02.03.08 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit for resale.

In the future, Huế hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages 16 and 19 years old. They all live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She said she is good at managing her home and business. She has been running a shop for the past 18 years in the local market, learning this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her sales. She likes her business because her daily sales are high. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her sales.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 sons. She is a pensioner on disability. 16 years ago her husband decided to raise livestock as this brings in at least a small income. This is their cooperative business. 

When the children were small there was enough money, but when they grew up and got into higher education levels, spending increased, and now Zamina and her husband try to work as hard as they can. 

Raising livestock is the main source of income for the family. Zamina sells milk, yogurt, cheese and butter. She wants to buy more livestock for this purpose. She hopes for a loan from VFAC to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  6 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito del  Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “María Elena Moyano” una de ellas es la Sra. Carmen   de 54 años de edad soltera y con  4 hijos, la Sra. Carmen   se dedica ya hace 7 años a la venta de  gaseosas, golosinas en un pequeño puesto todos los días,  la Sra. Carmen nos cuenta que a llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en una pequeña bodega  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: This is a group made up of 6 responsible women who work in different commercial activities. All of them live in the district of Agustino. These are the members of the “María Elena Moyano” communal bank. One of them is Carmen. She is 54 years old, single and has 4 children. Carmen has worked for 7 years selling sodas and snacks in a small sales spot every day. Carmen tells us that she has earned regular customers and is generating income to cover the household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own locale where she can sell her products and make more income. With the loan she has been given she will invest in a small store and thus have more income. She gives a hug to Kiva and says she will meet all of the goals she has set.

loans.use: to invest in a small store.

loans.name: Leslie Lizzeth

texts.es:
Leslie tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Lesli tiene desde hace 2 años un taller de costura. Ella aprendio esta actividad realizando cursos de talleres de alta costura. Confecciona vestidos de novia, trajes formales para eventos como graduaciones etc. Manifiesta que esta muy satisfecha con el trabajo que hace tiene sus clientes fijos y el ingreso que genera ayuda para solventar gastos del hogar. Ella ha trabajado varios creditos con Odef, actualmente solicita 20000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos, agujas, botones, zipers etc. Esta segura que con esta inversion resolvera en tener el material necesario para sacar sus pedidos a tiempo.La meta que tiene es crecer en su negocio y economicamente.
texts.en:
Leslie, 26, is married and lives with her husband in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

For two years she has been working as a seamstress in her workshop.  She took courses in high fashion sewing and makes wedding dresses and gowns for events such as graduation ceremonies, etc.  She claims she is very satisfied with the work she does since she has fixed customers and the income she earns helps cover household expenses.  She has had several ODEF loans and is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 HNL to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons, zippers, etc.  She is sure this investment will give her the materials she needs to deliver orders on time.  Her goal is to expand her business and grow economically.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, fabric, needles, buttons, zippers, etc. to make clothing.

loans.name: Poni Ake

texts.en:
Poni Ake is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 10. All of them go to school.

She runs a liquor store and has been in business for 7 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase beer, soda water and many others. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

In 5 years she would like to expand her business. Poni Ake says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like maize flour and onions, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and married, and they have been blessed with four children aged 25, 18, 15 and 13 years respectively. She is a farmer and she has been in  this business for four years. Right now her monthly income from the business is about KES 20,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 40,000 with which she intends to purchase fertilizer and seedlings. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit. This is her fourth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Marima is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan along with her husband and ten-year-old child who is in school. She has been selling slippers and rubber dishes (tubs, buckets, plates, spoons, etc.) for the past 4 years. She enjoys the business because of the profit she makes every day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes (tubs, buckets, plates, spoons, etc.) for her business. She hopes to be an owner of a house and take care of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes (tubs, buckets, plates, spoons, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Pitia

texts.en: Pitia benefited from her previous loans as follows: she bought more maize flour and eggs, and paid part of her children's school fees. She is now taking a new loan to purchase more mixed items, like millet flour, maize flour, etc. She is happy for FSL and Kiva's continuous support towards her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like millet flour and maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Oscar Alfonso

texts.es: Don Oscar se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz, frijol y maicillo tiene 15 años de ser agricultor,  vive con su esposa y sus  2 hijos de 1 y 6 años, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes y herramientas para su cultivo de maiz y asi poder llevar el sustento diario a du hogar
texts.en: Don Oscar works in agriculture and his main crops are corn, beans and sorghum. He has been a farmer for 15 years and he lives with his wife and two children ages 1 and 6 years old. He is hard-working and dedicated to his responsibilities in the home. He has always tried to provide the best for his children. He is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and tools to grow corn, which is how he provides for his family on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL ROSARIO” se encuentra pasando el ciclo 18 es grupo puntal en sus cuotas grupales. Violeta es secretaria del grupo tiene 37 años de edad conviviente con hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace tres años y medio. El préstamo que se le dio lo usara en la compra de útiles escolares para su hija y en arreglar la fachada de su casa. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Violeta es la tercera del lado derecho se encuentra con su bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "EL ROSARIO" is in its 18th loan cycle; and the group makes its loan payments on time.  Violeta, 37 and the secretary of the group, has a common-law husband and children.  For three and a half years she has been selling beauty products.  She will use the loan to buy school supplies for her daughter and to fix up the outside of her house. 

The group is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Violeta is the third from the right, holding a baby.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for her daughter.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther works very hard to support her family and improve her standards of living. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Currently, she is running a business of selling food products. She is requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000 to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cereals and vegetables for resale to satisfy her clients by offering varieties of food products.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cereals and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal, 37 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. For four years she and her husband have been rendering transportation services to local people using their chartered bus. Her husband drives the bus while she works as a conductor. 

Last year, they purchased land where they built their house. However, due to lack of finances, they couldn't afford to finish it completely. So Tumenjargal is requesting a loan of 6,900,000 MNT to purchase necessary building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, foam, fiberglass and cement. Using these materials, she can complete the unfinished job and add insulation to its walls and roof. 

As a result, her family can live in a warm and comfortable place, which will enable the family to burn less coal and emit less smoke, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. Tumenjargal is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Elmer Efrain

texts.es: Elmer es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos, maíz y frijol. Elmer desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Elmer is a responsible family man who has always tried to provide the best for his children. He currently lives with his wife and their four children. Elmer is hard-working. He is a farmer and every year he plants staple grains like corn and beans. He would like to increase his sales and that's why he has requested a loan which will allow him to purchase: seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other things. Elmer hopes to receive the loan because he has no other source of financial support and this will help him to continue providing for his family on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Joujam Lom Group

texts.en:
“Behind every strong soldier, there is even stronger woman who stand behind him, supports him and love him with all his heart.” This line is an indication of a very strong woman called Henem. She is featured with her raised hand and is a member of the Joujam Group. Her husband serves in the Indian paramilitary force and is stationed outside the state. Henem takes care of her three children all by herself because her husband comes home only once in a year during his work leave. She always encouraged her husband that both had to work hard and live an independent life.
 
Henem runs a variety shop in her house. She sells potatoes, cereals, sugar, milk powder, paan, dry tobacco, local cigarettes, toothpaste, soap, detergent powders, candies, toffees, etc in her variety shop. She is delighted to share that she purchased a refrigerator and vanity from the small savings she made by running the shop. She successfully paid back her previous loan and she aspires to get another loan and start another side business. 

With the Kiva loan, she is planning to buy chicks and raise them for sale. Henem believes that she will be able to sell them at the nearby police station, where the police officials are stationed. She will run her shop and raise chickens too. She also says that she still lacks skills and knowledge about poultry, so she will get poultry experts to help her out when she starts her poultry business. She aspires to become a successful businesswoman and a responsible housewife. She will try her best to work things out and believe in her dream. She is thankful towards all the lenders.

The other group members are engaged in ginger farming, a piggery, poultry, and vegetable farming. They are also very hard working, optimistic and always looking forward to development.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise and sell them

loans.name: Shirvan

texts.en:
Shirvan is a 33-year-old, hard working Iraqi man. He is married and is the father of two children.

Shirvan is the owner of a typical small Middle Eastern-style fast food restaurant, where he makes delicious shawarma, either chicken or other meat, and served in a bun with both fresh and pickled vegetables. Shirvan has been running the business for three years already, and he is constantly working on improving it to offer better and better services for his customers.  

Shirvan took a loan in the past which he used to renovate the shop. Having successfully repaid the previous loan, he is now taking a new loan in the amount of 2,900 USD to be able to purchase an oven.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase an oven.

loans.name: Javier De Jesus

texts.es:
Javier de 57 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y esforzado por salir adelante. Desde hace diez años abrió un restaurante-hotel, el cual administra. Gracias a su labor ha logrado solventar sus gastos y sostener a su madre debido a que su padre falleció hace algunos años. 
Su mayor deseo es poder mejorar su negocio debido a que las ventas y los turistas han escaseado, con el fin de mejorar la difícil condición económica que afrontan en la actualidad.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nevera y productos de la canasta familiar, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre.
texts.en:
Javier is 57 years old. He is an entrepreneur and committed to getting ahead. Ten years ago he opened a restaurant-hotel, which he manages. Thanks to his job he has been able to settle his debts and provide for his mother since his father died several years ago. His greatest wish is to improve his business, since sales and tourists are scarce, and improve the difficult economic situation he is currently facing. 

Today he is requesting a loan that he will invest in buying a refrigerator and food staples, in order to offer better service to his customers and to improve his mother's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and staple foods.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 28 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 6, and both of them are attending school and live at home. For the past two years Mercy has been selling charcoal in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Walter Giovany

texts.es:
Su nombre es Walter  cuestiones familiares hizo su primaria y bachillerato en el colegio con grandes esfuerzos que se hicieron para estudiar se pudo graduar en el año 2012 en un instituto donde realizo su último año.
Básicamente ahora y siempre ha vivido con toda su familia junta con padres y una hermana menor de 17 años y con una sobrina que el tiene, viven en arriendo y pues todos los gastos que tienen ellos básicamente son para alimentación pagar arriendo y ahora pagar la mensualidad de estudio para la carrera y tienen  lo básico para vivir y con el aporte que les dará kiva será de gran ayuda para bajar un poco los costos que tienen ellos y eso ayudara para otras cosas necesarias que le piden en campo alto y gastos de la casa.
Tuvo un año donde tuvo que pensar firmemente que era lo que de verdad quería estudiar y dedicarse por completo a ello y tener la certeza de que le gusta y que lo va a hacer pro amor, gusto y no por fuerza mayor. 
Hace un tiempo decidió estudiar hotelería y turismo que es lo que de verdad le llama bastante la atención por la variedad de cosas que como profesional puede llegar a realizar cuando este ya poniendo en práctica todo lo que se ha aprendido, y se tenga la  práctica
Sabe que puede poner en práctica todo lo aprendido y que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación puede salir adelante que puede alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Due to family concerns and through much effort, Walter was able to receive both an elementary and high school education, receiving his diploma in 2012 from the high school he attended the last year.

Basically, he has always lived with his entire family: his parents, his minor sister and a niece.  They rent their home and use most of their income to pay for rent and food, and to cover university costs.  They can pay for their basic needs, but the Kiva loan will be very helpful in reducing their costs and help cover the high cost of household expenses.

Walter had a year to decide on what field of study he wanted to pursue based on his preferences and passions, rather than going in to just any field.  Some time ago he decided that Hospitality and Tourism were what really interested him because of the wide variety of projects he can do when he becomes a professional in the field he is learning.  He knows he can put into practice all he has learned; and that through much effort and dedication he will be able to get ahead and meet his goals.

loans.use: To finish his studies in Hospitality and Tourism.

loans.name: Josphen

texts.en: Josphen is a 50 years old responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi Pakistan. Her husband is a government employee and three of her children are currently in school. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children and they are facing many hurdles in life. Josphen has been helping her husband by working at her cloth business for the last three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to buy new varieties of cloth at a cheaper rate and then sell it for a profit. In the future she is looking forward to opening a small boutique in the market. With the profit she will pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money. She has a bright vision and this loan will help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy new varieties of cloth to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 19, a single, youth client from Iraq. He lives with his family, which consists of four members.  Ali and his father provide the income for the family. 

Ali owns a small shop selling glass plates. These plates are used to install display windows for shops and are highly in demand. Ali is a very dynamic person; he took over his father’s business, which he established in 2006, and has been gaining much experience in this field and his fame has been growing rapidly in the neighborhood.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing a new floor, a second ceiling, and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he could provide extra income for his family, and start saving money to buy himself a house.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing a new floor, a second ceiling, and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Bahidja

texts.en:
Bahidja is a 51-year-old Iraqi woman.  She is married and a mother of 3 children.  With limited career options, due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Bahidja is working from home and using her sewing skills to generate income to help meet the financial needs of her family.

Bahidja has 2 years’ experience with the small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity.  She would like to improve her work and offer a better quality/variety of services for her clients.  To do so she would like to buy a new sewing machine, an embroidery machine, good-quality fabrics, and raw materials.  To make these purchases she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1,800 USD. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection.  RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an embroidery machine, good-quality fabrics, and raw materials.

loans.name: Power Puff Girls Group

texts.en:
Gilda is the featured borrower of Power Puff Girls group. She got together with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they are friends and trust each other. Gilda is a 44-year-old married woman who left Philippines and came to Lebanon to work as a housekeeper. She wants to provide her family with the best living situation. The loan will be sent to her family to cover their educational fees. She is the second one from the right.

Nurhaina is the first one from the right. She is a 35-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to support her family in Philippines. The loan will be sent to her family to provide them with better living standards.

Mary Rose is the one in the middle with the red shirt. She is a 32-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to support her family financially in Philippines.

Victoria is the first one from the left. She is a 48-year-old divorced woman who works as a housekeeper. She also sells mobile phones to support her family in the Philippines.

Joy is the second one from the left. She is 22-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to provide her family with a good living.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Ivone

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos, dos quais 5 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante, vende produtos alimentares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, amendoim, massa, feijão, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio, melhorar as condições de vida da sua família e apostar nos estudos dos seus filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes e a grande concorrência no mercado.
texts.en:
Ivone is married and the mother of 6 children, 5 of whom are in school. She lives in her own house and is not supported by anyone. She works selling groceries. With this loan, Ivone intends to buy products like rice, flour, peanut butter, pasta, beans and more in order to increase the merchandise she has on hand. 

In the future she would like to expand her business, improve her family's living conditions and invest in the studies of her children, so she is committed to paying back the loan she has requested from Hluvuku. Her current challenges are the lack of funding and competition in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, peanut butter, pasta and beans in order to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: La señora Blanca, siendo madre soltera ha sacado adelante a sus hijos hoy en día uno es mayor de edad e independiente y la menor de 17 años está estudiando, todo ha sido posible gracias a su negocio de venta de comida por encargo a las empresas desde hace 6 años, ahora ella solicita este crédito para reparar las paredes internas y el techo de su vivienda, comprando laminas de zinc, perlines, cemento, arena, bloques, hierro, para vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en: Blanca, being a single mother, has brought up her children. Today, one is older and independent and the younger one is 17 years old and studying. All has been possible thanks to her business selling custom food to businesses for the last six years. Now she is requesting this loan to repair the internal walls and the roof of her house, buying sheets of zinc, framing, cement, sand, blocks, iron to live in better conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc,framing, cement, sand, blocks, and iron.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella, de 54 años de edad es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años.Estrella se dedica a la venta de carne ,cuenta que su trabajo consiste en la compra de ganado porcino en cantidad, sobre todo los de mayor peso y en estado saludable ,después de adquirirlos, los mata para vender la carne en ferias regionales y de los distritos. Con ellos obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovecha el puesto que tiene para vender productos de belleza a los clientes que ya la conocen. Le va muy bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Hace poco, pintó el ambiente donde abrirá su Chicharronería (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), donde podrá obtener más ganancias, pues posee la carne de cerdo de su negocio y ella misma podrá utilizarlo para la elaboración de sus platos, de esta manera tiene mayor ganancia nos cuenta que le va muy bién. 
Estrella, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de carne de cerdo, que le sirve como insumo para su chicharronería como también para su negocio de compra y venta de carne , además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibirá y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Estrella, 54 years old, is a simple woman. She lives in the company of her two children, who she cares for in the house she bought ten years ago. Estrella is dedicated to selling meat. Her work consists of her buying pig livestock in quantities, above all those of greater weight and in a healthy state. After acquiring them, she kills them to sell the meat in regional and district markets. With them, she obtains good earnings. Additionally, she takes advantage of the job she has to sell beauty products to customers who already know her. Her business is going well. "I sold more meat during the holidays" she said. Recently, she painted the area where she will open her Chincharroneria (a place where she sells pork-based dishes), where she will be able to obtain more income since she has the pork from her business and she will be able to use it herself to make the dishes. In this way, she can have greater income. She says it is going very well.

Estrella will invest S 2000 in the purchase of pork which will serve as ingredient for her chicharroneria as well as for her business buying and selling meat. In addition, she is grateful for the financial support that she will receive and promises to pay installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 37 años de edad , es casada y tiene 2 hijos a los que cuidan en la casa que compró, hace 8 años. Hace poco cerró su locutorio, donde brindaba el servicio de llamadas telefónicas y espera poder retomar ese proyecto. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar una suma considerable de dinero gracias a su esposo, que trabaja en una empresa de autos como mecánico. Con ello compraron dos autos, que alquilan para el trasporte público; a diario le pagan 30 nuevos soles por el servicio. Este negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque no necesita mucho mantenimiento, pues su esposo conocedor del tema; mantiene en perfectas condiciones los autos cambiando el aceite y revisándolos constantemente. “Gracias a su buen mantenimiento pueden trabajar sin problemas en el trasporte público”, comenta. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para volver a abrir su primer negocio, donde está segura tendrá mucho éxito.Margarita; invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de baldes de aceite para el mantenimiento de los autos que posee , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Margarita, 37 years old, is married and has two children who she cares for in the house she bought eight years ago. A little while ago, she closed her shop where she provided telephone service and hopes to be able to resume this project. With time, she managed to save a considerable amount of money thanks to her husband who works in a car company as a mechanic. With him, they bought two cars which they rent for public transport. On a daily basis, they are paid S. 30 for the service. This business helps her a lot with the bills above all, since they don't need a lot of maintenance since her husband is knowledgeable on the subject. He maintains the cars in perfect condition changing the oil and reviewing them constantly. "Thanks to his good maintenance they can work without problems for public transport," she says. Now, she hopes to put together the money necessary to reopen her first business where Margarita is sure she will have a lot of success. She will invest S. 3000 in the purchase of buckets of oil for the maintenance of the cars she owns. Also, she promises to pay her installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy buckets of oil for the maintenance of her cars.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hard-working mother who has six children; she owns a house which has no electricity and piped water.

She has a business selling food stuffs in her kiosk [shop], but she see seasonality as a challenge in her business.

She is requesting for a loan of KES 10,000 to buy more sugar, rice, salt, flour, and cooking oil so she can offer a variety of food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, salt, flour, and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old and married. She has 8 children between the  ages of 13 and 25; they all  live in Buchanan Ground Bassa county.  This county is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market.  

Unfortunately, she did not go to school, but she is good at managing her home and business. Sarah has been running  a shop for the last 15 years selling food such as rice, biscuits, Vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc.  She learned this way of selling from her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, biscuits, Vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers, and her daily savings is high. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, biscuits, Vita, candy, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en:
Sarkis is a 26-year-old single Lebanese man living with his brother. They work together to cover their living expenses and fulfill their needs. 

Sarkis has owned a metal shop for a few years. He also works as a dancing teacher to supplement his income. 

Today, he is looking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l.; he will use it to purchase metal for his business. He noted that this loan will help him increase his productivity and thus improve his way of living. 

In the future, he plans to get more Kiva loans in order to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to purchase metal for his business

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
Sadriddin is a kind person who is married and has seven children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for over 20 years; he has great experience in this business. His father also had a lot of cattle. 

Sadriddin is looking for a loan to buy young cattle; he will be able to offer his customers good animals, and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings.  He will also be able to offer his sons access to a better quality education, and financial stability that will allow them to progress. 

He is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy young cattle to further develop his business. Each month he will make his payments on time; he awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to further develop his business.

loans.name: Love

texts.en: Love is 28 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 13. They all  live in the capital city (Buchanan) of Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. For the past five years, she has been selling palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc. in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc. to expand her business, In the near future she wants to own a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, biscuits, candy, sardines, etc. to expand her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a devoted mother who is trying her best to satisfy her family's needs; she owns a house with neither electricity nor water.

She is asking for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy more scrap metal for resale so that she can get her daily bread and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal for her recycling business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 55 años de edad es una mujer líder. Ella vive en compañía de su esposo y ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuidan en la casa que heredaron hace algunos años.Yolanda tiene una ferretería, equipada y surtida. Según cuenta le va muy bien en su negocio; pues abre sus puertas todos los días sin descanso. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, no solo se dedica a ello. También vende comida los domingos, en un espacio de su casa. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas, las que le brindan un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos; a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Ahora quiere surtir su tienda, con todo el material posible, “existen días en las que llegan compradores grandes que se llevan cemento y demás materiales por cantidad y no me es suficiente”, afirma. Yolanda, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de arena, cemento, fierros y demás mercadería para surtir su ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 55, is a leader.  She lives in the company of her husband and together they have two children whom they care for in the house they inherited some years ago.  Yolanda has a hardware store; equipped and stocked.  According to what she says, she is doing very well with her business since she opens its doors everyday without a break.  But since she is a hard-working woman she is not only dedicated to this.  She also sells food on Sundays, from a place in her home.  

For his part, her husband makes a living by renting out heavy machinery to state institutions and private constructors, who give him monthly payment.  With this he pays for the university studies of his children, for whom he wishes to provide a good education.  

Right now Yolanda wants to stock up her store with all the materials that are possible.  "There are days when large buyers arrive to take cement and other materials in abundance and there isn't enough," she says.  Yolanda will invest the 3500 soles to purchase sand, cement, wrought iron, and other merchandise to stock up her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy cement, wrought iron and sand, among other items.

loans.name: Lialo

texts.en:
Lialo, now 25 years old, supports a family of three. He has successfully repaid his previous loan owing to the good wheat harvest of the last season. 

He has acquired a sixth loan of 100,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from KADET LTD to buy wheat seedlings and also buy a flock of sheep, goats and cows for fattening to sell at a gain.

He plans to use additional proceeds to educate his children as well as enlarge his farming activities. His hopes and dreams are to become a renowned commercial farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seedlings and also buy a flock of sheep, goats and cows for fattening to sell at a gain.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 50 years old, married, and has eight children between the  ages of  17 and 35 years old, and they all  live in Buchanan Ground Bassa County which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She has not attended school but she said she is good at managing her home and business, and she has been involved in the sale of fish at the local market, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase enough fish to expand her sales. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers, and her daily sales are high. Her plans are to build herself a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase enough fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
Gulmurod is 50 years old. He and his wife are happy and have four children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Gulmurod has been busy with farming for 20 years, producing onions, carrots, wheat and other agriculture produce. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops and vegetables. His produce is sold at the local market in the city, but it is also exported. 

In order to provide his crops and vegetables with the needed attention, he is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 somoni so that he can buy fertilizer and continue improving his crop production. He hopes to generate more income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en:
Balakhan is a 55-year-old man, widowed with one son. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers.  There are about ten head in his herd. Balakhan has 20 years of experience in this field, and the reason that pushed him to start his own business was a very low pension.

Balakhan usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  Milk and yoghurt he sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat-selling brings 170 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered as very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

This is the only financial income in his family and is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved son. Balakhan applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase three cattle, two milking cows and fodder.  This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, two milking cows and fodder.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 53-year-old married woman, very hardworking and experienced.  She has five children, who are already independent adults. She breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products, as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Tamara has 26 years of experience in this field, thanks to her father, who taught her the best way to look after cattle. 

Tamara usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. Milk and yoghurt she sells to the neighbors. Milk and meat selling brings in an income of 130 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered to be very healthy and are also present in everyday. 

  Tamara applied for 2,000 AZN to purchase three cattle, one milking cow and fodder. Tamara has a very positive loan history and has already completed several loans.

loans.use: to buy three cattle, one milking cow and fodder.

loans.name: Rafael Edward

texts.es:
El Señor Rafael vive en Guayaquil (La Libertad), el tiene 33 años de edad. El decidió ayudar a cuidar el medio ambiente y una buena manera era la de reciclar, que además le daría ingresos económicos para su familia.
El realiza su trabajo diariamente adquiriendo vidrio, chatarra, papel. Etc. 

La dificultad que se le presenta en su negocio es la enfermedad. El está casado, su esposa se dedica al hogar.
Tiene 3 hijos que estudian en instituciones fiscales. 

El usara el préstamo para una maquina recicladora y tarros. El desea para el futuro arreglar mas su vivienda y tener capital para poder adquirir los materiales de reciclaje.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 33, lives in Guayaquil (La Libertad).  He decided to help the environment, and a good way was recycling.  This also would give him income for his family.

He does his work daily getting glass, scrap metal, and paper, etc.

The difficulty that he faces in his business is illness.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the home.  He has three children, and they attend public schools.

He will use the loan to buy a recycling machine and pots.

In the future he wishes to fix his house more.  He also wishes to have capital in order to be able to get recycling materials.

loans.use: to buy a recycling machine and pots.

loans.name: Jamalladin

texts.en:
Jamalladin is a 57-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He is farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 26 years. 

His primarily crops are fruits, which are very popular fresh and in juice. He chose this business because it is profitable, and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made from vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan families, and also are used to make fresh punch.

Jamalladin sells his crops in the bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Jamalladin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fikiri

texts.en: Fikiri, 36 years old, is married and has five school-going  children. She has a kiosk (shop) which sells foodstuffs and her clients are people from her neighborhood. She is hoping to expand her business which entails having cash and so she is requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy more rice, milk, wheat flour, sugar and other foodstuffs for sale to satisfy her clients' demand.

loans.use: to buy more rice, milk, wheat flour, sugar and other foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the No. 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between 10 and 22; her children are attending school, and all of them live at home. 

She has been selling soap, rice, Vita, oil, candy, etc., for the past 10 years now.  She started this business by running a table with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, rice, Vita, oil, candy, etc., for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, rice, Vita, oil, candy, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 51-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and only one working child. In 1995, in order to supplement the family’s income, he decided to start his own work. His job consists of selling vegetables. He has a wide variety of goods which he sells to customers from his town and the neighboring villages. 

Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a vegetable cart, where he can expose all his products. He states that the loan will certainly help him increase his sales by a fair percentage, which will return higher profits for him. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and open his own vegetable shop.

loans.use: to purchase a vegetable cart.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 30 years old and lives happily with his family. Apart from the retail shop he owns, he also supplies fresh milk from his farm to his customers. He has been in this business for a period of five years and earns an income of KES 30,000.

Richard has applied for a third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He wishes to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and feed.  

The anticipated revenues from the sale of milk will be used to pay the school fees for his children and improve the living standards of his family. His dream is to see his family live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is 42 years old, has two children. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. She has a business selling fruit and she also sells vegetables at the market.

Mary intends to expand her business and satisfy her clients' needs. She is asking for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more mangoes, oranges, bananas and vegetables for sale to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, oranges, bananas and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Xhevair

texts.en:
Xhevair is an Egyptian man in his 60s and has been photographed with his wife Sanie for this profile. They are very poor and they live in the outskirts of a little town in southern Albania where they manage livestock as the main source of income for their family. 

They started their dairy/livestock activity some six years back and have been selling milk to the local dairy farm ever since. Through this activity, they have been able to cover their basic living expenses; yet they couldn’t put any money aside to build a stable for their animals. This is the reason that they are applying for a loan for the first time.

loans.use: To build a stable for his animals.

loans.name: Aflatun

texts.en:
Aflatun is 54 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. Aflatun is a livestock breeder, but he also sells milk, yogurt, cheese and eggs. He conducts his sales every day of the week. His customers include friends and neighbors who visit his business on a daily basis.

Aflatun is requesting a loan in order to pay for his wife's surgery. She has health problems and this investment will help him to help his wife to feel better.

loans.use: To pay for his wife's surgery.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and lives in the county of Montserrado, which is the No. 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between the ages of 16 and 20. All of her children attend school and live at home. 

Victoria has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts and peppers for the past 15 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from him also. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts and peppers for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts and peppers for her business.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is 42 years old and lives in the county of Montserrado, which is the No. 1 commercial county in Liberia. She is married with four children between the ages of 2 and 21. Only three of her children are in school and live at home. She did not attend school herself.

Since 1999, Atta has been selling fish at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her future plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru:
Нурулло молодой и энергичный человек современности. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще несовершеннолетние. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому он является единственным кормильцем в семье. 

С целью получения дохода 2 года назад он начал свой бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды и обуви на местном рынке. Он всегда старается пополнить свой оборотный капитал каждый сезон и таким образом быть в конкуренции с развивающими бизнесменами. Он торгует на местном рынке, где много народа делают покупки. Его брат помогает ему в введении бизнеса. 

Он хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал и расширить ассортимент своего товара, но не имеет денег для этого. Он с надеждой обращается за займом в сумме 1000 долларов США для покупки мужской одежды и обуви. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nurullo is a young and dynamic man of our times.  He is 29 years old, married, and raising two children who are still minors.  Since his wife is a homemaker, Nurullo is the only breadwinner in his family.

In order to make an income, Nurullo started his own business two years ago, buying and selling men's clothing and shoes at a local market.  Every new season he tries to expand his working capital, in order to remain competitive against other developing entrepreneurs.  He conducts his commercial activity at a local market where many people come to shop.  His brother helps him with the business.

Nurullo wants to expand his working capital and increase his assortment of merchandise, but he does not have enough money to do so.  Hoping for the best, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 which will be used to purchase men's clothes and shoes.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy men's clothing and increase his assortment of goods.

loans.name: Bondo

texts.en:
Bondo is 49 years old from Senaki District. He lives with his wife, 17-year-old daughter and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Bondo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Each member of the family gets monthly income, 28 Laris (GEL) per person, from the government institutions, as they are persecuted. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Bondo requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Bondo will renovate his car and after the car is renovated he will be able to serve local people as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to renovate his car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Khonim

texts.ru:
Хоним 50 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж электрик. Дети совершеннолетние. Хоним старается помочь мужу и сыновьям улучшить условию проживания. Она решила организовать новый бизнес купле продажей детских одежд. 

Она очень любит маленьких детей и поэтому хочет, чтобы дети всегда носили новые одежды. Она будет продавать свой товар на местном рынке, где много народа делают покупки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
