Khonim is 50 years old. She is married and has raised three children. Her husband is an electrician. Her children are adults. Khonim tries to help her husband and sons improve their living conditions. She decided to set up a new business of buying and children's clothing. 

She loves small children and therefore wants the children to always wear new clothes. Khonim will be selling her goods in the local market, where many people make purchases. It asks for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy children's clothing. She's waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase children clothes for setting up a new business

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en:
Mr. Magsarjav is 48 years old, and he lives with his wife and three children, in a house in Ulaangom soum, Uvs province, in western Mongolia. His wife, Tungalag, age 46, earns income by providing cobbler services at home. His son, Ganzorig, age 21, and daughter, Uranchimeg, age 19, are university students. His youngest son, Monh-Erdene, age 17, goes to a local secondary school.

Borrower has been running a wood-shop since 2000. He started a business, retailing construction materials at a rental counter of a local market, in 2009. Now, he is requesting to borrow 7,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase electric appliances, for starting up his own electric appliances retail business. He is a hard-working, open-minded and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase electric appliances to start his own business, selling electric appliances at retail

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 26 years old. He lives in Kutaisi District, West Georgia with his wife  and five-year- old daughter. Koba requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nowadays the family is out of source of income.

Koba requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Koba will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Teolfilo Melecio

texts.es:
El cliente Teófilo vive en Libertad, el tiene 36 años de edad. El decidió escoger esta actividad porque es donde invierte poco y gana más, y además ayuda con el cuidado del medio ambiente. El se dedica al reciclaje, y lo realiza todos los días, lo realiza solo.

La única dificultad que él tiene en su negocio es que teme a enfermarse. El tiene esposa, y se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos del hogar.   El tiene 5 hijos pequeños y van a la escuela fiscal y la pequeña aun no estudia.

El utilizara el préstamo para incrementar su negocio de reciclaje comprando fundas y tarros para reciclar. El desea para el futuro poder obtener una bodega donde pueda mejorar sus ingresos debido al reciclaje, para mejorar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teófilo, age 36, lives in Libertad.  He decided to choose this business activity because it is one where you invest little and gain more.  Also, it helps take care of the environment.  He devotes himself to recycling, and he does it alone every day.

The only difficulty he has in his business is that he is afraid of getting sick.  He has a wife, who devotes herself to the household chores.  He has five small children.  They go to public school, except the little one does not go to school yet.

He will use the loan to increase his recycling business.  He will buy sacks and containers for recycling.

In the future he wishes to be able to get a store where he would be able to improve his income from recycling.  He wants to do this in order to improve his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy sacks and containers for recycling.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 42 years old. He lives in a small village of Didgori District with his wife and two children. Tariel has requested for a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time due to his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Tariel works as an artisan at a local building company. His wife works as a nurse at the hospital. They both get a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tariel has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Tariel will purchase two milking cows which he will use to produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows.

loans.name: Elmer Dimitrio

texts.es:
Elmer tine 26 años de edad, es soltero, y vive en San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida.
Elmer tiene 20 años de dedicarse a realizar actividades de ganaderia, el tiene varias vacas de donde genera ingresos por la venta de leche , el se levanta desde muy temparano a ordeñar las vacas y llevar a vender la leche en el mercado local.las ventas las hace a diario y mantiene sus clientes fijos.Esta solicitando la ayuda de un prestamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para hacer un cerco y nivelar el lugar donde mantiene su ganado, esto le ayudara a darle mas seguridad a su ganado y mantenerlo es un lugar estable. la meta que tiene es trabajar muy duro y tener el capital economico y en un futuro poder casarse.
texts.en:
Elmer is 26 years old, single and lives in San Juan Pueblo, Atlantida.

Elmer has been making a living in animal farming for the past 20 years. He owns cows and generates income by selling their milk. He wakes up early to milk the cows and sells the milk in his local market. He sells everyday and has fixed customers. 

He is requesting a loan to buy materials to build a fence and level the ground of his cattle pen. This will allow him to keep his cattle in a safe and stable place.

His goals are to work hard to make money and, in the future, get married.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a fence and level the ground of his cattle pen

loans.name: Priscile Olive

texts.fr: Priscile est une femme de 34 ans, célibataire et mère d'une fille. Elle possède et gère un mini restaurant où elle vend des repas camerounais depuis 1 ans. Son activité est situé dans un quartier de la ville. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de matières premières en achetant 1 sac de riz, 1 sac de sel, un cajou de tomate etc... afin d'accroître ses revenus et ses profits. Les bénéfices générés seront réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, logement, nutrition santé)
texts.en:
Priscile is 34 years old, single, and mother of one daughter. She owns and operates a small restaurant where she has been selling Cameroonian meals for one year now. Her restaurant is located in a neighborhood of the city.

She is seeking this loan so that she can increase her inventory of raw materials by buying 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of salt, 1 crate of tomatos, etc. in order to increase her revenue and profit.

She will use the profits that she earns to reinvest in and expand her business and to support her family (education, housing, food, health).

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
This is Rima, a 34-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and lives with her husband, who has been working for a local company since 2000. 

Rima started her own home business as a tailor in 2005. She’s stylish, fashionable and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new sewing machine in order to improve her business and therefore increase her productivity. 

Rima has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to better develop her work and augment her earnings. She’s planning to open her own tailoring shop and also expand her business outside the country soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gustavo Humberto

texts.es: El señor Gustavo habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe en el populoso Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, junto a su familia ha salido adelante para cumplir su mayor sueño, terminar su casita, para darle mejores condicones a su esposa e hijos, el trabaja como albañil, su mayor dificultad es que no puede recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de Materiales que necesita. con este Credito que se le ha otorgado comprara Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, Perlines y Zinc para continuar con su sueño, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic y Fondo Kiva le han brindado
texts.en:
Gustavo lives with his family in the town of Ticuantepe in the populous neighborhood of Juan Ramón Padilla.  He has gotten ahead to achieve his biggest dream of finishing his house so he can give his wife and children better living conditions.  He works as a bricklayer.

His biggest difficulty is he can't raise the funds he needs to buy the materials all at once.  With the loan he has received he'll buy cement, sand, gravel, cinder blocks, and metal sheeting to continue with his dream.

He's grateful for the support he has received from AFODENIC and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Las Minas Group

texts.es:
La señora Noemi  esta casada, cuenta con 24 lindos años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion secundaria, tiene 1 hijo; ella se dedica al a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tiendita y6 hasta el momento lleva ya 5 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercaderia para su tienda tales como: azucar, aceite, arro, frijo, jabones, detergentes, huevos, embutidos, entre otros. En el futuro proximo quiere que su tienda prospere hasta tener una abarrotería y eso lo lograria solo con su ayuda; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía, comercio y agricultura.
texts.en:
Señora Noemi  is married, is 24 years old, left high school after passing her sixth year, and has one child. She works serving customers in her store. She set up this business with a small store and now has five years of experience. She is supported by her husband, who makes a living farming.

Noemi is organizing a group and requesting a loan to buy merchandize for her store, such as sugar, oil, rice, beans, soap, detergents, eggs, sausages, and others. In the near future, she wants her store to prosper and grow into a grocery store. She can only do this with your help. The other members of the group make a living producing handicrafts, in business, and farming.

loans.use: to buy daily consumer goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her crops

loans.name: Johnnathan Harold

texts.es:
Johnnathan, tiene 20 años de edad, es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica y Telecomunicaciones, en una universidad privada. Lleva estudiando un poco mas de un año.
Él solicitó un crédito anterior para llevar unos cursos extras, ese crédito fue pagado de forma puntual demostrando responsabilidad.
Anteriormente se le presentaba el problema de que si no pagaba su mensualidad a tiempo no podía dar sus exámenes, pero gracias al crédito recibido anteriormente y al hacer el pago completo del ciclo de estudios ya no se le presenta este inconveniente.
Su mayor anhelo es terminar su carrera, ser un profesional exitosos y apoyar a sus padres quienes han sido su fuerza, motivo y apoyo en todo momento.
texts.en:
Johnnathan, 20, is studying electronic engineering and telecommunications in a private university.  He has been studying for a little over a year.

He requested a previous loan to take some extra courses.  He repaid that loan punctually, an indication of his responsibility.

Previously he had the problem that if he didn't make his monthly payment on time he couldn't take his exams, but he no longer has this problem, thanks to the loan he received and to making his complete payment.

His greatest desire is to finish school, be a successful professional, and help his parents, who have always been his strength, motivation, and support.

loans.use: to pay for the third level of his electronic engineering and telecommunications program

loans.name: Ernesto Isabel

texts.es: Don Ernesto vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, es responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecanica de obra de banco( elaboracion de estructuras metalicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años, solicita el credito para comprar mas materiales ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Ernesto lives in his own home with his family. He is responsible and hard-working, and has made a living producing metalwork (making metal structures such as doors, window balconies, gates and roofs) for many years. He is requesting the loan to buy more materials, as he has a lot of demand due to his high quality work. With his earnings, he has managed to support his family and pay their bills.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marina de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de ropa desde hace 8 años cerca de su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos y su hermano ella solicita un credito para poder comprar mas ropa y obtener mejores ganacias porque con lo que vende ha logrado salir adelante y con la yuda de su familia logarn solventar todos los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Marina is 43 years old and sells all sorts of clothing on foot.  She's been doing this for eight years from a place near her home.  She lives in a home of her own along with her two children and brother.  She is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy more clothing and obtain better income becasue she is able to get ahead with what she sells and with her family's help is able to pay all of her expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jesús Albeiro

texts.es:
Jesús de 38 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde su infancia, oficio que aprendió gracias a sus padres y tíos.
Su labor se ha convertido en la fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su esposa y su hijo de cinco años de edad, al que sueña con brindarle una educación de calidad. 
En la actualidad tiene sembrados de arveja y desea poder incrementar su producción con el objeto de aumentar sus ingresos, por lo cual se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para comprar insumos y material agrícola que le permitirán mejorar su cultivo y poder comercializarlo a un mejor precio.
Espera poder cumplirle el sueño a su esposa de tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 38 years old, and has made a living farming since a young age. He learned this job from his parents and uncles. His work has become his source of income with which to support his wife and five-year-old child, who he dreams of giving a high quality education. 

Today, he is growing pea crops and wishes to increase his yield in order to boost his profits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and agricultural material which will enable him to improve his crops and sell them at a higher price. He hopes to be able to achieve his wife's dream of owning their own home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and agricultural materials.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una señorita soltera de 23 años quien vive junto a sus padres en Sololá.
Ella cuenta con una  tienda de abarrotes  que se encuentra en un lugar de su vivienda,  tiene 3 años de tenerlo, eligió este tipo de negocio ya que obtiene ganancias aceptables y de esta manera contribuye a la economía familiar.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para aumentar su negocio comprando más productos  y así ofrecerles variedades  a sus clientes, para brindarles un buen servicio y de esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su tienda de abarrotes ya que actualmente las condiciones  no son buenas.
texts.en:
Clara is a single young woman aged 23 who lives with her parents in Sololá. She has a grocery store in her home, which she has run for three years. She chose this type of business because she can earn an acceptable income and help out with household expenses.

She is requesting a loan of Q 5,000.00 to expand her business by buying more products, so that she can offer a wider variety to her customers and provide them with a good service. In this way, she will boost her earnings. Her biggest dream is to remodel her grocery store as the current state of it is not optimum.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more products.

loans.name: Faraja Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Faraja victimes de l'incendie du marché central de Bujumbura, sont composés de 2 femmes et 2 hommes.Sur la photo,deux femmes Josélyne et Virginie empêchées, sont représentées par leurs maris respectifs Célestin et Réverien.

J Claude est choisi comme chef de groupe. Il  est client  de Turame depuis 2012.Il  habite à  Bujumbura. Il est marié à Claudine. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, âgés de 1 à 5 ans, dont 1 étudient.
Il  a sous sa charge sa sœur qui étudie.

Il faisait le commerce des habits  au marché central de Bujumbura. Il a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de 2 000 000Fbu (1282,05$) par l’incendie.

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des habits  à revendre, pour continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Faraja Group comprises four members, two men and two women, who are all victims of the fire at the Central Market in Bujumbura. In the photograph, two women, Josélyne et Virginie, who couldn't be there are represented by their respective husbands, Célestin and Réverien.

J.-Claude was chosen as the group's leader. He's been a client of Turame since 2012. He lives in Bujumbura and he's married to Claudine. Together, they have two children, age 1 and 5. One of them goes to school. J.-Claude also has his sister, a student, to support.

He used to sell clothing at the Central Market in Bujumbura. He lost merchandise valued at BIF 2'000'000 (ca US$ 1'300) in the fire. With this Kiva loan, he will rebuild his working capital and buy clothing to resell, in order to continue earning a living.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña María una señora humilde muy trabajadora quien a diario anda en las calles buscando como captar nueva clientela para venderles sus ricos arroz con leche y buñuelos, postres típicos del país y ahora vende también ropa usada, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien aporta en los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos como carretonero, también sus 3 hijos le ayudan, ellos son mayores de edad e independientes. María ha utilizado sus créditos en construcción de su casa, ahora desea hacer lo mismo ya que le falta levantar paredes, hacer divisiones de concreto, poner el piso, pero por su condición de ingresos lo hará poco a poco, comprara cemento, bloques, arena, hierro entre otros lo que alcance con el monto solicitado.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a humble and hardworking woman that walks the streets every day looking for customers for her delicious traditional desserts (buñuelos and sweet rice). She also sells used clothes. Her husband supports her and contributes with some of the home expenses. He works collecting and transporting different things on a cart. Her children help her also; they are all adult and independent.

María has used previous loans to build her house and now she wants to build some walls, make divisions in concrete and fix the floor. She will do this step by step, considering her current income. With this loan, she will try to buy as many materials as she can, like cement, bricks, sand and iron.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron, among other materials.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco Tulio tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre en la ciudad de choloma, Cortes.
Don Marco hace 15 años logro iniciar su propio negocio. En busca de generar sus propios ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. en la pulperia vende productos de la canansta basica, como arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina, azucar,etc. El ha sido una persona muy tabajador y responsable, Odef le ha apoyado con algunos prestamos que ha solicitado, para mantener su negocio activo. Actualmente necesita otro de 21000 lempiras para surtir de producto que le hace falta y que los clientes buscan frecuentemente como frijoles, arroz, harina, huevos, manteca, sal, azucar, pollo, refrescos,medicinas etc. Su meta es seguir trabajando y en el futuro alcanzar la solvencia economica que necesita.
texts.en: Marco Tulio is 45 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Choloma, Cortes. 15 years ago, Marco established his own business in order to generate his own income to help his family. He sells basic foodstuffs his store such as rice, beans, butter, flour, sugar etc. He is a very hard-working and responsible individual. Odef has supported him through several loans to keep his business running. Today, he needs another 21000 lempiras to stock the products he needs and that customers request regularly such as beans, rice, flour, eggs, butter, salt, sugar, chicken, soft drinks, medicines, etc. His goal is to keep working and obtain the financial solvency he needs in the future.

loans.use: to stock the store with food items such as butter, sugar, soft drinks, beans, flour, sugar, salt, rice, eggs, chicken, medicines etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old. He lives in Badiauri village, Sagarejo district, with his 43-year-old wife, retired parents, and 21-year-old son. Several times, David requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

David's family owns a vineyard. Harvested grapes are sold at the local markets. They also have piglets which will be sold as meat after they are grown. David has a mini-bus. He is trading fruits and vegetables, buying at the wholesale price and selling locally with the price marked up. David makes a small profit and brings additional income to the family. 

David requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, David will renovate the commercial space which was rented out. He will also purchase a stock of groceries and open a grocery shop. David decided to stop the rent, make some cosmetic repairs, and open a grocery shop, himself. As locals are already used to this shop, after the family opens it again with better stock and a better environment, David hopes it will bring good profit. Part of the profit will be used to expand the stock in the shop and another part will be used to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate space and purchase grocery stock for a grocery shop.

loans.name: José Orlando

texts.es: José Orlando a sus 25 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería y a la venta de leche. Esta labor de ordeño de vacas la aprendió desde su infancia debido a que han residido toda la vida en el campo. Su gran pasión siempre han sido los animales por lo cual disfruta lo que hace. Con su actividad ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar. Actualmente, desea comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar la producción de leche y aumentar sus ingresos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En un futuro sueña con tener un mayor número de vacas y generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
José Orlando is a 25-year old man who works in stockbreeding and milk sale. Having lived this whole life in the countryside, he learned to milk cows when he was a young boy. Animals have always been his big passion and he really enjoys what he does. Thanks to his job, he has been able to improve his household life conditions. 

He's now looking to buy a milk cow that will allow him to increase his milk production and his income, and to provide his family with a better quality of life. His dream is to have more cows in the future and to create direct employment in his community.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Balel est constitué de cinq femmes qui sont majoritairement des veuves. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine de Ségou. Elles font le commerce de riz, fruits (orange et banane), pagnes wax et bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Awa (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de riz dans le marché Médine Ségou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz avec les forains  de la zone office du Niger au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement d’hommes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Balel Group is made up of five women, who are mainly widows. They average 42 years of age and four children. They all live in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood in Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and got acquainted through their money-earning activities at the Médine market in Ségou.

They sell rice, fruits (oranges and bananas), pagnes Wax (colorful African cloth), and firewood. In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their eleventh solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Awa (standing on the left in the photograph) is a big rice seller at the Médine market in Ségou. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 2 sacks of rice at the Grand Market in Ségou, from stallholders coming from "Office du Niger" (a cultivation area in Inner Niger Delta).

She resells for cash and on credit to a clientele comprising mostly men. With this loan, Mrs. Awa hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 60), to be in part used to ensure she can provide for her children, and in part reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
Justo Pastor de 37 años de edad es padre de cuatro hijos. Se dedica desde hace 10 años a la actividad agropecuaria, compra y venta de ganado. Aprendió la actividad desde hace 10 años y su jornada desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m diariamente.  Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, Justo desea comprar ganado, pero no cuenta con los recursos para su adquisición, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito. Espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y garantizarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su microempresa y  tener la oportunidad de generar empleos directos a campesinos de su localidad.
texts.en:
Justo Pastor is 37 years old and has four children.  He has worked in the business of farming and buying and selling livestock for ten years.  He learned this business ten years ago and works daily from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m.  With the goal of increasing his income, Justo wishes to buy livestock, but doesn't have the resources to make this acquisition.  So, he is requesting a loan.  He hopes to improve the quality of life of his family and guarantee that his children have a quality education.

His greatest dream is to see his small business grow and have the opportunity to employ farmers in the region.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants, les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes à Pelengana, chef lieu de commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Pelengana. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, couscous, échalotes et pagnes wax. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Ba Oumou (femme en 2ème  position de la   droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse  d’échalotes dans le marché de Pelengana.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 400kg d’échalotes avec les productrices au marché château de Ségou. Elle procède par enlever l’enveloppe externe, bien lavés puis mis en sachet plastique avant d’être revendu au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Oumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in monogamist families, the four women of the Benkadi group are on average aged 40 with four children. They all live in Pelengana, the administrative centre of a rural commune in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of Mali). They came to know each other through their business activities at the market in Pelengana. They buy and sell cereals, couscous, shallots and wax fabrics. In order to increase their stock in trade, the members of the group joined Soro Yiriwaso and this is their 10th solidarity loan.
Mrs Ba Oumou (the woman second from right to left in the photo) is a great shallot seller at the Pelengana market. She plans to use her loan to buy 400 kilogrammes of shallots from the producers at the Chateau de Segou market. She prepares them by removing the outer skin, washes them well, and then puts them into a plastic bag before selling them for cash or for credit to a mainly female clientele. With this loan, Mrs Ba Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 32 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to provide for her children.

loans.use: To buy shallots.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 3 enfants, les quatre  femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Médine de Ségou. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers (brosses à dents, pâtes dentifrices, peignes, miroir, …), d’œufs de poules, d’arachide et de bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 11ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Kadiatou (femme debout au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des œufs de poules de qualité dans son quartier  et dans le marché Médine Ségou.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 33 alvéoles d’œufs avec les éleveurs de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Avec ce prêt, Madame Kadiatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group are married mostly into polygamous families, average about 44 years old, and on average have three children. They all live in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through business in the Medine Segou market.  They sell a variety of goods (toothbrushes and toothpaste, combs, mirrors, chicken eggs, ground nuts, and fire wood). In order to increase their business funds, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 11th loan cycle as a group. 

Kadiatou (the woman standing in the middle of the photo) has a good reputation for selling quality chicken eggs in her neighborhood and in the Medine Segou market. She plans to use her loan to buy 33 trays of eggs from Segou chicken farmers. She will resell [the eggs] for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. With this loan, Kadiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and to ensure the care of her children.

loans.use: to buy chicken eggs

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bakary  est âgée de 27 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside avec sa conjointe à Hérémakono Nord, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après une formation en santé, Bakary s’est vite initié aux activités d’achat de vente de produits pharmaceutiques depuis plus de dix  ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Il est à son premier prêt qui sera utiliser pour acheter 3 cartons de produits contre le paludisme, 2 cartons de produits contre les maladies respiratoires, 3 cartons d'antibiotiques et 10 litres d’alcool. 
Sa lieu d’approvisionnement  principale est  Bamako (capitale du Mali). Il effectue ses ventes en détail à crédit et au comptant dans les différents centre de santé de la ville de Bougouni et environnant sa clientèle est mixte. Avec ce  prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice réalisé, il compte résoudre ses dépenses de la famille et payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bakary is 27 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He lives with his spouse in North Hérémakono, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Bougouni (the third administrative region in the republic of Mali.) After training in healthcare, Bakary quickly immersed himself into the purchase and sale of pharmaceutical products, which he has done now for over 10 years.

With so much experience in this industry, Bakary has established a solid reputation. He is on his first loan, which he will use to purchase 3 containers of anti-malaria medications, 2 containers of medications for respiratory ailments, 3 containers of antibiotics, and 10 liters of alcohol. Bakary procures his supplies mainly in Bamako (the capital of Mali.)

Bakary's sales are both in cash and credit in various health centers in the town of Bougouni and surrounding areas, and his customer base is widely varied. With this loan, he hopes to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. Once he has earned this profit, Bakary plans to provide for his family's expenses, to pay off the interest on his loan, and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase medications

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 32 years old, and lives at Congo Town in Montserrado county.  Montserrado county has the largest free port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  Cynthia is married, and her husband is a businessman.  They have three children between 12 and 17 who live at home and attend school. 

For the last ten years, Cynthia has been selling pepper, oil, beans, rice, etc.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her save more money. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, beans, rice, etc. for  her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, beans, rice, etc. for  her business

loans.name: Juan Dario

texts.es: Juan Darío tiene 49 años de edad y labora como ebanista desde hace más de 15 años, aprendió la actividad por tradición familiar. En su residencia tiene su taller, debido a que hace algunos años sufrió un robo en el que perdió la totalidad de sus implementos de trabajo y debió prestar recursos para comenzar de nuevo. Hoy su mayor sueño es poder acreditar su negocio y constituir su taller en una microempresa, en la que pueda ofrecer empleo a las personas del sector. Con el fin de continuar con su proyecto, Juan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de dos máquinas, una circular y una rutradora, que le permitirán elaborar artículos alta calidad y agilizar sus procesos. Espera con este crédito mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y consolidar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Darío is a 49-year old man who has worked as a cabinetmaker for 15 years now, a profession that he learned from family tradition. He has placed his workshop at home after he was robbed a few years ago. He lost all his working tools then and had to turn to loans to start all over. 

His biggest dream is to accredit his business and turn it into a microenterprise that will offer employment to workers in the sector. In order to accomplish this project, Juan is requesting a loan to buy two machines, a circular saw and a woodworking router. These will help him to produce high-quality items and speed up the working process. With this loan, he expects to improve the qualify of life of his family and consolidate his business.

loans.use: to buy two machines, a circular saw and a woodworking router.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia est une femme mariée de 28 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni. 
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école dès à son jeune âge, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des condiments. 
Avec plus de 3 ans d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité qu’elle a appris auprès de sa mère. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 2 eme prêt après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Elle compter acheter avec ce nouveau prêt,  3 paquets de cube maggi, 10 kilo de sel de cuisine, 3 boites de tomates concentrée, et 1 colis d’épices. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bougouni. Ses condiments sont  vendus à la maison à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA 
Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs Rokia is a married woman of 28 who has three children. She lives with her husband and their children in the Torakabougou quarter of Bougouni.
Having rapidly abandoned school at an early age, she decided to take up some activities which generate income, in particular the sale of condiments.
With over three years' experience, she has mastered her profession that she learned from her mother. In order to satisfy her growing clientele, she has requested a second loan from Soro Yiriwaso having repaid the first loan correctly.
With this new loan she plans to buy three packets of Maggi cubes, 10 kilos of cooking salt, three boxes of tomato concentrate, and one package of spices. She buys her stock at the big market in Bougouni. She sells her condiments to a mainly female clientele.
With this loan she hopes to make an average monthly profit of  40 000 FCFA. 
With this profit she plans to expand her company.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old. She is married to her husband, Njuguna, and has three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. She also farms on the side to supplement her income.

Mary is applying for her third business loan with KADET LTD. She successfully repaid her previous loans. Mary will use this loan to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, and green grams for her retail shop. 

She intends to reinvest the income she earns back into her business as well as invest in her children’s future. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, tissue paper, sweets, and green grams.

loans.name: Luis Orbey

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, y asegura que la mayor prioridad en su vida es su esposa y su hijo de un año. “Ellos se han convertido en la niña de mis ojos y se que para mejorar nuestra condición económica debo esforzarme y consolidar mi negocio, garantizándoles mejores oportunidades de vida”. Con estas palabras Luis manifiesta que esta es la mayor motivación que lo impulsa a salir adelante. Desde hace algunos años trabaja en la extracción de material (arena) de playa, actividad que le brinda el sustento y un techo a su familia. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito  para la compra de un coche y herramientas que le permitirán mejorar la productividad y aumentar sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Luis is twenty-five years old and and says that the greatest priority in his life are his wife and one-year-old son.  "They have become the apple of my eye, and I know that in order to improve our economic condition, I need to try and strengthen my business, thereby guaranteeing them better life opportunities."  With these words, Luis declares that this is the greatest motivation that propels him forward.  

For several years, he has worked in extracting sand from the beach, an activity that has provided him with sustenance and a home for his family.

Today, he is requesting a loan in order to buy a vehicle and the necessary tools that will allow him to improve his productivity and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy a car and tools for extracting sand.

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en: Zoe is 26 years old and had to stop her education at the 6th grade. She is married and the mother of three children between the ages of 9 months and 11 years, two of whom attend school. Her husband earns a living as a driver, and they live in Buchanan Ground, Bassa County, which is a good place to catch fish for sale in the local market. She describes herself as a strong woman who has made herself into a businesswoman and now earns a living by selling chicken feet, pig feet, and beef in the local market. She learned this trade from her friends, and is applying for a loan for 16,000 LRD  to buy more items to sell to her customers. She would like to expand her business because this will allow her to do a better job of providing for her family, and allow her to move into a new home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and pig feet and beef to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 36 years old, has three school-going children, and she owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. She has a business selling second-hand clothes ("mtumba") to her clients who are her friends and neighbors. With the need of boosting her business, she is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to buy more new clothes for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes for sale

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi, 39, is a married man with three children who attend school. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

To earn a living and support his family, he runs a butcher shop. He is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more goats to sell as meat to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell as meat to his customers.

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en: Varsenik is 52 years old and lives in Ijevan city with her husband and three children. She graduated from the State Medical College and for many years worked as a nurse in one of the schools in Ijevan city. Because her salary was low, Varsenik and her husband decided to create their own business. In 1995 they began selling clothing from a rented stall. This activity was profitable for them and soon they expanded into selling flowers, which was also successful. Varsenik and her husband are very pleased, because they can now provide for their family needs, including education. They have also bought some furniture and a car and paid for their children's wedding. Varsenik is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy new spring-summer seasonal clothes from  wholesale markets in Georgia and Yerevan which she will sell in her stall in Ijeva.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith really appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped her to make good profit out of the sales she made. She again comes to you for another loan of Kshs 30,000 to buy more sacks of maize, beans, peas and other cereals for sale to expand her business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize, beans, peas and other cereals

loans.name: Justina Emperatriz

texts.es: Justina Emperatriz tiene sesenta y nueve años de edad, soltera y es madre de  tres hijos, es originaria del departamento  de Chinandega ubicado al occidente del país, es propietaria de una pulpería en la cual distribuye productos de consumo básico en el hogar, como granos básicos, detergente, productos congelados, embutidos y golosinas. Justina Emperatriz  a pesar de su edad, es muy trabajadora ya que aparte de la pulpería se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y ropa interior. Inicio su negocio desde hace varios años con poco dinero, con una pequeña venta de fruta pero gracias a su empeño  ha logrado salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para comprar más productos y aumentar su inventario. Su mayor sueño es invertir más para poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Justina Emperatriz is 69, single, and the mother of three children. She was born in Chinandega department in western Nicaragua. She owns a small store where she sells basic household items such as grains, detergents, frozen foods, canned goods, and candies. Despite her age, hardworking Justina Emperatriz also sells children's clothing and underwear. Several years ago, she opened a fruit business with little capital. Thanks to hard work, she has managed to get ahead. She has applied for a loan to buy more merchandise to stock her store. Her dream is to invest more so that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy items like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, frozen foods, and canned goods.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una señorita  de 24 años de edad,  es soltera y  vive en Panajachel, Sololá. Ella vive con sus padres y  3 hermanos.  
Ella se dedica a la venta  de  cosméticos lo cual lo hace con amigos y familiares y otras personas en el municipio de Panajachel. Hace un año ella empezó este pequeño negocio gracias a los consejos de una amiga que se dedica a la misma actividad. El propósito principal de esta actividad es la generación de ingresos que la ayuden a aportar a la economía familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo y así ampliar la variedad de cosméticos que vende, mejorando así sus  ingresos y también  el servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es contar con un local comercial  que la ayude a vender más e incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario, 24, is a single young woman.  She lives with her parents and three siblings in Panajachel, Sololá.

She earns a living selling cosmetics to friends, family members, and other people in the town of Panajachel.  She started this small business a year ago thanks to the advice of a friend who does the same work.  The main goal of this job is to generate income to help her contribute to the family finances.

She's requesting a loan for 3,000 quetzals [GTQ] for working capital to expand the variety of cosmetics she sells, thus improving her income and also her customer service.

Her dream is to have a sales space to help her sell more and increase her income to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is 66 years old. He lives in Senaki District with his 40-year-old son, his daughter in-law and two grandchildren (15 and 10 years old). Pridon requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a vineyard and plot of agricultural land where nut trees, maize, and laurel are grown. They also have a milk cow and a calf. The cow is milked to make dairy products, and with the grapes Pridon is making vodka. Harvested produce, together with vodka and dairy products, are sold at the local markets in Senaki district. 

Pridon requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received loan Pridon will purchase an electricity counter for his wood workshop. He is already building the workshop himself and needs electricity to start working in it. Pridon is very experienced in this field as he already was working at a local wood workshop for a small monthly salary. Now that he will have his own workshop, the family income will significantly increase. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business and another part used to provide better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase an electricity counter for his wood workshop

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are three and eight years old. She owns a beauty salon and has been in the business for five years. She earns an income of KES 15,000.

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase more beauty products for her salon.  

Irene will save her profits with the goal of starting the same business in a different location.  Her dream is to improve her business and her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a 24-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband Ali and their three children, all of whom are still attending school. Although Khoulod should be taking care of her children, she was obliged to go to work because she is responsible for helping her husband meet their family expenses. She opened her own clothing shop in 2010 and provides her customers with a variety of women's, kids' and men's clothes at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living even more. As for her husband, he has been working in the construction field for many years. Khouloud is seeking a youth loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a new collection of clothes that she will sell to increase her earnings. Her husband and children trust her, knowing that she’s a brave woman who can handle problems however complicated they are.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes.

loans.name: John Macharia

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and is married with two children aged 22 and 20 years old.

John used his previous loans well and his farm did better after the loans. He has applied for another loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm. He looks forward to getting a good harvest during this planting season.

He hopes to see his farm do even better in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married, 27 years old and the mother of three children who range in age from nine and three years old.  For the last two years she has earned about KES. 26,000 a month by making and selling bricks. She is a member of KADET LTD and has applied for her first loan for KES. 30,000 to buy the materials she needs to make bricks, and to hire workers to help produce them. She will use the money she expects to earn from this loan to pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to run a successful business and live a rewarding and happy life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and pay workers to help make bricks.

loans.name: Maryit Johana

texts.es: Maryit  a sus 32 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos de 7 y 2 años. Tiene una pequeña tienda en al sala de su casa dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a la motivación que recibió por parte de un familiar para que montara su negocio, hoy Maryit cuenta con recursos para el sostenimiento de su familiar. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido, lo que le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y a su vez incrementar sus ingresos con los que podrá brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. A futuro sueña con tener un mini mercado y brindarles un excelente bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maryit, 32, is the single mother of two children, ages 7 and 2. She has a small store in her living room where she sells basic household items. Her family encouraged her to open her business, and today Maryit has resources to support her family. 

She has applied for a loan to buy stock, which will allow her to offer her customers better service, increase earnings, and give her children a better life. She dreams of owning a mini market and providing for the well being of her children.

loans.use: to buy basic household items.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 53-year-old businessman, married to Peris and a father of four children. He has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 8,000 which he uses to support his family. James is applying for his third loan term with KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

He is glad for the financial support he has been receiving from KADET. He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs, i.e., seedlings and fertilizer. 


With the anticipated profits from the business, he will invest in his children’s education. His hopes and dreams are to venture into large-scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, i.e., seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 32 years old from Nyahururu and is married with two children who are aged 14 years and seven years old.

Monica has a cereals business that she has been running and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more stocks of spinach, green vegetables and onions to sell.

She hopes to see her business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spinach, green vegetables and onions  to sell on.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 40 years old, lives in Nakuru and is married with two children who are six and four years old. For the last three years, he has earned a living by running a transport business. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD because he needs to service his motorbike so he can transport his clients safely and comfortably. He hopes to be able to own a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Elva Mirian

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva  vive en La Libertad, ella tiene 43 años de edad. Todo empezó cuando ella necesitaba tener otro medio de ingreso para el hogar y junto a una amiga de ella comenzó la venta de productos para el hogar, venta de ropa ofreciendo a sus vecinos, amistades, y así fue acogiendo clientela. 

Ella realiza su labor sola, todos los días. La dificultad que a ella se le presenta en su trabajo es la distancia, como movilizarse se le hace muy pesado.

Ella si es casada, Tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian en escuela fiscal. Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio como: blusas, pantalones, relojes, etc. Sus sueños son poder mejorar su estilo de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en: Elva lives in La Libertad and she’s 43-years-old.  Everything started when she needed to have another source of household income and with a girlfriend started selling articles for the home and clothes to neighbors and acquaintances and gradually acquired a customer base.  She works alone every day.  The difficulty she faces with her work is distances because getting from place to place is very demanding.  She’s married and has four children all attending public school.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise like blouses, pants, watches, etc.  Her dream is to be able to improve her and her children’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants and watches.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana es una señorita de 25 años quien es soltera y vive con sus padres en Sololá.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles típicos, eligió esta actividad porque desde pequeña su mamá le enseño el proceso para poder elaborarlos ya  lleva 2  años realizando esta labor por lo que de esta manera contribuye a la economía familiar.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de materia prima y así poder elaborar  güipiles típicos y con ello ofrecerles  más variedades de prendas tipicas a sus clientes y de  esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un local para poder tener su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is single and lives with her parents in Sololá. She makes and sells traditional, hand-embroidered garments. She chose this profession because her mother trained her in the techniques as a young girl. Ana has been making garments for two years as a way to contribute to the family finances.

She is requesting a loan of Q 4,000.00 to buy materials to make traditional, hand-embroidered garments. She will offer her customers more selection and increase her profits. One of her dreams is to have a space for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Arkadiy

texts.ru:
Аркадий   - фермер. С 1989 года занимается выращиванием моркови, капусты, арбуза, дыни, буряка и чеснока.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга и двое детей  20-ти и 18-ти лет. 
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания лука в открытом грунте.
Аркадий решил приобрести пленку для защиты от холода ветра, а также капельную ленту для полива.
В планах на БУДУЩЕЕ:  приобрести холодильное оборудование для хранения и охлаждения готовой продукции.
В личных планах:  Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки и капельной ленты.
texts.en: Arkadiy is a farmer. Since 1989, he has been earning a living by growing carrots, cabbages, watermelons, melons, beets, and garlic. He is helped with the farm work by his wife and 2 children, who are 18 and 20 years old. He began his business by growing onions in an open field, but later he decided to buy plastic covering to protect his crop from the wind and cold, and to purchase drip tape for irrigation. His future business plans include getting refrigeration equipment to cool and store his ripened produce, and his personal plans involve completing construction on the family house. Arkadiy needs your assistance to finance his purchase of plastic covering and drip tape.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 43 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port, Freeport, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with two children aged 3 and 21, who are attending school and live at home. She has been selling water by the sack for the past eight months.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from him. Her favorite part about her business is she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack for her business,

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en: Maroun is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to a sweet lady who is the mother of his only child. Maroun is the one covering the family expenses, not to forget the support of his wife who works at an engineering office. Maroun had many years of experience as a car mechanic when he decided to open his own garage in 2005.  As he wishes to better develop his work, he is asking today for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase added mechanic tools. This step will facilitate his business, allowing him to receive more clients, who are going to be served rapidly. Maroun just started his career; that’s why another Kiva loan will be a good way for him to expand his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase added mechanic tools

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma, a 35-year-old married father of four, owns a house which has no electricity or water. To meet the daily needs of his family, Juma sells coconuts at his nearby market. He is now requesting a loan of kshs 20000 to buy more coconuts to sell and to expand his business so that he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell and expand his business.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a mixed farmer and resides in Kitale in Western Kenya where she lives with her family. She is 36 years old and has been actively farming for six years. Her main products for the local market have been horticultural products, milk, and poultry products.

Evaline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to help her expand her poultry business. This will help her to earn more income and, hence, acquire more land for production.

The major challenges in this venture are diseases and pests, fluctuating market prices, and the high cost of production and theft.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Alfones Communications Ltd

texts.en:
Alfones Communications Ltd is a business run by a couple called Alex and Juliet. They sell and market products and services to bottom of the pyramid (BoP) consumers.

Alfones targets people who are typically not reached by traditional marketing. They go directly to the consumer, as opposed to requiring them to visit their shop. Alfones’ products and services include mobile phones, mobile banking services, solar lights, and efficient cookstoves.

Alfones started selling Paradigm’s efficient firewood cookstoves in 2010. They saw it as a beneficial product for their customers, most of whom live in rural areas and cook over three-stone fires. This traditional cooking method produces large amounts of health-damaging smoke and is very inefficient, contributing to the deforestation that is destroying Kenya’s environment. Paradigm’s cookstoves reduce the toxic smoke a woman inhales by 70% and reduces the fuel needed to cook by up to 50%, saving families money and time spent buying or collecting firewood.

Alex and Juliet started Alfones together in 2005. Their storefront is located in the town of Sagana, Kirinyaga county, while most marketing is field-based with operations extending to Muranga, Laikipia, Naivasha, and Nakuru counties. Alfones employs ten full-time staff, seven of whom are female.  Alfones reaches an estimated 24,000 people, over 95% of whom are women. Cookstove sales are strong and nowadays require Juliet’s full attention. Juliet and her sales agents are responsible for cookstove marketing and sales, while Alex continues manages the other aspects of the business.

Alfones currently offers its customers the ability to buy their cookstoves in three monthly installments. It has an almost perfect repayment rate as the groups they work with ensure proper repayment from its members. More customers are eager to purchase cookstoves, but Alfones struggles to raise enough low-interest capital to finance the cookstoves to allow more women to pay on credit. With a loan from Kiva, Alfones will be able to offer cookstoves to more women and offer better credit terms of four monthly installments instead of three.

With a Kiva loan of $4,650, Alfones will receive 300 fuel-efficient cookstoves from Paradigm and will offer its members improved financing terms to purchase a stove. This will make the stoves accessible to even the lowest income women in their customer base.

Help improve the health and financial stability of a rural family in Kenya today!

loans.use: to purchase cookstove products for sale to end users

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She has been an active farmer for 12 years and sells milk, fruits, and vegetables in the local market in Nkubu of Central Kenya.

Evelyn is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 65,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes. This loan will enhance her crops and livestock production and improve her living standard.  The major challenges she faces are pests, diseases, and drought. Evelyn plans to start exporting her products in the foreseeable future.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna, es casada tiene un hijo varón de 16 años de edad, que va a la escuela, ella ha podido con los gastos del colegio y del hogar gracias a su pequeña pulpería a la que le dedica todo el día y parte de la noche, este crédito que solicita es para invertir con mas productos al negocio como granos básicos, gaseosas, carnes variadas, lácteos, para tener siempre productos que ofrecerle a la clientela, así seguir ayudando más a su hijo para su desarrollo escolar, siempre contando con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja como albañil.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and has a son, 16, who attends school.  She has been able to cover the school and household expenses thanks to her small grocery store where she works all day and part of the evening.

This loan she's requesting is to invest in more products for the business, such as dry grains, soda, a variety of meats, and dairy products so she always has fresh products to sell to her customers.  This way she'll continue helping her son with his academic development.

She always has the help of her husband, who works as a bricklayer.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, soda, meat, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Edgar Yovany

texts.es: Edgar es un joven de 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Barrio San Antonio, Sololá junto a sus padres. El actualmente trabaja en la prestación del servicio de transporte de productos de Sololá hacia distintos puntos del mismo departamento, con ello genera ingresos aceptables que le ayudan a aportar a la economía de su familia. El tiene 5 años de estar realizando esta actividad,  la cual la  aprendió de su padre quien se dedicaba a lo mismo. Con el paso del tiempo el ha comprado su propio vehículo para llevar a cabo este trabajo; El solicita un préstamo de Q, 10,000.00 como complemento para la compra de un vehículo en mejores condiciones para prestar un  servicio de mayor calidad a sus clientes y a la población en general. Su sueño es construir una casa propia para vivir.
texts.en: Edgar is a 22-year-old, single man living in the San Antonio neighborhood in Sololá with his parents.  He currently works providing goods transportation services from Sololá to other points within the department.  He earns acceptable income this way that allows him to contribute to his family’s economy.   He’s been doing this work for five years having learned from his father who did the same thing.  As time has passed, he’s bought his own vehicle to carry out this work.  He’s asking for a 10,000 Quetzal loan to add to what he has to buy a vehicle in better condition to provide better quality service to his customers and to the general population.  His dream is to build a house of his own to live in.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle in better condition.

loans.name: Yamilet Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yamilet a sus 49 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 18 años a la venta de mecatos de manera ambulante, debido a la difícil situación económica que padecen y que hoy es más complejo debido al estado de salud de su cónyuge. Padece de cáncer, por lo cual requiere cuidados especiales y los gastos han aumentado. Con seis hijos por los cuales velar, esta mujer es digna de admiración y respeto, pues las circunstancias no la han  hecho retroceder y tiene claro que con esfuerzo es posible sacar a su familia adelante. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido y la reparación de su carro en donde transporta sus productos.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida  de su familia y olvidarse de las necesidades económicas.
texts.en: At the age of 49, Yamilet has been working for 18 years selling snacks from place to place because of the difficult economic situation she’s in that’s even more difficult now because of her spouse’s state of health.  He has cancer and needs specialized care and expenses have increased.  With six children to care for, this woman deserves admiration and respect because despite her circumstances she’s not retreated and she’s clear that with effort it’s possible to move her family forward.  Today, she’s asking for a loan to buy an assortment of snacks and to repair the cart she uses to transport her goods.  Her greatest wish is to improve her family’s quality of life and forget economic needs.

loans.use: to buy snacks and to repair her sales cart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials and vegetable seeds to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas is a single 23-year-old who supports two of his siblings. The owner of a retail shop for two years, he earns an income of KES. 10,000 each month.

Dismas will use his first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD to purchase stocks of salt, sugar, tea leaves, etc. for his shop. He will use the resulting additional profits to repay the loan and reinvest in the business.

Dimas dreams of prospering in business and having a family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, tea leaves, salt, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 42 years old and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single, with four children between 21 and 28 years old. Only one lives at home. 

Sarah has been selling fish for the past 28 years. She says her main challenge is transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her father and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and what makes her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more fish, to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking mother who has four school-going children. She owns a house without electricity and water. She sells ready-cooked food. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, coconuts and beans for her to prepare the food so that she can satisfy the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, coconuts and beans

loans.name: Maybeh

texts.en:
Maybeh is 37 years old and lives in Montrserrado County which has the highest production of fish on the Liberian market; she is married and has 5 children between 1 to 17, who are in school and live at home and in school. 

For three years now she has been selling charcoal in her community market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned this trade from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Yoemis

texts.es:
Yoemis es una joven emprendedora de 23 años, la cual lucha por sacar adelante de a sus dos hijos menores de edad. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de fritos en una esquina de su casa. Con los ingresos que genera ha logrado sostener su hogar y garantizarles a sus hijos educación. 
Su mayor sueño es poder comprar una vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos, una mesa y un paraguas para protegerse de la lluvia que se ha convertido en su principal problema brindándoles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Yoemis is a young, enterprising, 23-year-old woman who strives to move her two minor children forward.  She currently works selling fried fast-food snacks on her corner.  With income generated she’s been able to support her home and insure her children’s schooling.  Her greatest wish is to be able to buy a house to improve living conditions.

She’s currently asking for a loan to buy ingredients, a table and an umbrella to protect herself from the rain that’s become her main problem and to be able to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy basic food staples, a table and an umbrella.
